"Government spent ₹911 crore on advertisements...₹1,45,000 crore/year on giving tax benefits to its industrialist friends. But can't spend ₹1,500 crore on rail concession," Rahul said. "[BJP] will even bring stars for friends but will make citizens yearn for pennies," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Shining example of women empowerment: Patnaik on Droupadi Murmu
text: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik congratulated Droupadi Murmu on Thursday for her victory in the Presidential elections. "Her journey from a humble beginning to become the First Citizen of the country is...inspiring...Her journey is a shining example of women empowerment," the CM tweeted. "[I] congratulate the daughter of Odisha," he added. President-elect Murmu was born in a tribal family in Odisha.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Oppn unity is bit of chimera: Omar on TMC abstaining from VP poll voting
text: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah on Thursday reacted to TMC's decision to abstain from voting in Vice President elections, saying, "Opposition unity is a bit of a chimera." He added that "ultimately" political parties do what's in their own interest. Furthermore, he said that it's time for National Conference to do what suits it "rather than waste time chasing ghosts".
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: SBSP chief OP Rajbhar, an SP ally, gets 'Y' security from UP govt
text: The Uttar Pradesh government has provided 'Y' category security to Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief Om Prakash Rajbhar. This comes after Rajbhar announced his support for NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu in the presidential election. Last month, Rajbhar had questioned SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's absence from campaigning for the Lok Sabha bypolls to Azamgarh and Rampur seats.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: We can be Vishwa Guru only when Population Control Bill is brought: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Ravi Kishan will introduce a private member's bill on population control in Parliament on Friday. "We can be Vishwa Guru only when the Population Control Bill is brought. [It is] very important to bring the population under control. With the way in which it's rising, we're heading towards an explosion," said the Gorakhpur MP.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Cong-JD(S) coalition govt an outcome of 'selfish politics': K'taka CM
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that the Congress-JD(S) coalition government in the state was the outcome of 'selfish politics'. "We have seen the worst kind of selfish politics in 2018-19 when alliances were formed with everyone, law and order was compromised to retain power," Bommai said. "That is the politics of attaining and retaining power," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: 15-16 Cong MLAs voted for Murmu in Presidential poll: Assam CM
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday claimed that 15-16 Congress MLAs from the state voted for NDA's nominee Droupadi Murmu in the Presidential election. Assam Congress President Bhupen Bora also admitted that there was cross-voting in the Presidential poll. The Congress has 27 MLAs in Assam Legislative Assembly, but three of them have been suspended due to anti-party activities.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Choubey appointed C'garh Panchayat & Rural Development Minister
text: Chhattisgarh government named Ravindra Choubey as the state's Panchayat and Rural Development Minister on Thursday. The 65-year-old has replaced TS Singh Deo, who resigned from the post on July 16. While resigning, he said he was unable to fulfil the targets of the department. He also claimed that funds weren't sanctioned under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana despite his repeated requests.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: BJP wants to tarnish the image of Gandhi family: Adhir Chowdhury
text: After the Enforcement Directorate questioned Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Thursday, party leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury alleged that BJP wants to tarnish the Gandhi family's image. "Will anybody...believe that the party that was in power for 54 years will commit a scam of ₹90 crore that too by...Sonia and Rahul Gandhi whose family members sacrificed their lives," Chowdhury asked.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Why is relief to elderly a 'burden' when MPs get train fare subsidy: Varun
text: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Friday criticised the Centre's decision to remove the concession given to senior citizens in train tickets, calling it "unfortunate". He questioned why the relief to the elderly is considered a "burden" when MPs continue to get subsidy on train fare. Earlier, the Railways Minister had told Parliament that granting concessions "weighs heavily" on the Railways.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: It's our fortune a tribal woman will grace Prez's post: Arjun Munda
text: Union Tribal Affairs Minister Arjun Munda on Friday said that it is our fortune that a tribal woman will grace the post of the country's President. "Years after independence, India and its tribal community are growing with new opportunities," he said. His comment comes after Droupadi Murmu was elected as the 15th President of India.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: MPs walk out of Parliamentary panel meet, say Agnipath discussion denied
text: BSP MP Danish Ali and Congress MPs KC Venugopal and Uttam Kumar Reddy, who are part of Parliamentary Standing Committee on Defence, walked out of the committee's meeting on Friday. Venugopal said they had walked out in protest after committee Chairman Jual Oram refused to hold a discussion on the "controversial" Agnipath scheme despite their repeated requests.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Sonia Gandhi didn't tell ED to end questioning: Jairam Ramesh
text: "The allegations that ED stopped investigation as Sonia Gandhi requested to leave because she is suffering from COVID-19 are baseless," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh clarified after reports stating that Sonia asked ED officials to stop questioning her in the National Herald case surfaced. "The interrogation ended because ED didn't have anything to ask," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: PFI’s political wing SDPI wins 3 municipal seats in MP's Neemuch
text: Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI), a political wing of the Popular Front of India (PFI), has won three municipal seats in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch district. While SDPI's councillor candidates Arbina Bi and Jafar Shah won from wards 10 and 11 of Rampur municipality, defeating BJP candidates, Amna Bi won from ward 14 of Manasa, defeating a Congress candidate.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Election of Murmu bolstered people's trust in democracy: U'khand CM
text: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said election of tribal leader Droupadi Murmu as President of the country has bolstered people's trust in India's Constitution and democracy. "She represents a large section that had always been deprived, backward and at the end of society. That section is rejoicing," he added. Murmu was elected as the 15th President of India on Thursday.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Wished Murmu on behalf of the people of Odisha: Naveen Patnaik
text: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Friday said he spoke to newly-elected President Droupadi Murmu and wished her all the very best on behalf of the people of Odisha. "Entire family of 4.5 crore people of Odisha are proud of her achievement," Patnaik tweeted. President-elect Droupadi Murmu was born in a tribal family in Odisha.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Truth will prevail over 'arrogance & dictatorship': Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at the Central government on Thursday over its unwillingness to discuss issues like inflation and misuse of agencies, asserting that "the truth will prevail over dictatorship". His attack came on the day Congress president Sonia Gandhi appeared before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning in the National Herald money laundering case.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Earned enough for 3-4 generations in Nehru, Indira, Sonia's name: Cong leader
text: Karnataka Congress MLA KR Ramesh Kumar said Congress leader Sonia Gandhi should be morally relieved. "Only then two meals we eat will be worthwhile. We have earned enough for next three-four generations in the name of Nehru, Indira and Sonia Gandhi. If we are not prepared for...small sacrifice today...rice we eat will rot and have worms in future," he added.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Hang killers of Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal: LS member
text: Speaking in the Parliament, Lok Sabha member Arjun Lal Meena called for the hanging of the killers of Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal. He said capital punishment would prove to be a deterrent for those who plan to destabilise peace in Udaipur. He also called for a ban on activities of Dawat-e-Islami, a Pakistan-based organisation allegedly linked to the incident.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: If BJP has courage, let ED put cameras while questioning Sonia: Baghel
text: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said that if the Bharatiya Janata Party has courage, they should let the Enforcement Directorate to put cameras at the place where Congress leader Sonia Gandhi is being questioned in the National Herald case. "Do you have that kind of courage? The country wants to know where scam has taken place," Baghel added.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Video shows Ajoy asking to be 'detained' after Cong protests, he replies
text: A video of Congress leader Ajoy Kumar asking to be taken inside the police bus which was carrying detained Congress leaders after Thursday's protests has gone viral. The video showed Kumar saying, "You need to take me yaar...Humko bhi ghusne do." He later tweeted, "The bus was full...Had it been a demonstration of the RSS-BJP, the bus would've remained empty."
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: BJP govt misusing central agencies, democracy is in danger: Gehlot
text: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot slammed the central government for misusing central agencies, like the Enforcement Directorate, and said that democracy is in danger, ahead of Congress interim president Sonia Gandhi's appearance before the agency. "Our fight is to save the nation. Today, if they (BJP) would have been in our place, they would have indulged in arson," said Gehlot.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Droupadi Murmu leading with 540 votes in Presidential poll after 1st round of counting
text: NDA's Droupadi Murmu is leading with 540 votes in Presidential election after the 1st round of counting, PC Mody, Secretary General, Rajya Sabha, said. He added that Opposition's Yashwant Sinha has secured 208 votes with a value of 1,45,600. Results of the Presidential election are expected around 4 pm.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Trinamool Congress to abstain from voting in Vice Presidential election
text: The Trinamool Congress headed by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee will abstain from voting in the upcoming Vice Presidential poll, party MP Abhishek Banerjee said on Thursday. He said the party will not support NDA candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar, who was the Governor of West Bengal. The Opposition has fielded Margaret Alva in the election.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: UP minister Dinesh Khatik meets CM after resigning, says 'will continue in office'
text: A day after resigning as the Uttar Pradesh Minister of State for Jal Shakti, Dinesh Khatik on Thursday met CM Yogi Adityanath and said he'll continue in the post. "Whatever my issues were, I've put them before the CM. Action will be taken," he said. Khatik had alleged that he was being ignored by officials as he is a Dalit.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Congress workers burn car near B'luru ED office during protest
text: Congress workers protesting against Enforcement Directorate (ED) summons to party chief Sonia Gandhi on Thursday burnt a car near the agency's Bengaluru office. Congress workers are protesting across the country against ED questioning Sonia in the National Herald case. She left the ED office in Delhi after being questioned for nearly two hours on Thursday.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Kejriwal ignores LG's advice, says 'will go ahead' with Singapore visit
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal wrote a letter to Delhi LG VK Saxena, saying he'll "go ahead" and attend World Cities Summit in Singapore. Earlier, Saxena advised Kejriwal to not attend the summit, saying prima facie it's meant for Mayors. "Then the Prime Minister wouldn't be able to go anywhere...[In] most of his visits, he...discusses subjects [outside his jurisdiction]," Kejriwal said.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: ED should have gone to Sonia Gandhi's house for investigation: Raj CM Gehlot
text: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has criticised the Enforcement Directorate for asking Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi to appear in its Delhi office for questioning in connection with the National Herald case. "The kind of personality and aura she has and since she is more than 70 years old, ED should have gone to her house for investigation," Gehlot said.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Govt’s aim is 'character assassination': Pilot on Sonia's ED questioning
text: Criticising the Centre over Congress chief Sonia Gandhi's questioning by the ED, party leader Sachin Pilot on Thursday said that the BJP government's sole aim is to indulge in the "character assassination" of people. "This questioning has been initiated to damage the morale of the leadership, target the Opposition and trample upon the voice of the Opposition," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: It's duragrah not satyagrah: BJP MP Prasad on Congress' protests
text: Commenting on the protests held by Congress over Sonia Gandhi's appearance before the Enforcement Directorate (ED), BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "This is not satyagrah but duragrah against the country, its laws and its agencies." "This is also a duragrah for protecting the family which has pocketed the party's assets worth thousands of crores of rupees," the MP added.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: GST imposed on puffed rice, curd, what will people eat?: Mamata in Kolkata
text: Addressing a rally on TMC's Martyrs' Day in West Bengal's Kolkata, CM Mamata Banerjee criticised BJP for the current rise in GST rates and said, "Now that GST has been imposed on puffed rice as well, so will the people of BJP not eat that now." "GST is levied on sweets, lassi, and curd. What will people eat?" she added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP leader shares Maha Cong chief's video with woman, he reacts
text: BJP leader Chitra Wagh tweeted a video purportedly showing Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole with a woman. "I'm not peeping into anyone's personal life. The video has already gone viral," she told reporters. Calling it a "character assassination" attempt by the BJP, Patole said he has asked his legal team to examine the video and take appropriate action against Wagh.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Uddhav not a face for 2024 Lok Sabha polls: Rebel Shiv Sena MP Shewale
text: Uddhav Thackeray was not a "winnable" face for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections and it was imperative for Shiv Sena to tie up with the BJP, said rebel Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale on Thursday. "I told (Sanjay Raut) that we respect Thackeray but we have to be realistic. He cannot be the face for Lok Sabha polls," Shewale added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BJP will be defeated in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: WB CM Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said the BJP will be "swept away from power" at the Centre in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. Terming BJP government as "anti-people", Banerjee said, "BJP will not get a single-party majority, and once that happens, others will unite to form the next government." "They will be defeated," she added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: If Sonia doesn't call off protests, we won't consider her Indian: Uma
text: Reacting to protests over Enforcement Directorate's summons to Congress' Sonia Gandhi in National Herald case, BJP's Uma Bharti said it'll be determined if Gandhi's an Indian citizen if she stops the protests. "Otherwise we won't...forget that she's of Italian origin and doesn't respect Indian law," Bharti tweeted. Seventy-five Congress MPs were detained today for protesting over Gandhi's summons.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Woman who accused Rajasthan minister's son of rape moves Delhi HC
text: A woman who accused Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi's son of raping her multiple times moved Delhi HC on Thursday seeking cancellation of anticipatory bail granted to the man by trial court. The woman in her petition stated that the accused, Rohit, has been threatening her to withdraw her complaint since being out on bail. She filed the complaint in May.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: ED should've questioned Sonia Gandhi at her residence: Yashwant Sinha
text: Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha said Enforcement Directorate (ED) should've gone to Congress leader Sonia Gandhi's residence to question her in the National Herald case. He also accused ED of humiliating political leaders. "We condemn this and resolve to continue and intensify our collective fight against...policies of Modi Sarkar," a joint statement by Opposition parties read.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Doors of Matoshree open for those who want to return: Aaditya to Shinde camp
text: Shiv Sena MLA Aaditya Thackeray on Thursday said that real Shiv Sainiks are still with the party led by Uddhav Thackeray. Referring to MLAs who joined Eknath Shinde-led government, he added that the doors of Matoshree are going to remain open for those who want to return. The ones we trusted and offered ministerial posts, backstabbed us, he further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Samajwadi Party intimidates Muslims for votes: SBSP chief
text: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief Om Prakash Rajbhar on Thursday criticised his alliance partner Samajwadi Party over its treatment of Muslims. "The Samajwadi Party (SP) gets votes of Muslims by intimidating them but when the time comes to give the Muslim community their rights, the party turns its back on them," Om Prakash Rajbhar said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Break BJP's prison, bring people's government in 2024: WB CM Mamata
text: While addressing a rally in Kolkata, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday urged the people to break BJP's prison and elect a people's government in the 2024 elections. "What will the people eat when the BJP is implementing GST on everything, even puffed rice and milk powder. How will the poor survive in this country?" she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Summit is for Mayors: Delhi LG as he denies CM's plea for Singapore visit
text: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) VK Saxena has refused to approve CM Arvind Kejriwal's proposal regarding visiting Singapore to attend the World Cities Summit. The LG advised Kejriwal to not attend the summit since it is a conference of Mayors and won't be befitting for a CM to attend it, ANI reported. The summit is set to commence on July 31.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Wrong to summon 2 members of same family again & again: Cong leader
text: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED in connection with the National Herald case on Thursday, party leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said it is wrong to summon two members of the same family over and over again, that too in connection with the same case. The agency earlier questioned Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with the case.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP is blinded by their desire for revenge: Baghel on Sonia's ED questioning
text: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED on Thursday, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said the BJP is "blinded by their desire for revenge". "This is the same woman who was married to [former] PM Rajiv Gandhi," Baghel added. "Sonia Gandhi has not been well, of late, and yet the BJP is after her," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Shiv Sena leader backing Uddhav Thackeray attacked in Maha, 2 held
text: Police on Thursday arrested two people in connection with the attack on a worker of the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena in Maharashtra, an official said. Harshawardhan Palande, Deputy Chief of the Sena's Kalyan city unit, was attacked by four to five men with sticks and rods on Wednesday, a police official said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: PM, Shah will have to take many births to understand Gandhi family: Khera
text: Congress leader Pawan Khera on Thursday said PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah will have to "take many births to understand what Gandhi family and Congress party are". His statement came ahead of Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi's questioning by ED. "We'll not hold back, we're not among those who sit at home in fear," Khera added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 300 units of free electricity in Gujarat if AAP wins: Kejriwal
text: In the run up to Gujarat Assembly elections, Aam Aadmi Party national convener Arvind Kejriwal has promised free electricity up to 300 units per month if elected. Speaking at a town hall meeting in Surat, Kejriwal said AAP will waive off pending power bills till December 31, 2021. This will be implemented within three months of being elected, he said.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: 'Revadi' is called 'prasad' when distributed to public for free: Kejriwal
text: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal responded to BJP's "revadi culture" remark and said, "When 'revadi' is distributed among public for free, then it's called 'prasad'." "But when [revadi] is given for free to your own friends, ministers, then it is 'paap' (sin)," he added. His statement comes after BJP said that "revadi culture" may push Gujarat towards Sri Lanka-like crisis.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: TMC will win seats outside WB in 2024 LS polls: Abhishek Banerjee
text: TMC National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee on Thursday asserted that the party will continue with its expansion plans and will win seats outside West Bengal in 2024 Lok Sabha elections. He further said that tickets for next year's panchayat elections will be distributed on the basis of "merit and not recommendations". Banerjee was addressing workers at the Martyrs' Day rally.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: If Gandhi family is spotless, why is it anxious?: Anurag Thakur
text: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday said that it’s the duty of probe agencies to investigate people involved in corruption. "If the Gandhi family is spotless, why is it anxious? If they have not indulged in corruption then why this ruckus," Thakur added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Hand over AIADMK headquarter keys to EPS: Madras HC to Tamil Nadu govt
text: The Madras High Court on Wednesday asked the Tamil Nadu government to hand over keys of AIADMK headquarters to Interim General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami, also known as EPS. The court asked AIADMK cadres not to enter the office for one month to prevent untoward incidents. The office was sealed after a clash between supporters of EPS and O Panneerselvam.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: UP Minister Dinesh Khatik resigns, says 'was sidelined because I am a Dalit'
text: Uttar Pradesh Minister of State for Jal Shakti Dinesh Khatik on Wednesday resigned from his post alleging that he was sidelined because he is a Dalit. He sent his resignation letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah instead of CM Yogi Adityanath. "My working as a minister of state is... waste for the Dalit community," Khatik said in the letter.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Sonia Gandhi appears before ED in National Herald case
text: Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi has reached the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office to appear for questioning in connection with the National Herald case. Priyanka Gandhi Vadra accompanied her mother to the office due to the leader's ill health, according to reports. The agency earlier questioned Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with the case.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Sachin Pilot, Tharoor detained amid Congress protests over ED's questioning of Sonia
text: Amid protests by Congress, senior leaders including Sachin Pilot, Shashi Tharoor, Ashok Gehlot, Pawan Khera, Harish Rawat and others were detained by police. "We're being taken by police to an unknown destination. Two other police buses full of MPs are there," Tharoor tweeted. Congress workers are protesting against ED's questioning of Sonia Gandhi in connection with the National Herald case.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Being taken to unknown place: Tharoor after senior Congress leaders detained amid protest
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has released a video statement from Delhi Police Bus after senior Congress leaders, including Sachin Pilot, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, were detained amid protests against ED's summon to Sonia Gandhi. "We are being taken by the police to an unknown destination. Two other police buses full of MPs and other party colleagues are there," he said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 13 Opposition parties issue statement over Centre's 'political vendetta'
text: As many as 13 Opposition parties attended a meeting on Thursday, chaired by the Congress, to discuss the Centre's "relentless political vendetta" through misuse of investigative agencies to target political opponents. This comes ahead of Sonia Gandhi's appearance before ED in Delhi in a money laundering case. "We will intensify our fight against the anti-people Modi sarkar," the Opposition said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Tharoor shares WhatsApp forward on GST on 'Paneer Butter Masala' after hike
text: As 'Paneer Butter Masala' trended on social media amid controversy over 5% GST on packaged daily use food items, MP Shashi Tharoor shared a WhatsApp forward saying, "This one skewers the folly of the GST as few jokes have!" The Centre has recently imposed 5% GST on daily-use food items, including curd, wheat, pulses, only if they are packed.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: BJP distributes sweets when child is born at someone else's home: Kamal Nath
text: Congress leader Kamal Nath alleged that the BJP "blatantly used police, admin and money" to win in the Madhya Pradesh (MP) municipal elections. Reacting to BJP's celebration after MP municipal poll results, Nath said, "BJP lost seven corporations. If they want to celebrate there is no problem. A child is born at someone else's home and BJP starts distributing sweets."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Cong not letting DK Shivakumar function as KPCC President: K'taka CM
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday criticised Congress and said the party is not letting DK Shivakumar function as KPCC President. "Shivakumar has been nursing the dream of becoming the CM...We've been watching what is happening in Congress," Bommai said. This comes after DK Shivakumar on Tuesday said Congress coming to power was more important than him becoming the CM.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Be fair: AAP MP urges Centre to give representation to Punjab in MSP panel
text: AAP MP Vikramjit Singh Sahney on Wednesday urged the Centre to "be fair" and include representatives from Punjab in the committee constituted on the minimum support price (MSP) along with the Commission for Agricultural Costs & Prices (CACP). Avoiding a dialogue with representatives of Punjab will not serve the purpose, Sahney said.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Is Sonia a super human being?: Pralhad Joshi on Congress' protest
text: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi reacted to Congress MPs' protest against questioning of Sonia Gandhi by the Enforcement Directorate and said, "Everybody is equal before the law or not?" "Is the Congress President a super human being? [Congress] thinks they are above the law", he said in Lok Sabha. The House was adjourned till 11:30 am due to the protest.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: When PM Modi was questioned, did we protest?: Prasad on Congress’ protests
text: BJP’s Ravi Shankar Prasad reacted to Congress’ protests ahead of Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi’s ED questioning on Thursday. “When PM Modi was Gujarat CM, he faced questioning…Did we protest? [PM] Modiji appeared before agencies,” Prasad added. Sonia Gandhi has been summoned by ED in connection with the National Herald case.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: MVA govt didn't implement schemes for minorities properly: Maha SP
text: The Maharashtra unit of Samajwadi Party on Wednesday criticised the previous Maha Vikas Aghadi government and said it failed to implement important schemes of the minority ministry properly. "We've evaluated the performance of...schemes...being run by the state Minority Department," SP MLA Rais Shaikh said. "In nearly 19 of them, the utilisation of funds is less than 50%," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: 'Revadi culture' may push Gujarat towards Sri Lanka-like crisis: BJP
text: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil warned the public to not get misguided by "revadi culture" of freebies as it could push the state and country into a Sri Lanka-like crisis. Paatil's statement comes after  AAP's national convener Arvind Kejriwal promised free electricity to people if the party is voted to power in Gujarat after this year's Assembly elections.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: PM Modi meets PT Usha after she takes oath in Parliament, shares pic
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met renowned former athlete PT Usha in Parliament after the latter took oath as Rajya Sabha MP on Wednesday. The Prime Minister shared a picture of him standing beside Usha on Twitter. He tweeted, "Glad to have met PT Usha ji in Parliament." Usha, 58, has won 18 gold medals for India at several international events.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Maha CM Eknath Shinde stakes claim over Shiv Sena, sends letter to EC
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday night approached the Election Commission of India (ECI), staking claim over the Shiv Sena. CM Shinde on Tuesday said Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has recognised rebel Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale as the party's floor leader in the Lower House of Parliament. Sanjay Raut on Tuesday called Shinde's faction "snakes".
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Uniting Oppn most crucial thing at the moment: Margaret Alva
text: Opposition’s Vice President candidate Margaret Alva said she feels that uniting the Opposition is the most crucial thing at the moment. "It’s not a question of winning or losing, it’s a question of responding to a challenge before the nation," she added. "There will be various steps which bring them together, I think this is one of those," Alva stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Tripura CM Manik Saha tests positive for COVID-19
text: Tripura Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha on Wednesday said that he has tested positive for COVID-19. "I'm absolutely fit and fine with no symptoms. I humbly request all those who've come in contact with me to take necessary precautions," the CM wrote in a Facebook post. Earlier in the day, he inaugurated an oxygen plant at IGM Hospital in Agartala.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: BJP workers hold protest after girls told to remove bras at NEET centre
text: A protest was held on Wednesday outside the NEET exam centre where female students had allegedly been told to take off their bras before taking the exam. Protesters, purportedly belonging to Kerala BJP, were seen carrying BJP flags outside Mar Thoma Institute of Information Technology. Earlier, a student's parent filed a complaint about the removal of innerwear with Kollam SP.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: I strongly condemn ED's attitude to humiliate political leaders: Sinha
text: Ahead of Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi’s ED questioning, Opposition’s Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha said he strongly condemns the attitude of ED to "humiliate political leaders". "The officers of ED should've gone to her residence even if they had questions to ask [from] Sonia Gandhi," Sinha tweeted. Congress had announced that it will hold a nationwide protest on July 21.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP govt in UP invoking NSA even in trivial cases: BSP chief
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Wednesday said the BJP government in Uttar Pradesh was invoking National Security Act (NSA) even in trivial cases, in order to cover up its failure to control crime. "Criminals associated with the ruling party are roaming freely," Mayawati said. "In such a situation, how can rule of law be established in the state?" she added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: TRS workers protest against GST on packaged milk, dairy products
text: Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) leaders and workers took to the streets across the state on Wednesday to protest against the Centre's decision to impose Goods and Services Tax (GST) on packaged milk and dairy products. "The party condemns the anti-people policies of the Centre and will continue to resist till a rollback is announced," TRS MLA Danam Nagender said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Oppn wants limelight by staging protests, doesn’t want discussion: BJP leader
text: As monsoon session of Parliament is underway, BJP’s Sanjay Jaiswal said that the Opposition does not want any discussion in Parliament. “They just want to get the limelight by staging protests,” he added. His statement came as a response to the question, “How do you view the protests and disruption of proceedings that have taken place?” The Indian Express stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Expected high-handedness: Cong’s Jairam ahead of Sonia Gandhi’s ED questioning
text: As Congress has planned to launch a nationwide protest on Thursday as party’s interim President Sonia Gandhi is scheduled to appear before ED, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said Delhi Police is preventing the media from entering Congress party headquarters. "This high-handedness was only to be expected and reflects the mindset of the [PM] Modi Sarkar," Ramesh tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Counting of votes for the Presidential poll 2022 begins
text: The counting of votes for the 2022 Presidential election began in the Parliament House on Thursday morning. The ballot boxes from all the states have reportedly arrived at the Parliament House and the counting is taking place in room number 63. The voting for the poll took place on Monday where MPs and MLAs across the country cast their votes.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: It was not Pawar, but Sanjay Raut who broke Shiv Sena: Athawale
text: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale said it was not Sharad Pawar, but Sanjay Raut who caused a split in Shiv Sena. "Uddhav Thackeray decided to go with Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) at the behest of Sanjay Raut," Athawale added. He further said that BJP and Shiv Sena would have formed government in Maharashtra had Shiv Sena and NCP not come together.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Cong showing destructive attitude towards democracy: Union Minister
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Wednesday criticised Congress for disrupting proceedings in the Parliament. He added that the government is not running away from debate on price rise and such issues can be taken up once Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman recovers from COVID-19. He alleged there was a competition among Opposition parties on who would disrupt Parliament the most.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: No disqualification of MLAs yet, issue may require a 5-judge bench: SC on Shiv Sena crisis
text: Supreme Court on Wednesday said that the issues involved in the petitions over the Shiv Sena crisis might require to be referred to a five-judge bench for consideration. The Speaker will maintain the status quo and not decide on any disqualification of rebel MLAs, SC added. It also directed the Legislative Assembly secretary to keep all records in safe custody.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: FM will reply to Opposition's questions once she recovers from COVID: BJP's Joshi
text: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said that the central government is ready for discussion on inflation in Parliament. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is down with COVID and she will reply to questions once she recovers and when Business Advisory Committee decides and both chairs give permission. His statements come after Congress claimed that government is not allowing discussion on GST rates.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Onus on govt to ensure smooth functioning of House: Congress leader
text: As the Opposition has been protesting against inflation, price rise and other issues, Congress leader Shaktisinh Gohil said the onus is on government to ensure smooth functioning of the House. "When BJP was in Opposition, late Arun Jaitley and their other leaders used to say that it was the responsibility of the government…So, the onus is on government," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cruel to raise tax rates when CPI inflation is over 7%: Jairam Ramesh
text: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said that it is cruel to raise tax rates when CPI inflation is over 7%. "It is cruel…WPI inflation is over 15%, unemployment is high, the rupee is depreciating, the current account deficit is widening and inflation is expected to rise worldwide," he stated in a thread of tweets.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: This shows his arrogance: Cong MP on Assam CM's 'tricolour' remark
text: Reacting to Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma’s remark where he asked residents to hoist tricolour at homes to prove they're "genuine children" of 'Bharat Mata', Congress' Manickam Tagore said this shows Sarma's arrogance. "It should be the RSS that must be asked to put tricolour...because, for 52 long years, they didn't put Tiranga at their offices," Tagore added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Sanjay Raut quotes Premchand, says betrayal is easiest way out
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Wednesday tweeted a picture of him holding hands with Uddhav Thackeray, and added a couple of lines of Premchand, which says that betrayal is the easiest way out. Raut on Tuesday launched a veiled attack on Twitter at Shinde's faction and said, "Do not leave the forest because of the fear of snakes."
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Constructive opposition always welcome in Parliament: Pralhad Joshi
text: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said, "Constructive opposition always welcome in Parliament," in response to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's remark calling the Parliament 'unparliamentary'. Joshi tweeted, "There is no restriction on raising public issues in the Parliament, it was in 1975." Earlier today, the Parliament was adjourned as Opposition MPs raised slogans over inflation issues.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Rahul always disrespected Parliamentary proceedings: Smriti Irani
text: BJP MP Smriti Irani criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi by saying that he is adamant to bring down the productivity of Lok Sabha. Referring to Rahul Gandhi, she said, "The person who's been politically unproductive is dedicating himself to ensure there's no debate in Parliament." Rahul's entire political history has been dotted with showing disrespect to Parliamentary procedure, she added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Electoral offences committed by Prez candidate Murmu: Congress to EC
text: The Congress party has alleged violation of provisions of the law by NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu in the July 18 election and has filed a complaint with the Election Commission (EC) regarding it. The Karnataka Congress claimed that the BJP "bribed and exerted undue influence" on its MLAs on July 17 and 18 asking them to vote for Murmu.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Why was she deployed on night duty?: J’khand BJP MP on sub-inspector’s death
text: Following a female sub-inspector, Sandhya Topno's death after being mowed down by a vehicle in Jharkhand, state BJP MP Sanjay Seth said the law and order has collapsed in the state. "It is a matter of investigation why Sandhya Topno was deployed on night duty. I will raise the issue...in Parliament today," Seth said on Wednesday.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Parliament's functioning affected due to Modi govt's obstinacy: Congress
text: The Congress on Wednesday alleged that the PM Narendra Modi-led government is not allowing a discussion in Parliament on the issue of hike in GST on food items. "Government's obstinacy to not permit a debate on the matter has affected Parliament's functioning," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said. The Modi government is blocking desire of poor and middle class, he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: 4 arrested for offering Maha BJP MLA a ministerial post for ₹100 cr
text: Mumbai Police have arrested four men for allegedly offering Rahul Kul, BJP MLA from Maharashtra's Daund, a ministerial post for ₹100 crore. Kul met one of the accused in South Mumbai where he bargained to reduce the offer to ₹90 crore. Mumbai Police's Anti Extortion Cell had laid a trap to arrest the accused before their second meeting with Kul.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Inclination towards radical ideologies in India minuscule: Govt
text: The government said that some foreign agencies inimical to India along with global terrorist groups have been making efforts to radicalise people but “inclination towards radical ideologies is minuscule”, compared to India's population. "Radicalisation by global terrorist groups like ISIS, al-Qaeda etc. is one of the most challenging problems faced by countries," MoS Home Nityanand Rai said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Resigning only way when not respected: Akhilesh on UP minister's resignation
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav shared his take on the resignation of BJP MLA Dinesh Khatik, who alleged that the Yogi government sidelined him as he is a Dalit. "Where you are not respected as a minister but insulted because you're a Dalit, resigning from such a discriminatory BJP government is the only way," he tweeted in Hindi.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Owaisi accuses Centre of 'politicising' all-party meet on Sri Lanka crisis
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi accused Centre of politicising the all-party meeting on Sri Lanka crisis and by raising "unrelated issues" about finances of Indian states. "Dr S Jaishankar...said that there's a 'misinformed campaign and comparison between India and Sri Lanka'. If so, why did the Department of Economic Affairs have to make a presentation?" he asked in a Twitter thread.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Mann criticises Centre for not giving representation to Punjab in MSP panel
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has criticised Centre for not giving the state a representation in the panel formed on minimum support price (MSP). "Punjab's farmers are...stuck in crop cycle and debt. MSP is our legal right," he said. Besides members of agricultural universities and central government secretaries, the panel also includes chief secretaries of Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Sikkim and Odisha.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Chinese media doesn’t even mention ‘talks’: Chidambaram after 16th round of talks
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Wednesday said that the 16th round of talks between India and China on the "border disputes" ended, as expected, without an agreement. "While Indian media reports 'no breakthrough in talks', Chinese media does not even mention the talks," Chidambaram tweeted. "China has conceded nothing on 'Hot Springs'," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Hoist tricolour at homes to prove you're genuine children of 'Bharat Mata': Assam CM
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma asked all residents to hoist the tricolour between August 13 and 15 at their houses in order to prove that they are "genuine children of Bharat Mata". "Applying for NRC to say that you are Indian citizens is not enough. You have to give proof…Is it or not?" Sarma asked at an event on Tuesday.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Former athlete PT Usha takes oath as Rajya Sabha MP
text: Renowned former Olympic track and field athlete PT Usha took oath as Rajya Sabha MP (Member of Parliament) on Wednesday. The government nominated her to the Upper House of the Parliament along with renowned composer Ilaiyaraaja, screenwriter V Vijayendra Prasad and spiritual leader Veerendra Heggade on July 6. Hailing from Kerala, PT Usha is one of India's most iconic sportspersons.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Public wants Parliament to work: Om Birla on sloganeering by Oppn
text: On the third day of monsoon session of the Parliament on Wednesday, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said the public wants the Parliament to work. His statement came as Lok Sabha was adjourned amid sloganeering by the Opposition MPs today. "I want to tell those members who are indulging in sloganeering that they should take part in discussions," Birla added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Is it unparliamentary to discuss inflation?: Priyanka Gandhi to PM Modi
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Wednesday alleged that PM Narendra Modi is increasing household expenditure while shying away from discussion on it in Parliament. "Is it 'unparliamentary' to discuss inflation?" she tweeted. Priyanka said that the government has increased the burden of inflation by imposing "Grihasthi Satyanash Tax (GST)" (household destruction tax) on grains, jaggery and curd.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri booked for allegedly abusing T'gana CM
text: BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri was booked on Wednesday for allegedly abusing Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao. Arvind, who made the alleged comments at an event in Hyderabad last week, was accused of degrading the CM's image and inciting hate towards the state government in the FIR. Notably, Arvind recently alleged that his convoy was attacked by TRS workers.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Traitors left party but original Sena workers still with us: Aaditya Thackeray
text: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said that "traitors" have left the party but the original workers are still with them. "This rebellion has unmasked their hatred, jealousy and anger against us. The truth is thus coming out," Aaditya added. "It also means everyone of them used to lie when they claimed to have respect towards the Thackeray family," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Video shows TN minister angry as journalist questions him for being late
text: A video showing Tamil Nadu Rural Development Minister KR Periakaruppan furious after a journalist questioned him about arriving late at an event has gone viral. Periakaruppan reportedly was a few hours late. When a journalist confronted him, he said, "Who waited for three hours? Who gave such an interview? Who waited inside?" He then approached the person recording the video.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Satisfy hunger with tadka of jumlas: Rahul on GST on essential items
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi over GST on packaged food items and said that PM will have to take back the move. "Recipe of Gabbar for people struggling with inflation: Make less, eat less, satisfy hunger with the tadka of jumlas," he said. Packaged food weighing less than 25kg will carry 5% GST.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Rebel Sena MP is party's leader in Lok Sabha, says Maha CM Shinde
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has recognised rebel Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale as the party's floor leader in the Lower House of Parliament. "Shiv Sena MPs too have supported us in our stand to uphold ideals of Balasaheb Thackeray," Shinde added, while speaking to mediapersons in Delhi.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Opposition's Vice President candidate Margaret Alva files nomination
text: Opposition's Vice President candidate Margaret Alva filed her nomination papers on Tuesday in the presence of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, NCP chief Sharad Pawar, Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge and several Opposition leaders. Alva will be contesting against NDA's candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar. "It's a tough election...but I'm not afraid," Alva had tweeted earlier.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Tejashwi offered support to protect family from going to jail: Bihar BJP chief
text: Bihar BJP chief Sanjay Jaiswal said RJD's Tejashwi Yadav was ready to support BJP in government formation in Bihar to "protect himself and his family from going to jail". His statement came after Yadav said MoS Home Nityanand Rai had expressed his desire to join RJD. "No matter how much they try, Tejashwi and family will be jailed," Jaiswal added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Government does not maintain data of arrested journalists: MHA
text: Union Minister for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai, on Tuesday, informed in a written reply in Lok Sabha that the NCRB does not maintain any specific data regarding the arrest of journalists. His remarks came after TMC MP Mala Roy had asked about the total number of journalists arrested in the country since 2019, along with the charges against them.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Govt shouldn't give security to those speaking against religion: BJP
text: BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh on Tuesday said that some people make incorrect statements on religion and the country only to get security and urged the government to not give them any protection. He also said that suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma shouldn't get security just because she's a member of the ruling party.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Will help build a strong, united India: Alva after filing nomination
text: Shortly after filing nomination papers for VP elections to be held on August 6, Opposition candidate Margaret Alva said that she will help in building a strong and united India. "I have spent my life fulfilling my commitments, with integrity and courage. Elections don't frighten me - winning and losing is a part of life," she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Funeral procession of Haryana's law & order taken out: Hooda on DSP's killing
text: Congress MP Deepender Singh Hooda reacted to the killing of Tauru DSP Surender Singh in Nuh on Tuesday. "Funeral procession of Haryana's law and order has been taken out," Hooda added. "The state government has completely failed and criminals are roaming around-both mining mafia and organised gangsters. Organised crime has entered Haryana," Hooda stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Udhayakumar elected as Deputy Leader of Opposition in TN Assembly
text: AIADMK has elected MLA RB Udhayakumar as Deputy Leader of the Opposition in Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly. The post was earlier held by former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam, who was expelled from the party earlier this month. Further, MLA SS Krishnamurthy has replaced Manoj Pandian as AIADMK's Deputy Secretary. Earlier, Pandian was expelled from the party for supporting Panneerselvam.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Modi ji made fall of rupee an election issue in 2014: Tharoor
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor criticised PM Narendra Modi-led government by holding them responsible for fall of rupee against US dollar and said, "Rupee has crossed 80. Modi Ji is the one who made it an election issue in 2014." "He was going to strengthen rupee...but then what is this strong government giving us? Even a weaker rupee," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Govt wants to implement TN’s medical check-up scheme across India: State minister
text: Tamil Nadu Health Minister Ma Subramanian on Monday said that seeing the success of Tamil Nadu’s door-to-door medical check-up scheme, the Centre has sought its pattern to implement it across the country. Furthermore, he said, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has asked him to present details of the scheme at the World Economic Forum scheduled in Switzerland in January.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: It was Sharad Pawar who broke Shiv Sena into 2 factions: Ex-Maha MLA
text: Former MLA Ramdas Kadam on Tuesday accused NCP chief Sharad Pawar of breaking Sena into two groups. "He was trying to end it since Balasaheb was there but never found a chance," he said. Sena was "systematically weakened" by Pawar, but Uddhav Thackeray wasn't willing to part ways with Pawar, he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP runs away from caste census but asks for caste from Agniveers: Tejashwi
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has criticised the Centre for allegedly asking for caste certificate during the recruitment of Agniveers.  "The BJP government runs away from the caste-based census but asks for caste from Agniveers," Tejashwi tweeted. "The caste is being asked because the country's largest casteist organisation RSS will later sort out Agniveers on the basis of caste," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Cow urine will be used to make medicines in Chhattisgarh: CM Baghel
text: Soon after the announcement that Chhattisgarh government will purchase cow urine at ₹4 per litre, CM Bhupesh Baghel said that cow urine will be used to make medicines in the state to promote organic farming. "Our government is directly putting money in the pockets of people while Centre is taking money out of the pockets," Baghel added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Committee on MSP constituted by GoI comprises of BJP supporters: Raghav Chadha
text: AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Tuesday said by excluding food bowl of India, Punjab, from the newly constituted MSP committee, BJP has once again shown its "anti-Punjab" stand. "Committee on MSP constituted by GoI comprises of BJP supporters and supporters of the three black laws," Chadha added. "Can they do justice to the cause of farmers?" he tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Mamata's nephew came to vote in Prez polls with convoy of cars: MLA
text: BJP MLA Sudip Mukherjee filed a complaint with Election Commission against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew, Abhishek Banerjee. Mukherjee claimed MP Abhishek brought a convoy of cars inside West Bengal Assembly premises when he came to vote in Presidential polls. According to rules of Presidential elections, MLAs/MPs can enter Assembly only with a car and a driver, Mukherjee said.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Selling public sector banks to chosen few will be disastrous: Jairam Ramesh
text: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh has said that their party will oppose the BJP-led Centre's "Bank Sale Bill". "Today, 53 years ago, banks were nationalised. Now, the Modi government is on a privatisation spree," Ramesh tweeted. "Public sector banks must be equipped to face competition, but selling them off to a chosen few will be disastrous," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Ready to fight over symbol, control of party: Shiv Sena's Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said the party was ready to fight over the symbol and control of the organisation. He added that BJP was trying to break Maharashtra into three pieces. "A few MPs and MLAs may be leaving us. But MLAs and MPs alone do not make up the Shiv Sena," Raut added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Recruitment of Agniveers being done as per Army rules: Anurag Thakur
text: Reacting to Opposition's criticism regarding requirement for Agniveers to provide caste certificate during recruitment under the Agnipath scheme, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that recruitments are done as per Army Rules 1954 and Defence Service Regulation 1987. "Some parties like AAP try to mislead and lie. They tried to mislead youth without knowing the truth," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Govt putting more tax burden on people: Siddaramaiah on GST hike
text: Criticising the Central government over the latest hike of Goods and Services Tax (GST) on various essential food items, Congress leader Siddaramaiah said the government is putting more tax burden on people instead of helping them. "Depriving people of their food is 'Acche Din' for Narendra Modi-led government," Siddaramaiah tweeted. He further termed GST as 'Gabbar Singh Tax'.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: ED has become an extended part of BJP: Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi
text: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi on Monday said the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has become an extended part of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). "Wherever the BJP is in Opposition in a state, action is taken against [leaders of] the ruling party," she added. "However, if [they] come after bathing in the Ganges of the BJP, the action...stops," she further said.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Failure of entire govt machinery: Kejriwal on killing of Haryana DSP
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said the killing of a DSP in Haryana was the result of the failure of the entire government machinery in the state. "How will the public be safe where the police is not safe?" he asked. The DSP investigating illegal stone-mining was killed on Tuesday when a truck drove into him, officials said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Cong coming to power important than me becoming CM: DK Shivakumar
text: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Tuesday said that Congress coming to power is more important than him becoming the Chief Minister of Karnataka. "Only if the Congress party comes to power, the post of Chief Minister will be available," DK Shivakumar said. "The party high command will decide who should be the CM candidate," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Running away from discussion on price rise, GST hike unparliamentary: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the central government over price rise, hike in GST and depreciating value of the rupee. "Running away from discussion and questions in Parliament is most 'unparliamentary', Prime Minister ji," Rahul tweeted in Hindi. The former Congress President was referring to a list of unparliamentary words released by the Lok Sabha Secretariat last week.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Why is Delhi CM so desperate to go to Singapore: BJP to Kejriwal
text: Taking a dig at Arvind Kejriwal's complaint about pending clearance from Centre for his Singapore visit, BJP MP Manoj Tiwari said, "Why's Delhi Chief Minister who doesn't have charge of any department in the government so desperate to go to Singapore?" West Delhi BJP MP Parvesh Singh said, "It's a mayors' summit yet Kejriwal is so desperate to go there."
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Shiv Sena office-bearer attacked by unidentified persons in Nashik
text: A Shiv Sena office-bearer, identified as Nilesh alias Bala Kokane, was attacked with sharp objects by unidentified persons in the MG Road area of Nashik, Maharashtra. Kokane was rushed to a private hospital after being attacked while riding his two-wheeler, police said. The patrolling squads have combed the area to catch the unidentified attackers, police added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Arunachal court rejects bail plea of BJP MLA who is accused of rape
text: A court in Arunachal Pradesh on Monday rejected the anticipatory bail plea of BJP MLA from Koloriang, Lokam Tassar, who is accused of raping a pregnant woman at his residence. State CM Pema Khandu said that BJP will take action against Tassar if the allegations are proven to be true, adding, "No one is above...law." Tassar has been evading arrest.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: No: MoS Rai as MP asks whether terror attacks are rising in India
text: After Lok Sabha MP A Ganeshamurthi asked whether incidents of terror attacks are rising in India, Union Minister of State (MoS) for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai replied, "No, Sir." The MoS said, "The security situation has improved significantly in Jammu and Kashmir...There has been a substantial decline in terrorist attacks from 417 in 2018 to 229 in 2021."
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Uddhav fires Sena leaders for 'anti-party' acts, Maha CM adds them to his faction
text: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday sacked several Shiv Sena leaders, including former state minister Ramdas Kadam and senior party leader Anandrao Vithoba Adsul for anti-party activities. CM Eknath Shinde has reportedly appointed them as leaders of a new 'National Executive Committee'. Shinde also reportedly elected party MLA Deepak Kesarkar as chief spokesperson of the committee.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: 2023 K'taka polls my last, won't contest from Chamundeshwari: Siddaramaiah
text: Congress leader and former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has said that 2023 Assembly elections would be his last. "I'm making it very very clear...I will not contest from Chamundeshwari again," he added. "We will make someone a candidate, ensure that he or she wins, he or she will be a Congress candidate...I will contest from wherever I'm asked to," Siddaramaiah said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: ED questions Satyendar Jain's wife in money laundering case
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday questioned Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's wife, Poonam Jain, in connection with a money laundering case. Earlier, Poonam was summoned by the ED on July 14. This comes months after the ED arrested Satyendar Jain on May 30 in connection with alleged hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: GST is now Gayi Saari Tankhvaah: Akhilesh criticises BJP over GST rates hike
text: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav has criticised the BJP-led Centre over the latest hike in GST rates by coining a new term for it "Gayi Saari Tankhvaah [Gone all salary]". This new term came because of the disappointment with the increased “burden” on the earnings of common citizens due to the hike in GST rates, Yadav said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: When it was time to give relief, we burdened people: Varun on new GST rate
text: BJP MP Varun Gandhi criticised the central government over the latest increase in GST rates and said that when it was time to give people "relief", we are burdening them. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "This decision, taken amid record-breaking unemployment, will further lighten the pockets of middle-class families and especially the struggling youth living in rented houses."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Governor office neither ornamental nor political: Vice President Naidu
text: Outgoing Vice President Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday stated that the office of a Governor is "neither an ornamental position nor a political position". He appealed the Governors to ensure that programs funded by the Centre are properly implemented by the states. Governors' conduct should set an example, a media release from Naidu's office quoted him as saying.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: A farmer's son filed nomination today, grateful to PM Modi: Dhankhar
text: Shortly after filing his nomination, NDA's VP candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar said that a farmer's son filed his nomination and expressed his gratitude to PM Narendra Modi for giving him the opportunity. "Not even in my dreams did I think that a common man like me would be given such an opportunity," Dhankhar said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Poor being maligned with talk of 'revadi culture': Priyanka Gandhi
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Monday criticised PM Narendra Modi, saying that the poor and middle class were being maligned with the talk of "revadi culture", while others were earning indiscriminately. "Earlier, petrol-diesel, cooking gas were made expensive. Today, flour, cereals, and curd have also become expensive," Gandhi said. Electricity will also get expensive soon, she added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP leader Sultana Khan attacked by 2 bike-borne assailants in Mumbai
text: Two bike-borne assailants attacked BJP's minority wing (women) state president Sultana Khan in Mumbai on Sunday night. "Before leaving, the assailants said that this was just a token and that what you're doing is not right. Mend your ways else, we will finish you and your family," Khan's husband said. The accused attacked Khan with a sharp-edged weapon, he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Jagdeep Dhankhar will be an excellent, inspiring VP: PM Modi
text: Shortly after NDA Vice Presidential candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar filed his nomination on Monday, PM Narendra Modi said that he will be an excellent and inspiring VP. JP Nadda said Dhankhar is a "Kisan-Putra" (son of a farmer) who has established himself as a "people's governor". I will always strive to enhance the democratic values of India, Dhankhar said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Presidential polls witness 98.91% turnout at Parliament House
text: The polling for the 16th Presidential election was conducted on Monday commencing at 10 am and closing at 5 pm. As per the Rajya Sabha Secretariat, out of the 736 electors comprising 727 MPs and 9 Legislative Assembly members, 728 electors cast their votes which consists of 719 MPs and 9 MLAs. The total turnout was 98.91% at Parliament House.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: BJP’s nomination of Murmu a 'masterstroke': Congress leader Rathva
text: Senior Gujarat Congress leader Sukhram Rathva on Monday said that fielding Droupadi Murmu, a tribal woman candidate for the post of President, was a "masterstroke" by the BJP.  "I hope that whoever gets elected to the post of President, he or she will implement the provisions of the Constitution," said Rathva.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: I'm not a criminal: Kejriwal over delay in nod for Singapore visit
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that he wasn't a "criminal", stressing that there's a "political reason" behind the delay in granting him permission to visit Singapore for a summit. Kejriwal said he was specially invited to the World Cities Summit in Singapore, where he would present the Delhi model before world leaders and bring laurels to India.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: In veiled attack, Sena's Sanjay Raut calls CM Shinde’s faction 'snakes'
text: Amid reports of Shiv Sena's MPs being in touch with Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde, party leader Sanjay Raut launched a veiled attack on Twitter at Shinde's faction. "Do not leave the forest because of the fear of snakes," he wrote. As per reports, 12 of 18 Shiv Sena's MPs are likely to join CM Shinde's camp.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Not necessary for Bihar farmers to migrate to other states for jobs: Tikait
text: BKU leader Rakesh Tikait has said that the farmers of Bihar should come forward for their rights and raise their voices. "It is not necessary for the farmers of Bihar to migrate to other states for jobs," he added. "If any farmer would get a genuine price for the crops, why would he go to other states?" Tikait asked.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Character assassination: BJP on Tejashwi's 'Nityanand desired to join RJD' remark
text: BJP spokesperson Nikhil Anand reacted to RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav’s statement that MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai had expressed his desire to join RJD. "A dyed-in-the-wool RSS man like Nityanand Rai will prefer death to any association with RJD. His rising stature is causing troubles for Tejashwi Yadav and his family, so they're indulging in character assassination," Anand said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Why is Parliament not debating on Ladakh border crisis?: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Monday asked, "Why is the Parliament not debating [on] the Ladakh border crisis?" "Why are my questions on Ladakh being denied in the Parliament? Why is [PM] Modi scared of truth coming out in the public? What is he hiding?" he added. "Is [PM] Modi going to take the responsibility for this failure?" Owaisi asked.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: PM Modi-led govt's faulty policies reason for inflation: Kharge
text: Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge alleged that PM Narendra Modi-led government's "faulty policies" are the reason behind the rising inflation in the country. Criticising the high food prices and retail inflation, Kharge said it showed "how little the Modi government cares for the poor". He further called the step to hike GST rates as "anti-poor and insensitive".
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Delighted to win civic polls in Gwalior; BJP has crash-landed: Jairam Ramesh
text: After winning the Gwalior Municipal Corporation, Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said, "Nothing has given me greater pleasure than the victory in Gwalior local body polls." "BJP has crash-landed there," Ramesh said. Notably, Gwalior and its nearby districts, including Guna, are considered as the family bastion of the Congress-turned BJP politician Jyotiraditya Scindia.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Droupadi Murmu will win Prez polls by a huge margin: Karnataka CM
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has said that the BJP-led NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu will win the polls by a "huge majority". "There is every possibility of Murmu breaking all previous records in her margin of victory. Murmu is the personification of noble humane values," CM Bommai said. "Murmu has received support from several [non-NDA] parties too," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Goa reports 100% voter turnout in Presidential polls
text: All 40 eligible members of the Goa Legislative Assembly, including CM Pramod Sawant, voted in the Presidential elections on Monday. The polling started at 10 am and all 40 MLAs had voted by 1:50 pm, Secretary of the Goa Legislative Assembly Namrata Ulman said. She added that the polling was conducted smoothly and no complaints or objections were raised.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Before becoming Minister, Nityanand expressed desire to join RJD: Tejashwi
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav claimed that Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai had come with a request to be taken into RJD when he had not become a minister. Tejashwi said this after Rai criticised him for his "murti" remark against NDA Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. Rai had "no moral courage" to react, Tejashwi said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Rahul Gandhi joins Oppn's protest on inflation on 2nd day of monsoon session
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday joined the Opposition’s protest over the issues of inflation and price rise, at the Parliament. The monsoon session of the Parliament began on Monday. "We will fight it tomorrow...We have appealed to all parties to fight against price rise and GST hike," Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said on Monday.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: In a first, Cong fought Gwalior civic polls without Scindia and won: Digvijaya
text: Former Madhya Pradesh CM Digvijaya Singh has commented on Congress winning the Gwalior Municipal Corporation on Sunday. "For the first time, Congress fought the Gwalior local body polls without [Congress-turned BJP leader] Jyotiraditya Scindia and won it," Digvijaya said. He added, "This win should be noted by political observers." Notably, Scindia belongs to the Gwalior-based royal family.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Not going to be scared of anyone: Oppn's VP candidate Margaret Alva
text: Margaret Alva, the Opposition’s candidate for Vice President elections, on Monday said in politics, winning or losing is not the issue, fighting the battle is. "I will file the nomination tomorrow and will fight their (NDA's) campaign…I am not going to be scared of anyone," she added. Jagdeep Dhankhar, BJP-led NDA’s nominee for Vice President, filed nomination papers on Monday.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Tamil Nadu CM gets discharged from hospital, votes in Presidential poll
text: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin was discharged from Chennai's Kauvery Hospital on Monday after recovering from COVID-19 and went directly to the Secretariat complex to cast his vote in the Presidential poll. The ruling DMK and its allies are backing Opposition choice former Union Minister Yashwant Sinha. AIADMK is supporting Droupadi Murmu who is the nominee fielded by BJP.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: Margaret Alva is a better VP candidate than Dhankhar: Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge has said that the Opposition candidate, Margaret Alva, for the Vice-President elections is a better one than the NDA candidate, Jagdeep Dhankhar. "Our candidate is from the minority and is better than their candidate. If they will support our candidate [Margaret Alva], then it will be a unanimous poll," Kharge said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Congress candidate dies of heart attack after losing municipal council polls in MP
text: A Congress candidate died due to a heart attack after he lost the municipal council election in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa on Sunday. The candidate, Harinarayan Gupta, had contested the elections from ward number nine in the Hanumana area. Independent candidate Akhilesh Gupta defeated him by 14 votes. Harinarayan was also the mandal president of the Congress unit in Hanumana.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: BJP wins 7 seats, Congress wins 3 & AAP 1 in Madhya Pradesh mayoral polls
text: BJP has won mayoral seats in Burhanpur, Satna, Ujjain, Khandwa, Sagar, Bhopal and Indore, while the Congress won in Chhindwara, Jabalpur and Gwalior. AAP's Rani Agrawal has won the mayoral post in Singrauli in the party's civic poll debut in the state. As many as 11 municipal corporations went to the polls in the first phase on July 6.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Supreme Court bench headed by CJI to hear pleas on Maha crisis on July 20
text: A Supreme Court bench headed by Chief Justice NV Ramana will on July 20 hear a batch of petitions related to the recent political crisis in Maharashtra. Both Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena and the faction led by CM Eknath Shinde have moved the court over the disqualification of MLAs. Meanwhile, Sanjay Raut demanded the imposition of President's rule in Maharashtra.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Shiv Sena doesn't see Prez polls as any political election: Aaditya
text: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said that his party believes that Presidential polls are different from any political election. Stating that the party is supporting Droupadi Murmu in the ongoing Presidential polls, he added, "It's the highest post and votes should be cast for a suitable candidate." Earlier, he had said that Murmu is a tribal and we support tribals.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: AIUDF to support Yashwant Sinha in upcoming Presidential elections
text: The All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) on Sunday said that it will vote for the Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha in upcoming elections. AIUDF leader Aminul Islam said that the party will back Sinha even as it was "sidelined" during Sinha's recent visit to Assam to seek support for his candidature. Presidential elections will be held on July 18.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Impose Prez rule in Maharashtra till SC order on rebel MPs: Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has demanded the imposition of the President's rule in Maharashtra till the constitution bench of the Supreme Court gives its verdict on the plea seeking disqualification of rebel MLAs. "Maharashtra's 12-crore population has a cabinet of 2 members that is taking arbitrary decisions. Where is the regard for the constitution?" he tweeted.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Want President who looks into misuse of constitutional institutions: Tejashwi
text: As voting for Presidential poll is underway, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Monday said there is a "threat" to democracy. "In this country, there's a state of anarchy…The misuse of constitutional institutions is rampant. We would want a President who looks into it," he added. "Our PM doesn't even discuss the issues facing the youth or the farmers," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign aims to take patriotism into hearts of people: Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday interacted with CMs of all states/UTs to discuss the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign under the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, an official statement said. "It’s a programme to take the spirit of patriotism to the highest level into the hearts and minds of the people," Shah said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: There should be dialogue in Parliament with open mind: PM Modi
text: Ahead of monsoon session, PM Narendra Modi on Monday said there should be a dialogue in Parliament with an open mind. "If necessary, there should be debate. I urge all MPs to contemplate deeply and discuss," PM Modi added. "This session is also important because elections for office of President and Vice President are taking place right now," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Yashwant called Mulayam an ISI agent, can't support him: Shivpal
text: Amid ongoing voting for Presidential polls, Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohia) chief Shivpal Yadav said that he can't back Yashwant Sinha as the latter had called Samajwadi Party (SP) patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav 'ISI agent'. "Hardcore SP leaders...who follow [Mulayamji's] principles [won't] support a candidate who levelled such allegations," he added. Notably, SP had extended support to Sinha.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Original BJP isn't running Karnataka govt, says DK Shivakumar
text: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Sunday said it's a coalition government in state and it's not being run by those from the “original BJP”. "It’s a government of all party MLAs," he added. "There's fear in BJP that there are a lot of internal problems. That’s the reason their national leaders are repeatedly coming and holding discussions," Shivakumar stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Thank MP residents for reposing trust in BJP: PM on civic poll results
text: Congratulating winners of civic polls in MP, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday thanked the state's residents for "reposing their trust in BJP". "This victory is a symbol of the unwavering faith of the people in CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan's government," PM tweeted. BJP has won 7 mayoral seats, Congress has won 3 mayoral seats and AAP has bagged 1 seat.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: It was easy to identify him: Mufti after her sister identifies Yasin as her kidnapper
text: After Rubaiya Sayeed, sister of PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti, identified Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik as one of her kidnappers, Mufti said he had been in public domain and it was easy to identify him. "Rubaiya was called as witness to identify someone…32 years is long time, people forget a lot of things. She couldn't identify anyone else," Mufti added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Arrests will be made for seeking rights in new India: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday criticised the government over unemployment and action against protesting youths, saying "arrests will be made for seeking rights in new India". "Don't ask questions. Don't raise your voice. Don't protest peacefully," he said. By shattering the hopes of crores of families, this dictatorial government is destroying the future of the country, Gandhi added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Prez should be able to guide govt on economy: Akhilesh on supporting Yashwant
text: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said that he will cast vote for Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha today. "There should be someone in the country who can tell the government the situation of the economy, from time to time. Look at Sri Lanka's condition. So, there should be President who can say that from time to time," he said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Gabbar Singh strikes again: Rahul criticises Centre over GST rates hike
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the Centre over the latest increase in GST rates by comparing the rates of various commodities before and after the hike through a picture shared by him on Twitter.
