"Gabbar Singh [GST] strikes again," Rahul tweeted. He added, "BJP [shows their] masterclass on how to destroy what was once one of the world's fastest-growing economies."
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: This GST rate hike is breathtakingly irresponsible: Shashi Tharoor
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has criticised the BJP-led Centre for the new hiked GST rates implemented from Monday. "This GST rate hike is breathtakingly irresponsible at a time of mounting economic difficulties for most Indians," Tharoor said. "The common citizen will bear the brunt of the burden even as inflation eats into his earnings," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: I have voted for NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu: Cong MLA
text: Odisha Congress MLA Mohammed Moquim on Monday said that he has voted for NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. "It's my personal decision as I have listened to my heart which guided me to do something for the soil and that's why [I] voted for her," he added. The Opposition has fielded Yashwant Sinha as their candidate for the post.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Opp'n trying to belittle the image of Parliament: Union Minister
text: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Sunday criticised the Opposition, saying it was making issues out of non-issues and trying to belittle the image of Parliament. "No word has been barred from use in Parliament and the Lok Sabha Secretariat has been bringing out such a list of unparliamentary words since 1954," Joshi added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: 32 bills indicated by various departments for Monsoon session, 14 ready: Govt
text: The government said that 32 bills have been indicated by various departments for presentation in the Monsoon session of Parliament of which 14 are ready. The Monsoon session will commence on July 18 and is scheduled to continue till August 12. Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi said some of these bills have already been discussed by standing committees of Parliament.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: India moved from cooperative federalism to coercive unilateralism: Sibal
text: Rajya Sabha MP and former Congress leader Kapil Sibal said that the country has "moved from cooperative federalism to coercive unilateralism". He further added that the politics of the central government is ruling every state instead of the Constitution. Addressing a federalism seminar, Sibal said BJP-led Centre's motive is to create 'opposition-mukt Bharat' (opposition-free India).
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Only Delhi govt providing respite from inflation via its schemes: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that the Delhi government is the only one that is providing any respite from growing inflation through its many schemes. "I demand the central government to take back GST applied on materials of everyday use of basic food products, it is not right," Kejriwal added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: No option other than dialogue with Pak to resolve Kashmir issue: Mufti
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said that there is no option other than holding dialogue with Pakistan and other stakeholders to resolve the Kashmir issue and stop the bloodshed. Her statement came after a CRPF officer was killed by militants in Pulwama on Sunday. She further said that her party always believed that bullets or grenades cannot solve an issue.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Elect me to save democracy: Yashwant Sinha on Presidential poll
text: As the voting for the Presidential election is underway, Opposition candidate Yashwant Sinha on Monday said that this poll is important and will set a path for the country’s democracy. "I appeal to all voters to listen to their hearts. This is a secret ballot, I hope they'll use their discretion and elect me to save democracy," Sinha added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Ex-K'taka minister influencing probe: Deceased contractor's wife
text: Deceased contractor Santosh Patil's wife, Jayashree Patil, has alleged that the main accused in her husband's suicide case, former Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa, is influencing the police investigation in his favour. She has cited Eshwarappa's statement to substantiate her claim wherein he had purportedly said that he would be acquitted of the charges in 15 days.
author: Mayukh Debnath

headlines: ED's conviction rate 0.5%, only used to target Opp'n: AAP MP
text: AAP Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh on Sunday accused the Central government of misusing the investigative agencies for targeting Opposition leaders in the country, adding that the conviction rate of ED is only 0.5%. He also alleged that the Punjab government is being forced to buy Adani coal at ₹30,000, which is ten times more than India coal.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Stats say Murmu will become 1st tribal woman President of India: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA from Darjeeling, Neeraj Tamang Zimba, on Monday said that according to the statistics, NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu will become the first tribal woman President of the country. "This (Presidential poll) is just a formality. She has already won…It's a joyous occasion. There's support from everywhere. It is historic," Zimba added before voting began for the Presidential election.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: All Karnataka BJP MLAs moved to B'luru hotel ahead of Presidential election
text: All 121 Karnataka BJP MLAs have been shifted to a Bengaluru hotel ahead of the Presidential election on July 18. BJP chief whip M Satish Reddy has asked the MLAs to remain in the hotel until Monday morning. A BJP MLA said, "High command wants to send out a message of how serious our party is about Droupadi Murmu's candidature."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: I've been blocked from visiting Singapore to present Delhi Model: CM Kejriwal to PM
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has written to PM Narendra Modi saying he's been "blocked" from visiting Singapore to present the 'Delhi Model' of governance before world leaders. The Lieutenant Governor reportedly hasn't responded to the visit request sent on June 7. Kejriwal said he's been invited by the Singapore government, adding, "[it's] a matter of pride for [India]...Kindly grant permission."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Urdu is not a religion specific language: TRS' KT Rama Rao
text: TRS Working President KT Rama Rao said that Urdu is not a religion specific language but regretfully some ignorants are trying to give such an impression. He further criticised BJP government and said that on one hand Centre is releasing funds for promotion of Urdu and on the other hand BJP leaders are indulging in misleading propaganda against the language.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Free education, healthcare are for making India number 1: Kejriwal
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said his government's programmes of free education, electricity and healthcare were not "freebies" but were part of his plans to make India the world's number one country. His remarks came as earlier in the day Prime Minister Narendra Modi warned the people against the "revadi culture" of offering freebies in exchange for votes.
author: Indraneel Sen

headlines: BJP nominated Dhankhar as VP candidate for political gains: Adhir Chowdhury
text: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that the BJP has nominated Jagdeep Dhankhar as their Vice Presidential candidate for political gains like for getting Jat votes as there are polls coming up in Rajasthan. We don't have any problem with his candidature, he added. BJP President JP Nadda announced Dhankhar's name as NDA's Vice President of India candidate on Saturday.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP MLA's aide slaps toll staffer in Rajasthan, incident caught on camera
text: BJP MLA Sanjay Sharma's aide has been caught on camera slapping a toll plaza staffer in Rajasthan's Dausa. The incident occurred after the toll worker asked for the MLA's identity card which reportedly infuriated the aide. Sharma remained seated inside the car as his aide emerged from the car and threatened the staffer before slapping him.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: Former UP MLC arrested in Mumbai by Saharanpur Police
text: A former member of the Uttar Pradesh Legislative Council, Mahmood Ali, was arrested in Mumbai by the Saharanpur Police. Ali is the brother of former MLC Haji Iqbal, who is allegedly a member of a mining mafia, police said. Iqbal's three sons are already arrested in various cases. Notably, Iqbal and Ali were BSP MLCs from 2010-2016 and 2016-2022 respectively.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: To accuse Patel 20 months after his death is part of vendetta: Chidambaram
text: Reacting to accusations of conspiracy over the 2002 Gujarat riots against late Congress leader Ahmed Patel, party leader P Chidambaram said that to accuse Patel of conspiracy, 20 months after his death, is a "part of a vendetta" against a political opponent. "To allege that Ahmed Patel acted at the instance of Sonia Gandhi is vile and vengeful," Chidambaram tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: PM absent during all-party meet, isn’t this 'unparliamentary'?: Cong's Jairam
text: As the government held an all-party meeting on Sunday, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said, “The PM was as usual absent”. “Isn’t this unparliamentary?” he tweeted. “Today in the all-party meeting many political parties...pointed out the contradiction in the [PM] Modi Sarkar claiming credit for its Presidential candidate...and killing off the Forest Rights Act, 2006 on the other hand!” he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Delhi govt’s power subsidy is 'propaganda': Gautam Gambhir
text: East Delhi MP Gautam Gambhir said claims of power subsidy by the Delhi government are an eyewash as it comes from taxes paid by the people. "In the past eight years, people of Delhi have just been at the receiving end of propaganda and hogwash," Gambhir said. He added that private electricity companies collect around ₹20,000 crore every year.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Don't want statue in Rashtrapati Bhavan, we're electing President: Tejashwi
text: RJD's Tejashwi Yadav on Saturday said, "We don't want any statue in Rashtrapati Bhavan, we're electing President." Furthermore, he said, "You must have...heard [of] Yashwant Sinha but we have never heard of the Presidential candidate of the ruling party. She hasn't held a single press conference since she became a candidate." Earlier, NDA announced Droupadi Murmu as its Presidential candidate.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Jagdeep Dhankhar’s image is of Guv who rules hearts of people: Nadda
text: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar’s image has been of a Governor who rules the hearts of the people, BJP chief JP Nadda said. His statement came as he announced that Dhankhar is NDA’s candidate for the post of the Vice President of India. "Shri Dhankhar Ji is the son of a simple farmer family," Nadda added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Is word ‘revari’ unparliamentary, asks Akhilesh Yadav
text: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Saturday asked, "Is the word ‘revari’ unparliamentary?" His statement came as PM Narendra Modi, after inaugurating Bundelkhand Expressway in UP, cautioned people against "revari (sweet) culture". "If those in power, running the ‘thank you’ campaign after distribution of 'revaris', could focus on giving jobs to youth, they could avoid 'culture of blaming'," Yadav tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: No dearth of selfish people among Dalits, marginalised: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati has alleged that there is no shortage of selfish people in Dalits and other neglected groups and has asked her party workers to beware of them. "There is no dearth of selfish people...some of them are even my family relatives," Mayawati tweeted. She added that these people have got several bogus social organisations registered.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Cong shifts 5 of its Goa MLAs to Chennai ahead of Presidential polls
text: The Goa Congress has shifted five of its eleven MLAs to Chennai for the weekend ahead of Presidential elections, PTI reported. MLAs Sankalp Amonkar, Yuri Alemao, Altone D'Costa, Rodolfo Fernandes and Carlos Alvares Ferreira were moved to Chennai on Friday evening, the report added. On Friday, state Congress President Amit Patkar accused the BJP of trying to lure Congress legislators.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: On what criteria BJP chose Dhankhar as Vice Presidential candidate?: TMC MP
text: TMC MP Saugata Roy asked, "On what criteria did BJP choose West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar as their candidate for Vice Presidential election?" Furthermore, he said, "Everyone thought that a minority candidate would be chosen for the Vice Presidential election by BJP but the party made it clear once and for all that they are not interested in the same."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Instead of post-retirement ambitions, judges should serve nation: Gehlot
text: Judges and bureaucrats should work to serve the country rather than be concerned about their post-retirement ambitions, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said on Saturday. He added that if someone becomes an MLA, a CM, an MP or a judge, then he gets a chance to serve the country and should be proud of doing it.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Presidential poll isn't a contest between 2 individuals but ideologies: Sinha
text: Ahead of the Presidential election, Opposition’s Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha said this year the Presidential election is not a contest between two individuals but two ideologies. "Only one side wants to protect the provisions and values enshrined in our Constitution. I appeal to all MPs and MLAs to vote according to the Constitution and their conscience this time," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Hold discussions on issues in interest of country: LS Speaker to leaders
text: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Saturday appealed to leaders of all political parties to hold discussions on key issues in the interest of the country. "The monsoon session will begin on 18th July and it will conclude on 12th August," Birla added. The Lok Sabha Speaker chaired the meeting of leaders of all political parties on Saturday.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Shiv Sena will rejoice if Uddhav and Shinde reunite: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday said that it will be a "happier moment" for the party if Uddhav Thackeray and Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde reunite. Marathi actress Deepali Sayed had previously expressed her happiness over the news of Uddhav and Shinde coming together for discussions keeping the sentiments of Shiv Sainiks in mind.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: How is Dhankhar 'Kisan Putra', when he was sleeping during farmers' protests: TMC
text: Soon after BJP announced West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar as NDA's Vice Presidential candidate and called him a "Kisan Putra" (son of a farmer), TMC said Dhankhar was sleeping during farmers' agitation. "Those who just tweet on issues...cannot be for people. When there was farmers’ agitation, Dhankhar was sleeping, how can he be Krishi Putra," TMC MP Santanu Sen said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Will see if unparliamentary words list imposed in draconian way: Tharoor
text: Amid the unparliamentary words row, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said he would "speak normally" in the House and see whether the list of words is applied in a "draconian manner" to oppress meaningful criticism. A ruling by one presiding officer is not necessarily binding on another, so I would treat this list as indicative rather than definitive, he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Govt ready to discuss any issue in Parliament: Pralhad Joshi
text: Ahead of the monsoon session of Parliament, Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Sunday said the government is ready to discuss any issue, under rules and procedures of Parliament. "We invited 45 political parties of which 36 attended all-party meeting today, 36 leaders put forth their views, gave suggestions and demanded some issues to be discussed by government," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Achieved it using our vaccines: VK Paul on crossing 200 cr COVID vaccination mark
text: As India crossed 200 crore COVID-19 vaccination mark, Niti Aayog’s Dr VK Paul said it's a magnificent milestone for the country. "We've achieved this using our own vaccines. All the credit for this achievement goes to people and leadership of the country," he added. Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said, “India has set...new record by completing target…in just 18 months."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: How many times did Manmohan ji attend all-party meet?: BJP to Congress
text: Reacting to the criticism of Congress party over PM Narendra Modi's absence in the all-party meet held today, BJP's Pralhad Joshi said that before 2014 no PM used to attend all-party meet. "Congress's Jairam Ramesh raised issue that PM didn't attend the meeting today...How many times did Manmohan Singh ji attend the all-party meeting?" the Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister asked.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Whenever Jagdeep Dhankhar takes up task he completes it: Brother Randeep
text: NDA's Vice-President candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar's brother, Randeep, has commented on his brother's abilities. "We had not expected this. When he became the West Bengal Governor, we did not know even then," Randeep said. He added, "Whenever my brother takes any task into his hands, he works hard to complete it. When he did advocacy...his clients used to get positive results."
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Govt breaking hopes of crores of families by making youths unemployed: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the BJP by tweeting a video of the SSC GD 2018 candidates protesting against the delay in their recruitment by marching for 800 kilometres before police stopped them in Agra. "People will be arrested for demanding their rights in 'New India'...Government is breaking the hopes of crores of families by making youths unemployed," Rahul tweeted.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Jagdeep Dhankhar named as NDA candidate for post of Vice President of India
text: BJP chief JP Nadda on Saturday announced that West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar is NDA's candidate for the post of the Vice President of India. The announcement was made after a BJP parliamentary board meeting held in Delhi. Dhankhar is a "kisan putra" (son of a farmer) who established himself as "people's Governor", Nadda said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Charges against Ahmed Patel mischievous: Jairam Ramesh
text: Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh has stated that the party refutes the "mischievous" charges "manufactured" against its late leader Ahmed Patel. He added, "This is...Prime Minister's...strategy to absolve himself of any responsibility for the communal carnage unleashed [in Gujarat in 2002]." Patel has been accused of being involved in a conspiracy to topple the Gujarat government in 2002.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: AAP to support Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha
text: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh on Saturday said that the party will support the Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha. "We respect Droupadi Murmu but we will vote for Yashwant Sinha," he added. Notably, AAP has 92 MLAs and seven Rajya Sabha MPs. Earlier, Shiv Sena announced its support for Droupadi Murmu for Presidential elections.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Sonia Gandhi behind plot to frame Narendra Modi in Guj riots: BJP
text: The BJP on Saturday alleged Congress President Sonia Gandhi was the "driving force" behind the "conspiracy" to implicate then Gujarat CM Narendra Modi in the 2002 riots case in the state. Party spokesperson Sambit Patra said, "Through her (Sonia) Chief Political Advisor, late Ahmed Patel, Sonia Gandhi attempted to malign Gujarat's image. Through him, she attempted to insult Narendra Modi."
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: 'Revari' culture dangerous for country's development: PM Modi in UP
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, after inaugurating the Bundelkhand Expressway in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday, cautioned people against "revari (sweet) culture" and said, "It could be very dangerous for the development of the country." "Those with revari culture will never build new expressways, new airports or defence corridors for you. Together we have to defeat this thinking," the PM added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: His name still has weight: Daughter of late Congress leader Patel on conspiracy charges
text: Reacting to accusations of conspiracy over the 2002 Gujarat riots against her late father and Congress leader Ahmed Patel, Mumtaz Patel said, "I guess his name...still holds weight to be used for political conspiracies (and) to malign the opposition." Patel has been accused of giving money to arrested activist Teesta Setalvad to frame the then-CM Narendra Modi in riots.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 'Kisan Putra', known for his humility: PM on NDA's Vice President candidate Dhankhar
text: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday called West Bengal Governor and NDA's Vice President of India candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar a "Kisan Putra" (son of a farmer). "Jagdeep Dhankhar Ji is known for his humility...He has always worked for the well-being of farmers, youth, women and the marginalised," said PM. "[I'm] glad that he (Dhankhar) will be our VP candidate," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: A good man exits: Jairam Ramesh on outgoing VP Venkaiah Naidu
text: After BJP announced Jagdeep Dhankhar as NDA's candidate for Vice Presidential election, Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh said outgoing VP Venkaiah Naidu's humour and wit will be missed. "On many occasions [Naidu] got the Opposition all agitated...but at the end of it a good man exits," Ramesh said, adding, "He may have retired, but I know he'll not be tired."
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: BJP wants Cong-free India, now they're after regional parties: Gehlot
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday claimed that BJP wants a "Congress-mukt Bharat (Congress-free India)" and now, they're after regional parties. "They want that...entire country is ruled by the BJP and RSS," he added. He further said that a "very dangerous game" is happening and people "aren't speaking out of fear" of Enforcement Directorate, Income Tax Department and CBI.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Sangrur MP must apologise for calling Bhagat Singh 'terrorist': Hayer
text: Punjab minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer has stated that Sangrur MP and Shiromani Akali Dal (Amritsar) leader Simranjit Singh Mann should apologise for calling freedom fighter Bhagat Singh a "terrorist". This comes after MP Mann said, "Bhagat Singh had killed a young English officer...He had hurled a bomb into the National Assembly...Now...tell me whether [he] was a terrorist or not."
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: No Cabinet in Maha amid flood situation will harm people: NCP chief
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Friday criticised the Maharashtra government and said that no Cabinet of ministers poses a threat to the people of the state amid a developing flood situation. "Two people are running Maharashtra government for [the] past 10 days," Pawar said. "The Cabinet hasn't been formed so far. There is no reason for delay," Pawar said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Lawyer fined ₹50,000 for accusing Jain of owning benami property: AAP
text: AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj on Friday said that Delhi Lokayukta has imposed a fine of ₹50,000 on advocate Neeraj for falsely accusing minister Satyendar Jain of owning benami property. Neeraj has not produced any evidence against the AAP leader in court, Bharadwaj added. He further accused BJP of misusing powers of agencies like ED and CBI to malign AAP leaders.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Modi & Yogi will take development to cities as well as villages: PM Modi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said the Bundelkhand Expressway in Uttar Pradesh will bring an industrial boom in the region. "It is the Modi and Yogi government, we will take development not just to cities but to villages," he said. The 296-km-long expressway extends from NH-35 at Gonda village in Chitrakoot to near Kudrail village in Etawah district.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: JD(S) to support NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu in Presidential polls
text: JD(S) announced on Friday that it will be supporting NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu in the upcoming Presidential polls. "A tribal woman becoming the president of the country is a matter of pride. The selection...is according to the wish of Deve Gowda," JD(S)' deputy leader in the legislature Bandeppa Kashempur said. Murmu will contest against opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Absence of democracy in J&K feeding alienation: National Conference
text: The J&K National Conference Party said the "absence of democracy" in Jammu and Kashmir is "feeding alienation" among the people of the Union Territory. "There is disquieting evidence everywhere in J&K on the backsliding of democracy," MPs Mohammad Akbar Lone and Hasnain Masoodi said on Friday. "A remote-controlled system can't empathise with people's suffering...aspirations," they added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Dhankhar spent years in public service: Rajnath on NDA VP candidate
text: Reacting to Jagdeep Dhankhar's nomination as NDA's candidate for the Vice President of India's post, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh congratulated him and tweeted, "He has spent years in public service." "He is a farmer's son who has a deep understanding of Law and the Constitution. India will greatly benefit from his experience," Rajnath Singh tweeted.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Elected govts are toppled for not accepting BJP's ideology: NCP chief
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Friday accused BJP-led central leadership of imposing their ideology on state governments run by non-BJP parties. He alleged that democratically elected governments in states are toppled if they don't accept BJP's ideology. "But such things do not last...wherever autocracy took over in the world, it didn't last long," he told a gathering of NCP workers.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: 23-yr-old girl defeats Union Minister's sister in MP panchayat polls
text: A 23-year-old girl has defeated Union Minister of State Faggan Singh Kulaste's sister in the recently held three-tier panchayat elections in Madhya Pradesh's Mandla district. According to reports, Lalita Dhurve, who contested with the support of Gondwana Gantantra Party, defeated Kulaste's sister, Priya Dhurve, by 3,900 votes. Lalita is the youngest district panchayat member in the district.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Democracy stands ruined in the country: Oppn Prez candidate Sinha
text: Opposition candidate for Presidential polls Yashwant Sinha said when he started his campaign for the polls, he had said that democracy is in danger. "Now...I can say that...democracy stands ruined in the country," Sinha said at a press conference in Ranchi. He further said that Presidential elections shouldn't be made a question of identity, but a fight for ideology.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Kerur violence victim's wife throws ₹2 lakh aid at Siddaramaiah's car
text: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah gave a compensation of ₹2 lakh to a woman whose husband was injured in the Kerur communal violence. However, the woman threw back the money at the Congress leader's car. The woman, identified as Mohammad Haneef's wife Rajma, said, "Today they'll give compensation and go away...My husband can't work for another year because of the assault."
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Request Yashwant to withdraw from Presidential race: Ex-MP Prakash Ambedkar
text: Vanchit Bahujan Aaghadi National President and former MP Prakash Ambedkar has requested Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha to withdraw from the race. He said that Sinha should do so as many Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe members from across parties are joining to vote for NDA's candidate Droupadi Murmu. Murmu will become the first tribal President of India if elected.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: 'Jumlajeevi' unparliamentary as 'Mahamanush' upset: Congress leader
text: Rajasthan Congress chief Govind Singh Dotasra tweeted, "Jumlas were given in the name of jobs. It was nothing wrong then and now you are feeling 'jumlajeevi' is unparliamentary." "Say straightforward..the mood of 'Mahamanush' is upset with the opposition raising public issues in Parliament," he added. This comes after list of words not allowed in the Parliament was released.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Shinde-led new Maha govt renames Aurangabad as Sambhaji Nagar again
text: Days after former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray renamed Aurangabad as Sambhaji Nagar and Osmanabad as Dharashiv, the new government led by CM Eknath Shinde repeated the act. Shinde said the MVA government's decision was illegal as it was taken after the alliance had lost majority in the state. "Holding a cabinet meeting [in such a situation] was illegal," said Shinde.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: BJP MP's convoy attacked in Telangana, he blames TRS workers
text: BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri on Friday alleged that "10-15 goons of TRS (Telangana Rashtra Samithi)" attacked his convoy while he was visiting a village in Telangana. Dharmapuri claimed the assailants were sent by an MLA who didn't want the villagers to highlight the issue of a land scam. Police haven't confirmed if the assailants were TRS members, a report said.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Where is church priest & Imam: DMK MP at govt 'bhoomi pujan' event
text: DMK MP S Senthilkumar objected to a 'bhoomi pujan' for a government road project which was being prepared to be held only by a Hindu priest in Tamil Nadu's Dharmapuri. Pointing to the priest, he said, "Where are the other religions? Where is the Christian and the Muslim? Invite the Church father, the Imam...the atheists [and representatives of] Dravidar Kazhagam."
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Dhankhar's experience would be of great value for RS: Jaishankar
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday after the latter was nominated as NDA's candidate for the Vice President of India's post. The minister wrote on Twitter, "His great erudition and rich experience would be of immense value for the functioning of the Rajya Sabha." Dhankhar is the current Governor of West Bengal.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Dhankhar's experience will benefit nation: Shah on NDA's VP candidate
text: Reacting to Jagdeep Dhankhar's nomination as NDA's candidate for the Vice President of India's post, Union Home Minister Amit Shah tweeted, "His...long administrative experience in the constitutional process of the House will greatly benefit the country." "I am sure that with the election of Shri Dhankhar ji as Vice President...the dignity of our Upper House will increase further," he added.
author: Shailesh

headlines: After expelling O Panneerselvam, AIADMK sacks his sons & 16 supporters
text: AIADMK interim chief Edappadi K Palaniswami (EPS) on Thursday expelled O Panneerselvam's sons and 16 other supporters of the ousted leader from the party. This comes days after the AIADMK expelled Panneerselvam. AIADMK on Monday elected Palaniswami as its Interim General Secretary and vested in him full powers to head the organisation.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Shah Jahan didn't invite quotations for Taj: Goa Minister on not floating tender for work
text: Goa Minister for Art and Culture Govind Gaude cited the example of Taj Mahal to defend the government's decision to not seek tenders for the renovation work of Kala Academy. He said, "How is Taj Mahal beautiful and everlasting even today? Because Shah Jahan never invited any quotations. Now it's almost 390 years and Taj Mahal stands as it is."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Mehbooba's sister identifies Yasin Malik as 1 of her kidnappers in 1989 case
text: Rubaiya Sayeed, sister of Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chief Mehbooba Mufti, has identified Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik and three others as her kidnappers, officials said. Rubaiya appeared before a Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) court on Friday in a case related to her abduction by Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) on December 8, 1989.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: BJP shares alleged pic showing ex-VP Ansari with Pak journalist, Ansari denies
text: Former Vice-President Hamid Ansari has reiterated that he never knew Pakistani journalist Nusrat Mirza after BJP shared a picture purportedly showing him sharing a stage with Mirza. BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia alleged that the picture showed Ansari and Mirza at an Indian conference in 2009. Mirza, who's claimed to have spied for ISI, alleged Ansari shared "classified" information with him.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Will quit politics if any MLA who joined me loses polls: Maha CM
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has stated that he'll quit politics if any of the MLAs who joined him loses the next Assembly polls. "I'm confident that all these 50 MLAs will win the elections...If any of them loses, I'll resign from politics," he said. This comes after Shiv Sena MLAs, led by Shinde, rebelled against Uddhav Thackeray's leadership in Maharashtra.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: This isn't Germany: Kamal Haasan on 'unparliamentary' words list
text: Makkal Needhi Maiam (MNM) chief Kamal Haasan in a statement on Thursday condemned the list of unparliamentary words released by Lok Sabha Secretariat, saying, "Mr Hitler, this isn't Germany!" He questioned if the PM and his ministers aren't open to criticism, then does it mean "we're going back to [a] monarchy where...king and his ministers would be only praised?"
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Fadnavis meets Raj, wishes him a speedy recovery; pics surface
text: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis met MNS chief Raj Thackeray at his residence in Mumbai today. He also shared pictures and a video of the meeting on Twitter. Fadnavis said that he inquired about Raj's health and wished him a speedy recovery. Raj had undergone hip replacement surgery last month. This is Fadnavis' first visit to Raj since the surgery.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: BJP appoints Laxmikant Bajpai as chief whip of Rajya Sabha
text: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has appointed former Uttar Pradesh BJP President Laxmikant Bajpai as the party's chief whip in the Rajya Sabha. "I will discharge this responsibility given by the party leadership with full devotion," Bajpai said on Twitter. Bajpai has replaced Shiv Pratap Shukla who retired as a Member of Parliament from the Rajya Sabha.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: RSS means love for nation: Giriraj Singh on Patna SSP's PFI remark
text: After Patna SSP Manavjit Singh drew parallels between Islamic extremist outfit Popular Front of India (PFI) and Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS), Union Minister Giriraj Singh tweeted, "RSS means love for the nation, RSS means welfare of the nation, RSS means service to the nation...RSS means humanity and harmony." He added, "Every sensible person…understands this, except a few who've an agenda."
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Pune activists allege discrepancies in poll papers of Maha CM
text: Two Pune-based activists have moved a court to register an offence against Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, alleging discrepancies in his affidavits filed for legislative assembly polls in the past. The discrepancies pertain to the declaration of movable and immovable assets of Shinde, according to the activists. Shinde is a four-time legislator from Kopri Pachpakhadi constituency.
author: Indraneel Sen

headlines: My govt committed to all-round development of Maha: CM Shinde
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said he was a "sevak" and his government was committed to the all-round development of the state and the welfare of its citizens. Shinde said that the decisions for the people should have been taken two and a half years back, but since that did not happen, 50 MLAs had to take a stand.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Not Chinese people, some Chinese hardliners consider me separatist: Dalai Lama
text: The Dalai Lama on Thursday said not Chinese people but some Chinese "hardliners" consider him a separatist. "Now, more and more Chinese are realising that Dalai Lama is not seeking independence but within China meaningful autonomy and to preserve Tibetan Buddhist culture," he said in Jammu. He will make his first trip to Leh in about four years on Friday.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Siddaramaiah demands narco test on PSI scam accused ADGP Paul
text: Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Friday demanded a narco test on ADGP Amrit Paul who was arrested in connection with the 2021 Karnataka police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam. "If Amrit Paul...is subjected to...narco test, then it will be clear who all...politicians are involved," Siddaramaiah said. "There should be no attempt to cover up this case," he added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Odisha BJP MLAs protest against Cong leader's remarks on Murmu
text: Odisha BJP MLAs held a protest inside the state Legislative Assembly on Thursday against Congress leader Ajoy Kumar's remarks on NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. The BJP also took out a protest rally in Bhubaneswar condemning Ajoy Kumar's statement. Congress leader Ajoy Kumar on Wednesday alleged that Droupadi Murmu represents a "very evil philosophy of India".
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: We'll break records, everyone will vote for Murmu: Maha CM Shinde
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde claimed on Thursday that in the upcoming Presidential polls, all records will be broken as everyone will vote for NDA's candidate, Droupadi Murmu, under PM Narendra Modi's guidance. "Murmu is a tribal woman. We work for tribals and we support tribal people," he said. Murmu had met Shinde and other leaders the same day.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Attacks on Shiv Sena workers will not be tolerated: Uddhav Thackeray
text: Shiv Sena chief and former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said that attacks on party workers would not be tolerated. "If police cannot bring the culprits to book, Sena workers will do it," Uddhav Thackeray said. His comment comes after he met Shiv Sena worker Baban Gaonkar who was attacked by unidentified persons on Thursday night.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP running 'Operation Kamal' in Prez polls, bribing people: Sinha
text: Ahead of Presidential elections, opposition parties’ Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha has accused the BJP of carrying out 'Operation Kamal' by engaging in horse-trading. Sinha, who has sought a probe into the matter, alleged that the party is offering a "huge sum of money to non-BJP MLAs" to back NDA's candidate in polls. Presidential elections will be held on July 18.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: No concept of 'super CM' in present govt: Maha Dy CM Fadnavis
text: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said that there was no concept of "super CM" in the present Eknath Shinde-led government. "We have only one chief minister and that is Eknath Shinde. We are working under his leadership," Fadnavis said. His comment comes after some opposition leaders claimed that though Shinde is the CM, Fadnavis was taking the decisions.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: IT Department raids Cong MLA Sanjay Sharma's bungalow, sugar mill
text: The Income Tax Department is conducting search operations at premises linked to Sanjay Sharma, a Congress MLA from Tendukheda. The MLA is reportedly a liquor and sand baron in Madhya Pradesh. The search action covered 44 premises including Sharma's bungalow in Jabalpur and a sugar mill in Narsinghpur. As per reports, documents related to income tax evasion have been seized.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Murmu will get more votes than expected in Prez polls: Goa CM
text: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Thursday said NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu will get more votes than expected as BJP has 'numbers' in the state. "Apart from 25 MLAs, we have appealed to other MLAs too to vote for her," Sawant said. Murmu on Thursday arrived in Goa and sought support from MPs and MLAs for the upcoming Presidential elections.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: There's misgovernance, corruption in Mumbai civic body: Deora
text: Congress leader Milind Deora said there is "misgovernance and corruption" in Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation and that the municipality's recent delimitation was done to benefit the Shiv Sena. The BMC elections are scheduled for later this year and Deora said the Congress should be ready to take on Shiv Sena. Last year, the number of BMC seats increased to 236.
author: Indraneel Sen

headlines: SP-ally OP Rajbhar's party to support NDA's Prez candidate Droupadi Murmu
text: Om Prakash Rajbhar's Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP), an ally of the Akhilesh Yadav-led Samajwadi Party (SP), announced on Friday that it will be supporting NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu in the Presidential elections. "The decision was taken after discussions with party leaders and office bearers," Rajbhar said. Notably, Akhilesh Yadav is supporting Yashwant Sinha for Presidential polls.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: New dictionary for new India: Rahul on 'unparliamentary' words list
text: Congress’ Rahul Gandhi reacted to list of words that are banned in Parliament. "New dictionary for new India," Rahul tweeted. "Unparliamentary: Words used in discussions and debates which correctly describe PM’s handling of government, now banned from being spoken," the image Gandhi tweeted, read. "Example...'Jumlajeevi tanashah shed crocodile tears when his lies...were exposed'," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Complete dictatorship: O Panneerselvam after AIADMK expels OP Ravindhranath
text: Former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam has termed AIADMK's decision of expelling his son and Theni Lok Sabha MP OP Ravindhranath "complete dictatorship". "In...last General Election 2019, OP Ravindhranath won and that is the only seat where AIADMK won. Removing [him] is a complete dictatorship," said O Panneerselvam. His other son, VP Jayapradeep, was also expelled from AIADMK on Thursday.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Guru Granth Sahib insulted at Punjab CM Mann's marriage ceremony: SGPC
text: The Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) has claimed that the vehicle carrying holy book Guru Granth Sahib was stopped for inspection at Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's wedding ceremony. The committee called the act an "insult to the honour of the Guru". "It was even more hurtful that this incident took place at [CM's] residence," SGPC chief Harjinder Singh Dhami said.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Centre upgrades security of Kumar Vishwas to Y+ category
text: The Ministry of Home Affairs has upgraded the security of former Aam Aadmi Party leader Kumar Vishwas from Y to Y+ category, ANI reported. The decision is based on a threat assessment report by Intelligence Bureau. In February, the Centre had granted Y security cover to Vishwas after he accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of having links with separatist outfits.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Union minister unaware of ground realities on MGNREGA in Bengal: BJP
text: West Bengal's BJP unit claimed Union Minister Kapil Moreshwar Patil is unaware of the ground reality related to MGNREGA in the state. BJP national vice-president Dilip Ghosh alleged that officers have submitted misleading reports to Patil. This comes after Patil claimed that he doesn't know of any corruption in implementation of the scheme at the panchayat level in West Bengal.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: List of words banned in Parliament released
text: Lok Sabha Secretariat has released a list of words that will be considered unparliamentary, which includes 'corrupt', 'lie', 'jumlajeevi', 'nikamma', 'hypocrisy' and 'incompetent'. Words like 'anarchist' and 'dictatorial' will also be expunged if used during debates. The list, however, said that some of the words may not appear unparliamentary unless read in conjunction with other expressions.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Bolein toh bolein kya?: Opposition on list of words banned in Parliament
text: Reacting to a list of words that are banned in the Parliament, Shiv Sena's Priyanka Chaturvedi tweeted, "Reminded of this meme. Agar karein toh karein kya, bolein toh bolein kya?" TMC's Mahua Moitra tweeted, "Is 'Truth' unparliamentary?" Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said, "All words used by the Opposition to describe the reality of Modi Sarkar now to be considered 'unparliamentary'."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Next we'll be asked to wear saffron dress: Adhir on 'unparliamentary' words list
text: Reacting to the new list of unparliamentary words released by Lok Sabha Secretariat, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that Centre is making a "second republic" by bringing such rules. "At present, they (Centre) are saying that certain words can't be used inside Parliament, tomorrow they'll ask to enter premises in a saffron dress," the Congress leader said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Context is important in what you speak in Parliament: Owaisi on list of words banned
text: Reacting to a list of words that are now banned in the Parliament, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said context is important in what you speak in the Parliament. "You cannot just term words unparliamentary," he added. Lok Sabha Secretariat has released a list of words that will be considered unparliamentary which includes 'corrupt', 'jumlajeevi' and 'lie' among other words.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: What BJP did to tribal rights activist Father Stan Swamy isn’t secret: Ajoy Kumar
text: Congress’ Ajoy Kumar said BJP is now thinking about Adivasis but what it did to tribal rights activist Father Stan Swamy is not a secret. "The whole country knows BJP's Dalit and anti-tribal policies," he tweeted. Earlier, Kumar said NDA’s Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu represents a "very evil philosophy of India" and should not be made a "symbol of Adivasi".
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: FM has called planets to rescue the economy: P Chidambaram
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram said, "We're not surprised that Finance Minister tweeted pictures of Jupiter, Pluto and Uranus on the day when inflation printed at 7.01% and unemployment printed at 7.8%," he tweeted. "To begin with, she should appoint new CEA: Chief Economic Astrologer," he added. "The FM has called the planets to...rescue of the economy," he further added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Won't support any law that mandates 2 children: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that he will not support any law that mandates two children only policy as it would not benefit the country. "We should not repeat the mistakes of China...India's total fertility rate is declining, by 2030 it will stabilise," he added. Earlier, he criticised UP CM Yogi Adityanath over his "population imbalance" remark.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Thackeray forced to back NDA's Presidential candidate: Yashwant Sinha
text: Opposition candidate for Presidential polls Yashwant Sinha said that ex-Maharashtra CM and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray was "forced" to declare that his party would support the NDA’s candidate, Droupadi Murmu. "I am not only fighting a political party, I am fighting for the government and finally the cat is out of the bag," Sinha added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Have decided to learn Gorkhali language: Mamata in Darjeeling
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee during her Darjeeling visit said that she has decided to learn Gorkhali language in order to communicate more effectively with the people of the Darjeeling hills. "One of my nephews is getting married to a girl who is a resident of Kurseong...I have decided to learn Gorkhali from her after the marriage," Banerjee said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP playing dirty politics over upcoming Presidential polls: TMC leader
text: TMC's Partha Chatterjee said that the BJP is playing "dirty politics" over upcoming Presidential polls. "The NDA nominee was in Kolkata and didn’t ask for votes of Opposition legislators. But BJP leadership has written letters to our MLAs and MPs, seeking their support," Chatterjee added. "When candidate herself hasn't made any appeal, who are they to write letters?" he asked.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress to hold nationwide protest against ED summons to Sonia Gandhi
text: Congress has announced that it will hold nationwide protest on July 21 when Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi is scheduled to appear before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case. "[Sonia Gandhi] isn't afraid...she will go to...ED office and face this government," said Mallikarjun Kharge. Notably, former Congress President Rahul Gandhi was questioned by ED last month.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Congress sees politics in National Emblem: K'taka CM Bommai
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday criticised Congress over the National Emblem controversy and said the party sees politics in it. "Its fierceness shows our way of thinking," Bommai said. This comes after Congress criticised the BJP over the National Emblem cast atop the new Parliament building and accused the Centre of changing the nature and character of Ashokan lions.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Lost 2021 polls because of manipulators in our party: AIADMK's EPS
text: AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami said that the party lost 2021 state elections because of manipulators in AIADMK itself. "CM Stalin thinks he can knock our party with the help of traitors in AIADMK. But it won't happen, we'll form government again," Palaniswami said. Palaniswami's comment comes after he took control of the party as its interim General Secretary.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Cong should apologise: Minister on 'evil philosophy' remark on Murmu
text: Tribal Affairs Minister Arjun Munda on Wednesday criticised Congress leader Ajoy Kumar's "evil philosophy" remark on NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, stating that Congress should apologise for it. "Tribes weren't recognised by Congress even [as it was] in power for...long time," he added. Kumar had said that Murmu represents "evil philosophy" and shouldn't be made "symbol of tribals".
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP only national party today, others reduced to families: Nadda
text: BJP is the only national party today, while others have been reduced to families and individuals, said BJP president JP Nadda on Tuesday. While addressing the party's training camp in Rajasthan, Nadda expressed confidence that BJP will form the government in the state with a thumping majority in the Assembly polls next year.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP confusing people on population issue to deviate from real priority: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati said that BJP is confusing people on the issue of population control to deviate from "real priority". "At a time, when people are limiting their needs and are forced to lead a stressful life singed by extreme poverty and rising unemployment, is it wise of BJP to confuse people with long-term issues like population control?" she asked.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Gupkar alliance, NC greatest hurdle in fight against terrorism: BJP
text: J&K BJP unit’s spokesperson Girdhari Lal Raina said that the National Conference and Gupkar alliance are the greatest hurdles in the fight against terrorism. "Instead of educating youngsters about the futility of violence and terrorism, these self-centred, power-hungry and pursuers of dynastic politics are instigating people by their inciting statements," Raina added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Shinde's illegal govt doing no work for floods in Maha: Sanjay Raut
text: Calling Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's government illegal, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said they are not doing anything for the flood-like situation in the state. "Twelve days have passed and the Maharashtra government is not doing any work...Where is the Governor of Maharashtra for 12 days when the state is suffering from flood-like situations?" Raut said.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Anything can be said against ex-VP, nothing against Prez candidate: Cong leader
text: Congress leader Pawan Khera said that the situation of the country is such that anything can be said against a Former Vice President but nothing can be said against the political ideologies of a person who is a Presidential candidate. His statement comes a day after BJP accused Hamid Ansari of inviting a Pakistani journalist having links with ISI.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Don't wait for any alliance, gear up for BMC polls: Pawar tells party cadre
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday asked his party cadre to gear up preparations for elections to the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). "Don't wait for NCP to stitch up...alliance with any party but start work with an eye on BMC elections," Pawar said. He further asked NCP workers to step up outreach with voters to increase the party's presence.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Depends on book in Parliament that decides on words being unparliamentary: Kharge
text: Reacting to a list of words that are now banned in Parliament, Congress’ Mallikarjun Kharge said it depends on book in the Parliament that decides on words being unparliamentary. "We'll use those words that he (PM Modi) had used in his parliamentary career, we'll tell him what words he used in debates. He himself used these words," Kharge added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP turning Amarnath Yatra into a 'political issue': Mehbooba Mufti
text: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti accused the Centre of turning Amarnath Yatra into a "political issue". "The environment does not permit more than 5,000 pilgrims every day, but they sent thousands of people there. The result was that the cloudburst took place," Mufti said. She claimed the administration was hiding the actual number of deaths in Friday's cloudburst incident.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: India can't progress if it's caught in shackles of casteism: KT Rama Rao
text: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Wednesday said India cannot progress if it is caught in the shackles of casteism. "If caste and religion references are used...when progress is being made in all fields, it will cause serious damage to...country," he said during the launch of book "Charitraputtalo Telangana". He further urged the youth to grow with secular sentiments.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: West Bengal witnessing extreme appeasement: Governor Dhankhar
text: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Wednesday criticised the state government and said the state is witnessing extreme appeasement. "Our state has serious problems of governance," Dhankhar said. "I appeal to civil society and intelligentsia to speak about this serious problem of governance," he said, adding that this appeasement will destroy democracy.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Shiv Sena's poll symbol 'bow & arrow' should go to Shinde faction: Athawale
text: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale said Shiv Sena’s poll symbol, 'bow and arrow', should go to Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led faction. "As many as 40 out of 55 Shiv Sena MLAs are with Shinde…I am sure he'll lay claim for symbol because he has [over] two-thirds of MLAs with him," he added. The real Shiv Sena belongs to Shinde, Athawale stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Ever tried putting lion on leash, it breaks: Cong's Manish Tewari
text: Congress leader Manish Tewari on Wednesday tweeted, "Ever tried putting a lion on a leash? Only one thing happens, the leash breaks." Earlier, Tewari refused to sign a letter by the Opposition against the Agnipath scheme. Tewari, who was one of the Opposition MPs to meet Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, didn't sign letter that sought withdrawal or scrutiny of scheme.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Many Himachal BJP leaders suffocated within their party: Congress
text: Himachal Pradesh Congress President Pratibha Singh on Wednesday said many BJP leaders in the state are eager to join the Congress as they feel "suffocated" due to infighting in their party. Her statement comes a day after former Himachal Pradesh BJP President Khimi Ram joined the Congress. Singh also said that people are "fed up" with BJP's policies and decisions.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Shiv Sena spokesperson Sheetal Mhatre joins Eknath Shinde camp
text: Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena party spokesperson and former Mumbai corporator Sheetal Mhatre on Tuesday joined the Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led Sena camp. Mhatre, along with some Sena workers, visited Shinde's residence on Tuesday night and expressed their support for him. She had represented ward number 7 in suburban Dahisar in north Mumbai in 2012 and 2017.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Mann launches new RC service, Akali Dal says it was started in 2011
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday announced new e-Registration Certificates (e-RCs) service for new vehicles through automobile dealers. People will get the delivery of a smart registration certificate at their doorsteps, Mann added. Shiromani Akali Dal president Sukhbir Singh Badal said that the service was started by their government in 2011 and is in place since then.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Droupadi Murmu represents very evil philosophy of India: Congress leader
text: Congress leader Ajoy Kumar said NDA’s Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu represents a "very evil philosophy of India" and should not be made a "symbol of Adivasi". Following Kumar’s statement, BJP’s spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said that Congress has insulted Murmu. "Yashwant Sinha is also a good candidate," Kumar added. "[PM] Modi-led government is fooling people," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Brought disgrace to Bihar: Tejashwi faces ridicule for fumbling before PM
text: Responding to RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav's faltering speech at an event attended by PM Narendra Modi, BJP spokesperson Arvind Kumar Singh on Wednesday said that Yadav brought disgrace to Bihar. "On the occasion of Guru Purnima, we salute the teachers of Tejashwi Yadav, who does not have enough skills to read out from a text," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Muslims using most contraceptives: Owaisi on UP CM’s 'population imbalance' remark
text: Following UP CM Yogi Adityanath’s "population imbalance" remark, AIMIM’s Asaduddin Owaisi said that Muslims are the ones using most contraceptives. "The total fertility rate which was 2.6 in 2016 is now 2.3. The country’s demographic dividend is the best among all countries," Owaisi added. "Their own Health Minister said no law is needed in country for population control," Owaisi stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Assam minister, others targeted in 'gift card scam'; FIR filed
text: Assam minister Bimal Borah has lodged an FIR with the police after unidentified fraudsters created fake WhatsApp accounts of him and other senior officials to cheat people. "Messages were being sent [on my behalf] to...[people], asking them to transfer money by purchasing some gift vouchers," Borah said. "I've asked the police to investigate and trace the criminals," he added.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Sena part of MVA but didn’t consult us: Cong leader on Shiv Sena's support to Murmu
text: Congress leader Balasaheb Thorat said Shiv Sena didn't consult his party before deciding to support Droupadi Murmu for Presidential polls. "Though Shiv Sena is part of MVA, it didn't consult us about this," he said. Everyone who supports the "Constitution and democracy" is supporting the Opposition's candidate for Presidential polls, Yashwant Sinha, for the post, Thorat added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Won't betray Balasaheb's ideology: Eknath Shinde on Guru Purnima
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde paid floral tribute to Shiv Sena founder Balasaheb Thackeray on the occasion of Guru Purnima and said, "It is only due to his blessings that I stand before you all as the CM today." Sharing a Twitter post, he wrote, "Won't betray Balasaheb's ideology. That fire will not be extinguished...there is no thought without Hindutva."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: KCR to give positions to people who fought during T'gana movement: TRS leader
text: TRS leader K Kavitha said people who fought during Telangana movement will be awarded some position by CM K Chandrashekar Rao "when the time comes". "A very good position and identity have been given to Rajeev Sagar…Every brother, sister and people who fought during the Telangana movement with Rajeev will also be given positions by CM KCR," she added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Original lion different: CPI MP demands removal of distorted emblem
text: CPI MP Binoy Viswam on Wednesday criticised the Centre and said that the original Ashoka Pillar lion differs from the one atop the new Parliament building and demanded its removal. "This lion suits the ideology and politics of RSS and BJP and PM Narendra Modi," he said. This lion is frightening everybody, he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: TMC insulted Goddess Kali, now disrespecting National Emblem: Irani
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday reacted to TMC's criticism of the National Emblem atop the new Parliament building. "It is not unexpected from the party and its leaders who insult Goddess Kali to insult the National Emblem," Irani said. "Those leaders who...either disregarded or discarded the Constitution over the years, are expected to oppose the National Emblem," she added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Cong must apologise: BJP on Ajoy Kumar’s ‘evil philosophy’ remark on Murmu
text: Following Congress leader Ajoy Kumar’s "evil philosophy" remark on NDA’s Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, BJP's spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla demanded that Congress must apologise for the statement. "The Congress party must explain or else they must apologise for the statement that they have made insulting not just Droupadi Murmuji but the entire Adivasi community," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Hyderabad's infrastructure much better than Bengaluru's: T'gana IT Minister
text: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao said that he has no competition with Bengaluru but he believes that Hyderabad's infrastructure is much better than Bengaluru's. Listing out things he tells his investors about the city, Rao said, "We tell them that Hyderabad is the city where the North meets the South. Biology marries technology...Our infrastructure is much better than Bengaluru."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: We support tribals: Aaditya Thackeray on Shiv Sena supporting Murmu
text: Soon after ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray announced that Shiv Sena will support Droupadi Murmu for Presidential polls, Aaditya Thackeray said his party has decided to do so as Murmu is a tribal woman. "Today we've different political views but Droupadi Murmu is a tribal woman and we support tribals. That's why we will vote in favour of Murmu," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Ajoy's remark shows what Congress thinks of tribals: BJP's Babulal Marandi
text: Former CM of Jharkhand and BJP leader Babulal Marandi criticised Congress' Ajoy Kumar's "evil philosophy" remark on NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu and said that his statement shows what Congress thinks about tribals and women. "Tribal people got nothing during Congress rule," he said. Congress is having trouble because for the first time a tribal woman is nominated, he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: FM interested in Uranus, Pluto rather than tackling inflation: Congress
text: A day after the government released its inflation data, Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh on Wednesday criticised Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman for retweeting pictures from NASA's Webb Telescope. "She has an interest in Pluto, Jupiter and Uranus. Unfortunately, our Finance Minister is showing the way to Pluto, Uranus...and is unable to show...way forward to our economy," Vallabh said.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Religious conversion leads to separatism: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
text: Religious conversion should not be done as it separates individuals from their roots, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said on Tuesday. "Religious conversion leads to separatism. Conversion separates one from the roots. Hence, we should strive to stop religious conversion," Bhagwat added. "We have to ensure that 'dharma' should pervade all over," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress has to do a lot of introspection: Digambar Kamat
text: Former Goa CM Digambar Kamat said Congress has to do a lot of introspection as the party is losing so many polls and leaders are leaving. "I worked for the party with sincerity," Kamat added. His statement came after Congress accused Michael Lobo and Kamat of "conspiring and hobnobbing" with BJP to engineer a split in the party’s legislative wing.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Indians will create Sri Lanka, Afghanistan-like situation against BJP: TMC MP
text: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee said BJP will face Sri Lanka and Afghanistan-like situation by people because of the hike in fuel prices in country. "People won’t have food to survive. What happened in Sri Lanka and Afghanistan, people of India will create similar situation against BJP I believe," Banerjee added. Petrol and diesel prices are rising steadily, he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Will fulfil promise of making Punjab a drug-free state: AAP leader
text: Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) Punjab unit's Chief Spokesperson Malvinder Singh Kang said the Bhagwant Mann-led government will fulfil its promise of making Punjab a drug-free state. "Earlier, only drug addicts...were arrested," he said, adding that directions have been issued to seize the property of proclaimed offenders. He further accused previous governments of "playing politics over the issue".
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Population explosion not a problem of any religion but entire country: Naqvi
text: BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi has said that "population explosion" is not a problem of any religion but an issue for the entire country. It is not right to associate it with caste and religion, Naqvi added. "Some people want to create unlimited problems on the pretext of Allah’s mercy," Naqvi stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Don't allow swearing-in of ministers till SC's verdict: Sena to Maha Guv
text: Shiv Sena wrote to Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari stating that since a petition seeking the disqualification of 16 legislators was pending in Supreme Court (SC), he should not allow the swearing-in of any minister until the court's decision. "Rewarding persons against whom disqualification proceedings are pending...would be destructive of the Constitutional scheme," the letter added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India is mother of all democracies: PM Modi in Bihar
text: Addressing an event in Bihar, PM Narendra Modi said that India is not just the largest democracy but it is also the "mother of all democracies". The PM also stated that the nation was "on its way to becoming a mature democracy" which was evident from "better attendance of lawmakers inside Parliament and state assemblies" and "discarding of obsolete laws".
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Central schemes have become scams in West Bengal: Smriti Irani
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday said that the central schemes have become "scams" in West Bengal. "People have asked me to inform the administration to get them the central schemes as they are deprived of it," Irani added. She further said that she has spoken with the district administration and informed them about the "distress" of the people.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: WB Governor Dhankhar behaves in a communal manner: TMC MLA Ali
text: TMC MLA Idris Ali on Wednesday accused West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar of being communal and alleged that he behaves in a communal manner. Ali had previously sparked controversy for alleging that PM Narendra Modi will meet the same fate as Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. "Prime Minister Modi will also resign and flee," he had said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP's Malviya sending doctored video: Cong's Ajoy over his Murmu remark
text: Responding to his statement over NDA Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, Congress leader Ajoy Kumar on Wednesday said that BJP's IT cell in-charge Amit Malviya has doctored the video, which is being misrepresented. "Droupadi Murmu is a decent person, but she represents an evil philosophy of India. We shouldn't make her a symbol of tribals," Kumar had earlier said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Will ensure CAA isn't implemented if elected Prez: Yashwant Sinha
text: Opposition Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Wednesday said that if he is elected, he will ensure that the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) is not implemented. "Earlier, the government gave the excuse of COVID-19, but even now they have not been able to implement it because it is an Act foolishly drafted in a hurry," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Rahul leaves for personal visit abroad, to skip key Congress meeting
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi left for a personal visit overseas on Tuesday, the party confirmed, but didn't disclose any details about the visit. Rahul will skip a crucial Congress meeting on July 14 to discuss the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and internal party elections. All senior Congress members, including general secretaries, in-charges and PCC presidents, have been invited to the meeting.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Many Shiv Sena leaders, workers in touch with us: Maha CM Shinde
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has claimed that many Shiv Sena leaders and workers are "in touch" with his faction. "The Deputy CM handled the government very well during his tenure as CM...Many people have faith in the government," Shinde added. This comes after Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve claimed 12 Shiv Sena MPs are in touch with Shinde's faction.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Shiv Sena will support NDA's Presidential candidate Murmu: Uddhav Thackeray
text: Shiv Sena will support Droupadi Murmu for Presidential elections, the party's chief Uddhav Thackeray announced on Tuesday. This came after Sena MP and spokesperson Sanjay Raut had said, "Supporting Droupadi Murmu does not mean supporting BJP." He said Sena shared a "good relationship" with Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha but will not act "under pressure".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Statue atop Parliament is a copy of National Emblem: Sculptor on 'distortion' claims
text: Sculptor Sunil Deore has refuted claims of 'distorting' expression of lions in the National Emblem statue installed on top of the new Parliament building. "We've tried to perfectly copy the sculpture at Sarnath," said Deore, adding, "We studied the original sculpture before enlarging it." Many opposition leaders have claimed the lions were made to look "angry" in the new sculpture.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: TMC MP questions Smriti Irani's appointment as Minority Affairs Minister, Rijiju responds
text: Questioning Minority Affairs Minister Smriti Irani's appointment, TMC MP Jawhar Sircar tweeted, "Hardcore Hindu, married to a Parsi given charge of Muslims, Christians. Is this BJP's secularism?" Kiren Rijiju replied, Muslims, Sikhs, Christians, Buddhists, Jain and Parsis are all minority communities, adding, "I hope one can free mind from the shackles of pseudo secularism & appeasement politics."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Idris Ali is a terrorist: BJP MP Khan after Ali's statement on PM Modi
text: West Bengal BJP MP Saumitra Khan has called TMC MLA Idris Ali a "big terrorist" after the latter allegedly said that PM Narendra Modi will meet the same fate as Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. Khan alleged that Ali is currently out on bail and is making such statements to please West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: CBI chargesheet meets requirements: Court on denying Deshmukh's bail
text: While refusing default bail to ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a corruption case, a court stated that CBI's chargesheet against him met all requirements. Deshmukh had sought bail over claims that the chargesheet hadn't been submitted within the 60-day mandated period and that the chargesheet was incomplete. Courts cannot be too technical while entertaining bail pleas, the court said.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Former Himachal Pradesh BJP chief Khimi Ram joins Congress
text: Former Himachal Pradesh BJP chief Khimi Ram joined the Congress on Tuesday. Ram, a former minister and deputy speaker in the state, said he is not joining the Congress "out of any anger towards BJP". "I have taken a well-thought-out decision to take...Congress forward in Himachal Pradesh," Ram said. He was sworn in at AICC headquarters in New Delhi.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Peace, stability shouldn't be disturbed in Darjeeling: Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday called for peace and stability in Darjeeling. She was speaking at the swearing-in ceremony of the elected members of the Gorkhaland Territorial Administration (GTA), where elections were held after a gap of 10 years. "If few leaders try to instigate violence, don't allow them to do so," Mamata Banerjee said.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: BJP is a 'control-freak', 'dossier-loving' government: Congress MP
text: Congress MP Abhishek Singhvi on Tuesday accused the BJP of being a "control freak" and "dossier loving" government. Singhvi further said the BJP government has created an atmosphere of "fear, trepidation, anxiety and hesitation" among the judicial sector by the misuse of the "dossier raj". "BJP has indulged in several manipulative tactics qua the judiciary," Singhvi added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Never seen such shameless misuse of central agencies: Sinha
text: Opposition candidate for Presidential polls Yashwant Sinha on Tuesday criticised the Central government and said that he's never seen such blatant, shameless misuse of central agencies to fix rivals. He said that elections for the post of President are taking place in troubled conditions, adding that democracy is in grave danger. The economy is badly mismanaged, he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Jharkhand will become leading state if Centre's support continues: CM
text: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren on Tuesday said that the state would be one of the leading states in the next five to seven years if support from the Centre continued. "Jharkhand has been contributing to nation building for years through its minerals, including coal and iron," Soren said, reminding that the state's contribution should not be forgotten.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Country does not need a silent President: Yashwant Sinha
text: Presidential election candidate Yashwant Sinha said that the country does not need a silent president but rather someone who uses moral authority and discretion. Yashwant Sinha is the opposition candidate for the upcoming Presidential polls. Sinha accused the ruling party of misusing central agencies like the CBI against political rivals and said he will stop such acts if elected.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Bless and support me: Droupadi Murmu to YSRCP leaders in Andhra
text: NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu met YSRCP leaders in Andhra Pradesh's Amaravati on Tuesday as part of her election campaign and requested them to bless and support her. "Andhra and Odisha are neighbours and have many similarities in food habits, dress and customs," Murmu said. "I thank Jagan Mohan Reddy for extending support even before I requested," she added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: SAD's youth wing to take out tractor march against ban on 2 songs
text: Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) youth wing Youth Akali Dal has announced that it'll take out a tractor march on Thursday in protest against the Centre's ban on two Punjabi Songs. YAD president Parambans Romana said SAD views the Centre's ban on 'SYL' by late Sidhu Moosewala and 'Rihai' by Kanwar Grewal as an attempt to suppress the voice of Punjabis.
author: Mayukh Debnath

headlines: BJP has nothing to do with 'rebellion' in Goa Congress: Goa CM
text: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Tuesday said the BJP has nothing to do with the "rebellion" in the state Congress Legislature Party. Congress had accused MLA Michael Lobo and former CM Digambar Kamat of "conspiring and hobnobbing" with the ruling BJP to engineer a split in the party's legislative wing. On Sunday, five Congress MLAs in Goa had gone incommunicado.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Sena hasn't extended its support to anyone: NCP on Prez elections
text: Maharashtra NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal on Tuesday said that the Shiv Sena has not extended its support to anyone in the upcoming Presidential elections. "It is yet to make the final decision," Bhujbal said. This comes after Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that the party discussed NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu in their meeting on Monday.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Jaishankar's visit to Kerala aimed at 2024 LS polls: Vijayan
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's three-day visit to the state is aimed at the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "It was heard that...responsibility to ensure BJP's victory in...Lok Sabha seat was entrusted to Jaishankar," Vijayan said. "When...a [foreign] minister [goes] to inspect the flyover at Kazhakuttom, the people can...[see] real intention behind it," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Cong appoints Raj, Chhattisgarh CMs as observers for Guj & HP polls
text: Congress on Tuesday appointed Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot and Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel as senior observers for the upcoming Assembly elections in Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh. TS Singh Deo and Milind Deora have been appointed observers for the Gujarat polls, while Sachin Pilot and Partap Singh Bajwa will be observers for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections, a party statement said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: People trying to break Congress in Goa will fail miserably: Mukul Wasnik
text: Congress leader Mukul Wasnik said the people who tried to break Congress party in Goa "failed miserably". "Some people want to break the MLAs of different political parties, especially Congress...but Congress MLAs have shown them they're going to fail...miserably," Wasnik said. This comes after Congress accused some party leaders of conspiring with BJP to cause defections within the party.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Secretary of Swapna Suresh's NGO arrested for threatening tribals in Kerala
text: Secretary of an NGO named High Range Rural Development Society (HRDS) which had employed Swapna Suresh, the key accused in Kerala's gold smuggling case, was arrested for allegedly threatening tribals in Palakkad. The Sholayur Police arrested the accused, Aji Krishnan, based on a complaint filed by a local tribal member. Notably, Krishnan has been booked under the SC/ST Atrocities Act.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: MNS chief postpones rally with party workers amid heavy rains in Maha
