text: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray has postponed his rally with MNS workers which was scheduled for July 13, due to heavy rains in various parts of Maharashtra. He informed workers that he will soon announce the next date of his rally. He also asked party workers to reach out to the people affected due to heavy rains.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Class 12 student arrested for 'objectionable' FB post on UP CM
text: A Class 12 student has been arrested for allegedly posting an objectionable photograph of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Facebook, police said. The accused, an 18-year-old boy named Ashish Yadav, had allegedly drawn something on the photograph. Police said they've seized his mobile phone and are investigating his other posts. Yadav is a resident of a village in Talgram.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Aren't Muslims Indian natives?: Owaisi on Yogi's 'population' remark
text: AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday criticised UP CM Yogi Adityanath's "population imbalance" remark. "Are Muslims not natives of India? If we see the reality, natives are only tribals and Dravidian(s)," Owaisi said. His remarks come after Yogi said population control measures shouldn't cause imbalance in population growth percentages between 'mool nivasi' (native residents) and other communities.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP leaders should support 'old friend' Sinha in Prez polls: Baghel
text: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Tuesday appealed to the BJP leaders to support "their old friend Yashwant Sinha" in the upcoming Presidential elections. "If the BJP is listening to its inner voice, their old friend (Yashwant Sinha) is the candidate of the Opposition," he said when asked about BJP's appeal to support NDA Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Truck hits vehicle in Suvendu Adhikari's convoy, 2nd such incident since July 1
text: A truck collided with a police vehicle in BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari's convoy near Kolkata's Kalikapur on Monday night, the police said and added that no one was hurt in the accident. Notably, this was the second such incident involving Adhikari's convoy since July 1. The truck driver has been arrested and he will be produced in court today.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: PM violated constitutional norms: Owaisi on PM unveiling National Emblem statue
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised PM Narendra Modi for unveiling bronze statue of India's National Emblem on top of the new Parliament building in Delhi and said that he (PM) violated all constitutional norms. Taking to Twitter, Owaisi said, "As head of government, PM shouldn't have unveiled the National Emblem...Speaker of Lok Sabha represents LS which isn't subordinate to government."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: AAP MP Raghav Chadha appointed Chairman of Punjab advisory panel
text: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has appointed AAP MP Raghav Chadha as the Chairman of a temporary advisory committee to the state government. Chadha will oversee the conception and implementation of pro-people initiatives of the AAP government in the state and advise it on matters of finance, the Chief Minister's Office said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: FIR filed over sexual harassment of Delhi BJP woman spokesperson
text: A case of sexual harassment was filed after Delhi BJP complained that a woman spokesperson of the party was being defamed through a video posted on social media. The party said the video insulted the spokesperson's modesty electronically. The party further alleged that a group of people have been harassing its female spokespersons for the past two to three months.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: CBI files chargesheet against MHA officials in FCRA bribery case
text: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has filed a chargesheet against seven Home Ministry officials, among others, arrested in a Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FCRA) bribery case, officials said. It is alleged that several officials were involved in exchanging bribes for facilitating clearances of foreign donations to NGOs in alleged violation of FCRA rules, officials had earlier said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Ex-Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains surrenders before court in rape case
text: Former Lok Insaaf Party (LIP) MLA Simarjeet Singh Bains on Monday surrendered before a court in Punjab's Ludhiana in connection with a rape case, Joint Commissioner Ravcharan Singh Brar has confirmed. Police took custody of Simarjeet, whose younger brother Karamjit Singh Bains and aide Sukhchain Singh are already in jail in the case.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: 3 senior Congress leaders join Aam Aadmi Party in Uttarakhand
text: Uttarakhand Pradesh Congress spokesman Rajendra Prasad Raturi, Pradesh Mahila Congress vice-president Kamlesh Raman and social media adviser Kuldip Chaudhary on Monday joined Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in Delhi. They were inducted into AAP in presence of Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia. The leaders said they quit Congress as infighting was increasing despite the party's rout in the state Assembly polls.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: PIL filed against Mamata in Calcutta HC over her 'jihad' remark
text: A PIL has been filed at the Calcutta High Court against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee over her comments saying that Trinamool Congress will declare 'jihad' against BJP in the upcoming Martyrs' Day event. State Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar recently wrote to the CM asking her to withdraw her comments. The petitioner's counsel called the comments 'unwarranted.'
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Siddaramaiah accuses Pralhad Joshi of conspiring against Yediyurappa
text: Congress leader Siddaramaiah accused Union Minister Pralhad Joshi of conspiring against BS Yediyurappa and removing him from the post of Karnataka CM. "Yediyurappa, who built BJP in Karnataka, was sent to jail...removed from the post of CM by whose conspiracy? Aren't you (Joshi) into it?" Siddaramaiah remarked. "Who finally removed him from the post of Chief Minister?" he tweeted.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Rising Chinese invasion & PM's silence harmful for country: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that the increasing Chinese infiltration and PM Modi's silence on it are "very harmful" for the country. He also shared five "truths" about PM Modi, alleging that he's afraid of China, hides the truth from the public, lowers the morale of the Army and plays with the security of the country.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Hear us out before taking a call on party symbol: Shiv Sena to EC
text: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena has moved to Election Commission (EC), asking it to hear it out before taking a view on any demands made on the party symbol by the faction led by Eknath Shinde, sources said on Monday. "It is kind of a caveat," an EC functionary said. Last month, nearly 40 MLAs walked out of Shiv Sena.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: 12 Goa Congress MLAs ready to join BJP: CT Ravi
text: BJP General Secretary CT Ravi on Monday claimed that 12 Goa Congress MLAs are ready to leave the party and join BJP. Ravi, who is BJP's in-charge of Goa, added that many Congress leaders and legislators are in contact with the BJP. Congress said it was seeking disqualification of party leaders Michael Lobo and Digambar Kamat from the Goa Assembly.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Will put burden of ₹1,000 cr on govt: AIMIM MP on renaming Aurangabad
text: AIMIM MP Imtiaz Jaleel has criticised the decision to rename Aurangabad, claiming that a Delhi official told him that this puts a "burden of around ₹1,000 crore" on the government. Alleging that people would also have to bear the "burden of several thousand crores", he said, "It's not like [ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray or NCP chief Sharad Pawar]...would..help you."
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Modi is weakest PM; 'undeclared emergency' under his rule: CM KCR
text: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said that PM Narendra Modi is the weakest and most inefficient Indian PM of all time. CM Rao also said that there is an "undeclared Emergency" in India under PM Modi's rule. "During the Congress rule, there was brain-drain. Now, with BJP's policies, there is a capital drain, resulting in depleting forex reserves," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Sena's 16 MPs tell Uddhav to back NDA's President pick Murmu: MP
text: Shiv Sena MP Gajanan Kirtikar said 16 MPs of the party, who had attended a meeting called by Uddhav Thackeray on Monday, requested the former Maharashtra CM to support NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. "She is an NDA candidate but Droupadi Murmu belongs to the tribal community and is a woman," ANI quoted Kirtikar as saying.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Abe killed by ex-serviceman, BJP playing with fire on Agnipath: TMC
text: The TMC has cautioned Centre over new military recruitment scheme Agnipath by pointing out that ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe was assassinated by a short-service ex-serviceman. "BJP is playing with fire in the name of Agnipath...We have seen what...happened in Japan," TMC's Kunal Ghosh said. Abe's attacker reportedly lost his job in Japanese Maritime Self-Defence Force after three years of service.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP should clarify alleged links with Udaipur murder accused: Gehlot
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot alleged that BJP had links with the accused involved in the murder of Kanhaiya Lal in Udaipur and asserted that the party should issue a clarification. Gehlot further asked BJP to respond to allegations of helping one of the accused by requesting the police to drop a case filed against him for not paying rent.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Will not endorse anyone running to replace me as PM: Boris Johnson
text: Britain's caretaker PM Boris Johnson on Monday said that he will not endorse any contender in the race to replace him as the PM as that would damage their chances of winning. He added, "Whoever takes over from me, there is a great agenda to be continued...my job is to continue with the programme on which we were elected."
author: Mayukh Debnath

headlines: We've stable govt, don't need anyone: Goa CM on Cong's defection accusation
text: After AICC Goa in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao said a "conspiracy" was led by two of their leaders by "hobnobbing" with BJP to ensure defection in Congress in Goa, CM Pramod Sawant said, "We don't need anyone, we've a stable government with support of 25 MLAs." Furthermore, he said, "Since they (Congress) have nothing to do, they're doing this blame-game drama."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Keep boxes of stones, pistols in shops: BJP leader to traders on Nupur row
text: Bharatiya Janata Party legislator Vikram Saini, while addressing gathering of traders in Uttar Pradesh, asked them to keep boxes of stones, shovel bents and pistols in their shops. His comments came over ongoing controversy regarding suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Muhammad. "By the time the police come, they set your shops and houses on fire," he added.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Goa Congress MLAs being offered ₹50 cr by BJP to join party: Siddaramaiah
text: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah alleged that BJP is offering ₹50 crores to Goa Congress MLAs and said that by doing this they (BJP) are not believing in democracy. "Not only in Goa, everywhere they do Operation Kamala. They will offer money, they will purchase MLAs," the Congress leader said. It's not possible for BJP to do this in Karnataka, he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Panneerselvam's supporters slap slippers at Palaniswami's photo in Chennai
text: Former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam’s supporters slapped slippers at Edappadi K Palaniswami’s photo as they protested AIADMK’s General Council meeting in Vanagaram, Chennai on Monday. Panneerselvam was expelled from all posts of AIADMK after Palaniswami took control of party as its interim General Secretary. Earlier today, supporters of both leaders clashed near party’s headquarters in Chennai.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Centre should invite Oppn to events related to Parliament: Ex-Cong MP
text: As PM Narendra Modi unveiled the National Emblem on the new Parliament building on Monday, ex-Congress MP Sandeep Dikshit said the Centre should invite Opposition leaders as well to the events and functions related to the Parliament. "The Parliament does not belong to a single party, government or a PM...It belongs to every elected member of the Parliament," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: TDP will back Murmu for Presidential polls: Chandrababu Naidu
text: Telugu Desam Party chief and former Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu said that his party will vote for NDA's Droupadi Murmu in the upcoming Presidential polls. Naidu said that it would be "wonderful to see her [Murmu]" become the first tribal woman President. With this, Andhra Pradesh's two main political parties, YSRCP and TDP, have declared to support Murmu.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: If rising population a threat, why is China doing well: Tejashwi Yadav
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Monday stated that China is ahead of India in terms of the economy and GDP despite being the most populous country. "If the rising population is a threat, then why is China doing so well?" Yadav added. A United Nations report stated that India is projected to become the world's most populous country next year.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: TMC leaders insulted Hindu Gods earlier too: Smriti Irani
text: Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani reacted to TMC MP Mahua Moitra's "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess" remark and said that it is not "impossible" for TMC MP to insult the goddess. "TMC leadership had in the past several times insulted Hindu Gods and Goddesses," she said during her visit to West Bengal's Howrah.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Can't allow mindset of 1 person having 10 children: Giriraj Singh
text: Union Minister Giriraj Singh said that there is an urgent need for a stringent law on population control. "We have limited resources. Our population is expanding like the mouth of Sursa (mythical female demon)," Giriraj said on the occasion of World Population Day. He added, "The perverse mindset out of which one person sires 10 children can not be allowed."
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP looting people's money in name of development: Kumaraswamy
text: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy criticised the BJP-led government in the state and at the Centre by calling it 'pro-rich'. "BJP government is looting people's tax money in the name of development," said Kumaraswamy. He further stated that if poor people are harassed in the country, then we too might witness a response similar to that of Sri Lanka.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Congress MP Manish Tewari refuses to sign Oppn's letter on Agnipath
text: Congress MP Manish Tewari on Monday refused to sign a letter by the Opposition against Agnipath scheme. Tewari, who was one of the seven Opposition MPs to meet Defence Minister Rajnath Singh earlier today, was the only one to not sign letter that sought withdrawal or scrutiny of scheme. Notably, Tewari had earlier termed the scheme "reform in right direction".
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Goa Congress removes Michael Lobo as Leader of Oppn for planning defections to BJP
text: Goa Congress has removed Michael Lobo as the Leader of Opposition with immediate effect, AICC Goa In-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao announced on Sunday. "A conspiracy was hatched by some of our own leaders with BJP to see that the Congress party in Goa is weakened and to engineer defections," Rao said. He said Lobo and Digambar Kamat led the conspiracy.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Palaniswami elected as AIADMK's interim General Secretary, post elections in 4 months
text: During a meeting held on Monday, Edappadi Palaniswami was elected as AIADMK's interim General Secretary. AIADMK General Council has adopted resolutions for reviving the general secretary post. It has also adopted resolutions to ensure electing a person for the post by the primary members of the party. The election will be held 4 months from now, news agency ANI reported.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Disqualify MLAs Michael Lobo, Digambar Kamat: Goa Congress to Speaker
text: The Goa Congress has petitioned the Speaker of the Assembly to disqualify its MLAs Digambar Kamat and Michael Lobo under the anti-defection law. Earlier on Sunday, it removed Lobo as the Leader of Opposition and claimed that a conspiracy was hatched by some of its own leaders with BJP. Reacting to the allegations, Kamat said he was "shocked and stunned".
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: O Panneerselvam expelled from all AIADMK posts as Palaniswami takes charge
text: Former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister O Panneerselvam was on Monday expelled from all posts of the AIADMK after Edappadi K Palaniswami took control of the party as its interim General Secretary. Senior leaders and OPS supporters- JCD Prabhakar, R Vaithilingam and PH Manoj Pandian were also expelled from the AIADMK.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: These are rumours: Cong leader on reports of Goa MLAs joining BJP
text: Goa Congress leader Michael Lobo has denied rumours of any party MLA joining the BJP. "These are all rumours. There's nothing as such. The Assembly session is starting and one rumour has to be spread by somebody or the other," he said. Three Goa Congress MLAs have reportedly skipped a party meeting.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: New forest rules are reformative, we're committed to protect Adivasi rights: Govt
text: After Congress criticised the Forest (Conservation) Rules, 2022, Union Minister Bhupender Yadav said the rules are reformative with an objective to streamline the process of approvals under the Forest Rights Act. He also called Congress' allegations that the rules will disempower tribals "ill-informed" and said, "Government under Narendra Modi ji remains committed to protecting Adivasis' rights."
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Madras HC allows AIADMK meeting for today; rejects Panneerselvam's plea
text: The Madras High Court has given a nod to AIADMK's general council meeting to be held today. The High Court also rejected O Panneerselvam's plea to stall the meeting. The meeting proposes to revive interim general secretary post and abolish coordinator as well as joint coordinator posts. The verdict was delivered on Monday morning.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Defer disqualification pleas against Uddhav, Shinde camps: SC to Maha Speaker
text: The Supreme Court has asked Maharashtra Speaker Rahul Narwekar to defer disqualification petitions pending against both the Eknath Shinde faction and the Uddhav Thackeray camp. "Please inform the Assembly Speaker not to take up the disqualification petitions until this court hears the matter. Matters won't be listed tomorrow but inform the Speaker," Chief Justice of India, NV Ramana, said.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: BJP spokesperson spoke nonsense & our delegates apologised in other countries: KCR
text: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday said that one Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) spokesperson spoke "nonsense" and our delegates and ambassadors apologised in other countries. "Why should the country apologise when BJP has done something wrong?" he asked. Earlier, BJP suspended Nupur Sharma following her remarks on Prophet Muhammad.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: There’re several Eknath Shindes in TRS: Telangana BJP chief
text: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar said there are several "Eknath Shindes" in TRS. "You (KCR) are state’s CM who is saying, BJP doesn’t have any strategy," he added. "He fears that leaders like Eknath Shinde are growing in his own party…Anyone can become Eknath Shinde in his party, it might be his son KTR, daughter or nephew," Kumar stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Centre shouldn't adopt a 'touch-me-not' attitude: Ex-EAM Khurshid
text: Ex-External Affairs Minister Salman Khurshid on Sunday advised Centre against adopting a "touch-me-not" attitude, days after Germany criticised Alt News co-founder Mohammed Zubair's arrest. "If we don't want an adverse opinion we must show the best side of us [to other countries]," Khurshid said. India had called Germany's comments "uninformed" after latter condemned journalists' 'persecution'.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Some people think they are born to rule: Shinde on Uddhav
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said that he was not born with a "golden spoon" and is a common man. Referring to Uddhav Thackeray, he said, "Some people think they are born to rule...They should have felt proud that a common man has assumed the chair." "They are filing petitions...But even the court knows...We haven't done anything illegal," Shinde added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Rumours about me joining BJP spreading since 2017: Digambar Kamat
text: Former Goa CM Digambar Kamat said "rumours" about him joining BJP have been spreading since 2017. "If I wanted to go, I'd have gone. No one can stop me. But still, I led party from the front," he added. "I saw a video of the presser of Dinesh Gundu Rao (Goa AICC in-charge)...It has hurt me beyond words," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Droupadi Murmu to visit Karnataka today to seek legislators' support
text: Droupadi Murmu, the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) candidate for the Presidential elections, will visit Karnataka on July 10, to seek support of the legislators in the state, as per BJP Vice President Nirmal Kumar Surana. Murmu, the former Jharkhand Governor, earlier visited Kolkata and Lucknow to campaign for support. She'll contest against opposition's presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: We're with Congress: Michael Lobo after being removed as Leader of Oppn
text: A day after Goa Congress removed Michael Lobo as the Leader of Opposition (LoP), he said he told Goa AICC in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao that he was not interested in continuing as LoP. "We're with the Congress party," he added. Earlier, Rao said that Lobo and ex-Goa CM Digambar Kamat hatched a "conspiracy" to ensure defection of Congress in Goa.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Grassroot Sainiks still with party despite betrayal: Aaditya
text: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday claimed the grassroot Shiv Sena workers were still with the organisation, despite "betrayal" by those whom the party trusted. "Those who are happy to leave should have the guts to face fresh elections. The doors of 'Matoshree' are open to all those who wish to return," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: TN CM 'anti-Hindu', practices religion-based politics: BJP leader
text: BJP leader K Laxman on Sunday alleged that Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin was "anti-Hindu" and accused him of practising "religion-based politics". "Stalin who always opposes Hindutva should understand that religion is man's belief and faith and PM Narendra Modi has never linked religion with politics," he said. BJP has never done politics based on religion, he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: PM Modi will meet same fate as Sri Lankan Prez Rajapaksa: TMC MLA
text: TMC MLA Idris Ali on Sunday said PM Modi will meet the same fate as Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who was forced to leave his official residence after anti-government protesters stormed into his official residence. According to reports, his remarks came after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee wasn't invited to the inauguration of the Sealdah Metro station in Kolkata.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: MVA allies should contest 2024 state Assembly polls together: Sharad Pawar
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Sunday said it's his personal wish that the three MVA allies, NCP, Shiv Sena and Congress, should fight the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections together. "This is my personal opinion. I'll first have to discuss the issue with my party leaders and talks can then be held with the alliance partners," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP Mahila Morcha member dies by suicide in Kerala, blames BJP leader
text: A BJP Mahila Morcha member died by suicide after hanging herself in her house in Kerala's Palakkad and blamed a local BJP leader in her suicide note, police said. Her brother spoke to a TV channel saying that the leader used her, adding other women are in the same situation. An FIR has been filed and probe has been launched.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: Won't take rest till we make Palaniswami CM of Tamil Nadu: AIADMK leader
text: Soon after Edappadi Palaniswami was elected as AIADMK’s interim General Secretary, ex-state minister and AIADMK leader Natham R Viswanathan said, "We won't take rest till we make E Palaniswami CM of Tamil Nadu." Furthermore, he said, "O Panneerselvam has a dual face. He doesn't want anyone to have a good life." "I'm happy that he is out now," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Uddhav writes to 15 Sena MLAs, thanks them for supporting: Report
text: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray reportedly wrote to 15 Shiv Sena MLAs, thanking them for their support during tough times, without surrendering to the pressure of threats or offers. He also called for a meeting with all Shiv Sena MPs at his residence 'Matoshree,' to take a decision on the next week's Presidential election, the report said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: We are getting oil at cheapest price; states must reduce prices: Jaishankar
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said that states must take some measures to reduce the fuel prices in their respective states. "Oil we are getting is the cheapest available in the global market and this makes our government reduce the price," Jaishankar said. "World today seeing us as a nation which stepped forward during the pandemic," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: New forest conservation rules will disempower tribals: Congress
text: The Congress on Sunday alleged that the new forest conservation rules will disempower crores of 'Adivasis' and others living in forest areas. "Once forest clearance is granted, everything else becomes a mere formality and almost inevitably, no claims will be recognised and settled," said Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh. New rules have been promulgated without any consultation, he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Telangana BJP Chief to resume third phase of padayatra on August 2
text: Telangana's BJP Chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar will resume the third phase of his padayatra, 'Praja Sangrama Yatra', on August 2 for 20 days, BJP general secretary Tarun Chugh announced. He further added that Kumar will sit on a silent protest on Monday regarding issue of Podu lands. To address people's problems, bike rallies will also be organised from July 21.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Lobo, Kamat hatched conspiracy for defection in Cong: Goa AICC in-charge
text: Goa AICC in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao said Michael Lobo, who was removed as LoP and ex-CM Digambar Kamat were hatching a "conspiracy" by "hobnobbing" with BJP to ensure defection in Congress in Goa. "Kamat did it to safeguard his own skin as so many cases are against him, Lobo did it for the sake of power and position," Rao added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Following violence, DMK-led state govt seals AIADMK headquarters in Chennai
text: The AIADMK headquarters, 'MGR Maaligai', in Chennai was sealed by the DMK-led Tamil Nadu government following the violence and vandalism that took place between the supporters of senior party leaders, Edappadi Palaniswami and O Panneerselvam. The action was taken by the revenue and police officials after Panneerselvam walked out of the office saying that he would approach the court.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: SP Founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's wife Sadhna Gupta passes away
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) Founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's wife Sadhna Gupta passed away at a hospital in Gurugram on Saturday. Gupta was reportedly admitted to Medanta hospital, where she was undergoing treatment for a lung disease. She had been ill for a long time and was in the ICU for the last four days, reports further stated.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Andhra CM Jagan Reddy elected lifetime President of YSR Congress
text: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy was on Saturday elected the President for lifetime of the YSR Congress (YSRC) Party. The process was completed on the concluding day of the party's two-day plenary. Jagan established YSRC in March 2011 after quitting the Congress and was last elected the party chief in 2017.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: SP chief Akhilesh's uncle supports NDA prez nominee, calls Akhilesh 'immature'
text: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's uncle Shivpal Yadav has declared support for NDA's presidential nominee Droupadi Murmu. Shivpal, who heads Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia, announced his decision after attending a dinner hosted by UP CM Yogi Adityanath for Murmu. He said he wasn't invited to meet with the opposition's presidential nominee Yashwant Sinha and called Akhilesh "politically immature".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 53 Shiv Sena MLAs of Shinde, Thackeray factions get show-cause notices
text: Maharashtra Legislature Secretary has issued show-cause notices to 53 of the state's 55 Shiv Sena MLAs – 39 of Eknath Shinde-led faction and 14 of Uddhav Thackeray camp. Both factions have accused each other of defying the party whip during the Speaker's election and trust vote on July 3 and 4, respectively, seeking disqualification of the legislators from both sides.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: CBI conducts searches at Cong MP Karti Chidambaram's Chennai house
text: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Saturday conducted searches at the residence of Congress MP Karti Chidambaram in Chennai in connection with the Chinese visa case, officials said. During searches on May 17, a portion of Karti's home was sealed because keys of that portion were not available, officials added. Searches were resumed after the CBI received the keys.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Jaishankar meets Lavrov, Blinken on sidelines of G-20 meet in Bali
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov and US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on the sidelines of the G-20 Foreign Ministers' Conclave in Bali, Indonesia on Friday. Jaishankar discussed the Russia-Ukraine war and other regional issues with the leaders. India has called for diplomacy to end the Russia-Ukraine conflict.
author: Indraneel Sen

headlines: End voting rights for Muslims if they aren't allowed to vote: Khan
text: The right to vote for Muslims should be ended if community members are not allowed to exercise this right, said Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan. His remark came in the backdrop of bypolls for Rampur and Azamgarh Lok Sabha constituencies, during which Muslim voters were harassed and the total voting percentage in the Rampur district was only 32%, claimed Khan.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Congress can even join hands with terrorists to be in power: BJP's Patra
text: Reacting to the Congress party's statement that it will hold nationwide press conferences to counter BJP’s "fake nationalism", BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said that Congress can even join hands with terrorists to be in power. Patra further said that the 10 years of UPA rule were "marked by frequent terror attacks" across India while PM Narendra Modi-led government controlled terrorism.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Muslim society should oppose such incidents vigorously: RSS on Udaipur murder
text: RSS leader Sunil Ambekar on Saturday condemned the killing of a tailor, Kanhaiya Lal, in Udaipur, saying that the Muslim society should come forward and oppose such incidents "vigorously". "The Hindu society is responding in a peaceful and constitutional way. The Muslim society is also expected to oppose such an incident. Some intellectuals have opposed it," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Raids against Karti Chidambaram show CBI has no work to do: TN Cong
text: After the CBI conducted searches at Congress MP Karti Chidambaram's residence in Chennai on Saturday, Tamil Nadu Congress President KS Alagiri said that these raids show that the CBI has got no work to do. "How many times would they raid his house? They have not found anything," Alagiri said. "Congress strongly condemns this," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP trying to poach our MLAs, intimidate them: AICC Goa in-charge
text: AICC Goa in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao on Sunday said, "All the MLAs of Congress party are intact but BJP is trying to poach our MLAs and intimidate them." Furthermore, he said, "Yesterday we had a CLP meeting in Goa…All our MLAs are intact." Meanwhile, Goa Congress leader Michael Lobo refuted the "rumours" that few Congress leaders are joining BJP.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: If elected, would urge govt to resolve Kashmir issue permanently: Sinha
text: Opposition’s Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Saturday said that if elected, he would urge the government to resolve the Kashmir issue permanently and restore peace in the region. "If elected...one of my priorities would be to urge the government to…restore peace, justice, democracy, normalcy and end the hostile development towards Jammu and Kashmir," Sinha added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 5 armed men barge into Haryana Cong MLA's house, beat up his cook
text: Five armed men allegedly barged into Congress MLA Kuldeep Vats' house in Haryana's Pataudi and beat up his cook, police said. Police added that a case has been registered against the accused. "They told me to warn the MLA that he should not make any comments against gangsters or he will face the fate as Sidhu Moosewala," the cook said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Babul Supriyo appointed as Trinamool Congress' national spokesperson
text: Trinamool Congress (TMC) appointed its MLA Babul Supriyo as the national spokesperson of the party. Taking to Twitter, the former union minister thanked TMC chief Mamata Banerjee and TMC's National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee and wrote, "Shall do my very best to live up to the responsibility entrusted upon me." In April, Supriyo won Ballygunge assembly seat on TMC's ticket.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Due to political opportunism, rift being created between communities: Amartya Sen
text: A rift is being created between communities on account of “political opportunism”, Nobel laureate Amartya Sen said on Saturday. "There is an effort to divide Indians…create a rift in the co-existence of Hindus and Muslims on account of political opportunism," Sen added. His statement came during a virtual address at the centenary celebration of ‘Anandabazar Patrika’.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: This is a fight for Mumbai: Aaditya Thackeray at Aarey protest site
text: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray, who joined the protest opposing metro car shed project in Aarey colony today, said that the protest is a fight for Mumbai and fight for life. "We fought for forest and to protect our tribals," he added. During our tenure, we had proposed construction to be turned into a veterinary hospital for jungle, Thackeray said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Impartial judicial system biggest need for democracy: Nitin Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said that an impartial and fair judicial system is the biggest requirement for a free and fair democracy. "During cabinet meetings...I often tell the law minister and prime minister that whatever the decision may be, it is the right of the judiciary to give the decision and it should not be influenced by anybody," he said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Farooq Abdullah demands probe in Amarnath cloudburst incident
text: J&K National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah has demanded an investigation into the Amarnath cloudburst incident, adding that the government should explain what happened and how. Calling the incident unfortunate, he said, "Basis on which tents were put up at such...risky place should be investigated. It's the first time when tents were placed there." Sixteen people have died in the incident.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Those using religion to divide people can't be true spiritualists: TN CM
text: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Saturday said that religion cannot be a tool to divide people and those who cause such a division cannot be true spiritualists. Addressing a gathering in Tiruvannamalai, Stalin said, "I don't care about those who utter lies and seek cheap publicity. Even you should not care but move on to embrace development."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Congress expresses solidarity with Sri Lanka and its people: Sonia Gandhi
text: A day after the protests against economic crisis reached a peak in Sri Lanka, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Sunday issued a statement, saying the Congress party expresses its solidarity with Sri Lanka and its people in this moment of grave crisis. "We hope that India will continue to assist the people and government of Sri Lanka," the statement read.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Uma Bharti writes to BJP chief Nadda against MP's new liquor policy
text: BJP leader and ex-CM of Madhya Pradesh Uma Bharti wrote to party President JP Nadda urging him to ensure that action is taken against Madhya Pradesh government's new liquor policy. "I do not go against party's set of rules, but I do not compromise with subjects that are related with my faith," Bharti said in her letter.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Will try to bring 'achhe din' in lives of common citizens: Maharashtra CM
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Saturday said he will use his CM’s post to give justice to the people of the state and will try to bring "achhe din" in common citizens' lives. "We will take forward the Hindutva of Balasaheb and teachings of Dharmveer Anand Dighe," Shinde added. He was addressing a public gathering in Pune.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Ensure cows are not slaughtered on Bakri Eid: Maha Speaker to DGP
text: Maharashtra Assembly Speaker Rahul Narwekar wrote to state DGP, Rajnish Seth, instructing him that the police should ensure that cows are not slaughtered on the day of Bakri Eid on July 10. Earlier, Karnataka Animal Husbandry Minister Prabhu Bhamla Chavan urged people to not slaughter cattle for Bakri Eid and warned stern action against offenders.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Andhra CM Jagan Reddy elected as YSR Congress' lifetime President
text: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy was elected as the lifetime President of his party, Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress (YSRC). The announcement was made on the concluding day of the YSRC's two-day plenary. Notably, the party's constitution was amended to enable CM Jagan for the post, especially after his mother, Vijayamma, had quit as YSRC's honorary President.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: My govt will complete its tenure, we'll even win next poll: Shinde
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Saturday said that his government will complete its tenure, adding, "We'll even win next election." While speaking at a press conference, he said that it is only the natural alliance of the BJP and Shiv Sena that can take Maharashtra ahead. Earlier today, BJP chief JP Nadda held a meeting with Shinde on cabinet expansion.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: We're moving towards gaining 100% results on issues of national consensus: Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that we are moving towards achieving 100% results on issues that require building a national consensus. "He said although the role of the (zonal) council is advisory, he is happy that in his three years of experience, over 75% of issues in the (zonal) council have been resolved by consensus," an official statement said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Tsunami of unemployment has hit the nation under BJP's rule: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday took to Twitter and alleged, "Under the BJP's rule, the prices of domestic LPG cylinders went up by 157%, fuel prices broke all records and the 'Gabbar Tax loot' and a 'tsunami of unemployment' hit the country." "[Public] is telling PM Narendra Modi...these obstacles created by you have exhausted us, now stop," Gandhi added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Andhra CM Reddy's mother quits YSR Cong Party to support daughter in T'gana
text: YS Vijayamma, mother of Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, on Friday resigned as the honorary president of the ruling YSR Congress Party. Vijayamma said she will now support her daughter YS Sharmila, who is heading the YSR Telangana Party in the neighbouring state. "My daughter is fighting alone. If I don’t support her, it'll be injustice," Vijayamma added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: He was a friend of India: Sitharaman on demise of Japan's ex-PM Abe
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has expressed grief over the demise of former PM of Japan Shinzo Abe. In a tweet on Friday, Sitharaman said, "Express my profound grief on the tragic demise of...Shinzo Abe. He was a friend of India and we held him in great regard." Abe died after being shot while delivering a speech in Japan's Nara city.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: ED raids 18 places linked to J'khand CM Soren's close aide over tender scam
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday conducted raids at 18 locations in Jharkhand as part of a money-laundering investigation against MLA Pankaj Mishra, a close aide of Chief Minister Hemant Soren, officials said. The raids were conducted in connection with an alleged scam carried out while availing marketplace tender in Sahibganj's Barharwa in 2020.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: ED summons Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's wife in money laundering case
text: The Enforcement Directorate on Friday issued summons to Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's wife Poonam Jain to appear before it at its headquarters for questioning on July 14 in connection with a money laundering case. This comes months after the ED arrested Satyendar Jain on May 30 in connection with alleged hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Stalin congratulates PT Usha, Ilaiyaraaja on Rajya Sabha nomination
text: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has extended greetings to athlete PT Usha and music icon Ilaiyaraaja on their Rajya Sabha nomination. "Congratulations to PT Usha on being nominated to the Council of States," Stalin tweeted. Stalin also congratulated the music maestro for his upcoming stint in the Rajya Sabha. Ilaiyaraaja thanked Stalin for the wishes.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Extend support to NDA's Prez candidate Murmu: Shiv Sena MP to Uddhav
text: Shiv Sena MP Rajendra Gavit has urged party chief Uddhav Thackeray to support Droupadi Murmu's candidature in the Presidential election. Gavit, who belongs to a tribal community, is the second Sena MP to suggest that the party back NDA's Presidential candidate. It would be an honour if a tribal person became the President, Gavit said in a letter to Thackeray.
author: Shailesh

headlines: TMC delegation meets Governor over Dilip Ghosh's remarks against Mamata
text: An eight-member delegation of TMC, including party's leader Kunal Ghosh, met Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Thursday, seeking action against BJP leader Dilip Ghosh for his alleged derogatory comments against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. Governor Dhankhar has assured the TMC delegation that he will look into the matter. Ghosh had allegedly made some remarks about Banerjee's family during an event.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Cong has misused Gandhi's name; brought country to a sorry state: CM Bommai
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has accused Congress of misusing Mahatma Gandhi's name and bringing the country to a sorry state. "Congress is in the position of a convict. They bowed to lobbies...They do not have the moral right to preach to others," CM Bommai said. "There are more such scams which Congress has buried. They would be exposed," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Deeply saddened by demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday expressed condolences and said that he's "deeply saddened" by the demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe. "[Abe's] role in strengthening...strategic relationship between India and Japan was commendable," he added. He further said that Abe has left behind a "lasting legacy in...Indo-Pacific". Abe died after being shot while delivering a speech in Nara city.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Cong has been constantly attacking constitutional institutions: Rijiju
text: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju criticised Congress and said the party has been constantly attacking constitutional institutions from the beginning. "Don't forget that people of India are not servants of anyone," Rijiju tweeted. Rijiju's comment comes a day after Congress' Abhishek Singhvi accused the BJP of promoting personal attacks on Supreme Court judges.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Dare TMC to arrest me: BJP's Dilip Ghosh on remarks on WB CM
text: West Bengal BJP leader Dilip Ghosh dared the TMC government to arrest him for his comments on Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. "TMC is falling on the feet of the governor so that I can be arrested. They are shameless!" Ghosh tweeted. Ghosh's comment comes after a TMC delegation met Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar and sought action against him.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP bags 102 of 130 panchayat seats unopposed in Arunachal Pradesh
text: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has won 102 out of 130 seats unopposed in the gram panchayat elections in Arunachal Pradesh. Other 14 seats were bagged by Congress, National People's Party (NPP) and independent candidates. Chief Minister Pema Khandu thanked all BJP supporters on Twitter and said, "Congratulations and thanks to all karyakartas, supporters and sympathisers."
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Sachin Pilot meets family of tailor killed in Udaipur; shares pics
text: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Friday met the family members of tailor Kanhaiya Lal, who was beheaded in Udaipur for allegedly supporting suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. He also shared pictures of the meeting. Calling the incident a "barbaric massacre", he added that the "pain and anguish" that Kanhaiya's family is going through can't be expressed in words.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: BJP wants to finish Shiv Sena: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena's Member of Parliament (MP) Sanjay Raut on Friday accused the BJP of trying to destroy Shiv Sena. "BJP doesn't want to engineer a split in the Shiv Sena, but it wants to finish the party," he said. "Till the time Shiv Sena exists, they cannot realise their dream of breaking Maharashtra into three pieces," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: 32 Sena corporators from Navi Mumbai meet Shinde, extend support
text: As many as 32 Shiv Sena corporators from Navi Mumbai met with Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday and extended their support to him. This comes after 66 of the party's corporators from Thane joined Shinde's camp. "[Shinde] never declined anybody's phone call. Even if an ordinary party worker calls him up, he receives...call," the Navi Mumbai corporators said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Ex-Sena MLA, 8 policemen booked for assaulting Dalit man in Pune
text: Former Shiv Sena MLA Mahadev Babar and eight police personnel have been booked for allegedly assaulting a Dalit man during a bandh last year in Pune. Babar and some others had reportedly forced the complainant to shut his sister's fish stall and thrashed him. Later, when the complainant went to Kondhwa police station, the accused police officers apparently beat him.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Saddened to know about demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe: Kejriwal
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal expressed condolences and said he is saddened to know about the demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe. "The world has lost a great leader. May the departed soul rest in peace," Kejriwal tweeted. Shinzo Abe was shot while delivering a speech in the city of Nara.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: No one can take away Sena's 'bow & arrow' symbol: Uddhav Thackeray
text: Maharashtra's former CM and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said the 'bow and arrow' symbol will always remain with the party. "There's a discussion going on about the party's symbol. As per the law, no one can take away 'bow and arrow' from Shiv Sena," he added. Thackeray further demanded that mid-term elections should be held in Maharashtra.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Centre creating 'economic blockade' for West Bengal: CM Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday claimed that the central government is creating an "economic blockade" for the state by not releasing funds for MGNREGA and other schemes. "UGC grants have also been stopped and is causing trouble to PhD students doing research," Mamata added. She was speaking at a programme held to distribute students' credit cards in Kolkata.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Extreme unemployment: Chidambaram on applications received under Agnipath
text: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday said that "extreme unemployment situation" in the country was the reason behind the Indian Air Force (IAF) receiving 7.5 lakh applications under Agnipath scheme. "Wrong conclusion: the Agniveer scheme is popular among...youth," he tweeted, adding that the correct conclusion would be the unemployment, which is driving desperate youth to take any job.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: BJP shouldn't teach Bengalis how to worship Goddess Kali: Moitra
text: TMC MP Mahua Moitra reacted to BJP criticising her remarks on Goddess Kali, saying that they "shouldn't teach Bengalis how to worship" the goddess. BJP should stop imposing its "version of Hinduism...based on established norms of North India" on other parts of India, she added. Earlier, Moitra said that to her, "Goddess Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess."
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Govt has fulfilled 95% of promises made before 2019 polls: Andhra CM
text: YSR Congress President and Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Friday said that his government has fulfilled 95% of the promises made ahead of the 2019 elections. Speaking at the YSRCP's plenary in Amaravati, Jagan Reddy claimed that his government has shown how an administration can be run in a transparent and a corruption-free manner.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: After being acquitted of murder, BJP leader holds roadshow in UP; booked
text: A BJP leader and his supporters were booked for allegedly holding a roadshow from Etah district jail to Aligarh in Uttar Pradesh without administration's permission. The roadshow was taken out on Thursday, a day after the BJP leader was acquitted of murdering a man during 2020 CAA-NRC protest. "There were around 30 to 35 vehicles in...procession," a police officer said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: My political & social tenure is not yet over: Naqvi after resignation
text: Senior BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi, who resigned as Union Minority Affairs Minister recently, said his political journey is not yet over. "I understand that my tenure in Rajya Sabha has been completed, but my political and social tenure has not yet been completed," he said. "I will continue to work with dedication and concern for society," Naqvi added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Pained to learn about assassination of Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe: Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday expressed grief over the assassination of former PM of Japan, Shinzo Abe. Taking to Twitter, Shah said, "Pained to learn about the assassination of...India's valued friend, Shinzo Abe. His efforts in strengthening...India-Japan relationship will always be held fondly in our memories." "My deepest condolences to his family...and...people of Japan," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Waiting for divorce from Akhilesh Yadav-led SP: SBSP chief
text: Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party chief Om Prakash Rajbhar on Friday said he will not initiate any steps to break SBSP's alliance with the Samajwadi Party and that he is waiting for "talaq" (divorce) from Akhilesh Yadav-led SP. Rajbhar added that he is "still with the SP, but will not remain together forcefully if Akhilesh Yadav doesn't want it".
author: Shailesh

headlines: Lalu Prasad Yadav's health is improving: Daughter Misa Bharti
text: RJD leader Misa Bharti tweeted that the health of her father Lalu Prasad Yadav is improving. She also shared some photos of the RJD chief from hospital and wrote, "Lalu Ji's condition is much better...because of his morale and your prayers. Please don't pay attention to rumours." Lalu was hospitalised with severe injuries and airlifted to Delhi's AIIMS on Wednesday.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: 66 Shiv Sena corporators from Thane join Maha CM Shinde's camp
text: As many as 66 Shiv Sena corporators from Thane, led by former mayor Naresh Muske, visited Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's official residence at Nandanvan and joined his camp. Former Amravati Lok Sabha MP, Anandrao Vithoba Adsul, also resigned as a Sena leader. Shiv Sena is currently divided into two camps, one led by Uddhav Thackeray and the other by Shinde.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: TMC's Mahua posts 'Be careful, Mahua!' poem by citizen after FIR over Goddess Kali remark
text: TMC MP Mahua Moitra took to Twitter to share a poem 'Be careful, Mahua!' reportedly written for her by a citizen of India after FIRs were filed against her in West Bengal and Madhya Pradesh over her remarks on Goddess Kali. Moitra had said that Goddess Kali ate meat and accepted alcohol. TMC had condemned Moitra's remarks.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Siddaramaiah's govt was unresponsive to many scams: K'taka CM Bommai
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said the government led by Congress leader Siddaramaiah was unresponsive to many scams related to recruitment tests and PU (pre-university) exams. "It was a government that covered up many such scams," Bommai added. The scam related to PU exams, involving ₹18 crore, was buried without taking any action against the culprits, Bommai alleged.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Kamal Nath threatened police, administration during his term: MP CM
text: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Wednesday said former CM Kamal Nath used to threaten police and administration during his term and continues to do so. "They've understood that Congress...lost badly and...the defeat has to be blamed on someone," Chouhan added. His comments came after Kamal Nath accused BJP of using police, money and administration for civic polls.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: BJP sending army of trolls to spread false info about SC judges: Cong
text: The Congress accused BJP of promoting personal attacks on Supreme Court judges and making campaigns to pressurise and influence free decision-making of the judiciary. "An army of trolls is sent out by BJP to fabricate and disseminate false information about the judges and altered photos are published to suggest a false closeness with Congress leaders," party spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: KCR didn't deliver promises, insulted PM with arrogance: BJP leader
text: BJP leader Gudur Narayana Reddy on Wednesday said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao failed in delivering promises and also accused him of insulting PM Narendra Modi with sheer arrogance. Reddy said that KCR has shown utter disrespect by not receiving PM Modi at the airport and for not taking part in the programmes being attended by the PM.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Everything I tweet is my personal opinion, I don't have any other kind: Tharoor
text: Congress' Shashi Tharoor said everything he tweets is his personal opinion. "I don't have any other kind," he tweeted. This comes after he said he was taken aback by "attack" on TMC's Mahua Moitra over her remark on goddess Kaali. Meanwhile, Congress' Ragini Nayak said, "Shashi Tharoorji expresses his personal opinions assertively and has done same on this issue too."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Stop digging roads during rains or else we'll protest: MNS to PMC
text: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has demanded that the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) should immediately stop digging city roads during the rainy season, warning that the party will resort to holding protests otherwise. "Despite the arrival of monsoon, PMC has dug up roads in many areas...causing traffic snarls and public inconvenience," MNS leader Babu Wagaskar said.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Form welfare board for autorickshaw, taxi drivers: Sena MLA to Shinde
text: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Uday Samant on Thursday urged Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde to form a board for the welfare of autorickshaw and taxi drivers in the state on the lines of Tamil Nadu. In a letter to Shinde, Samant said the move will benefit 8.32 lakh licensed autorickshaw and 90,000 taxi drivers and owners.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP chose Murmu as Prez candidate to gain tribal votes: Medha Patkar
text: Social activist Medha Patkar claimed that the BJP has fielded Droupadi Murmu as NDA's Presidential candidate only because tribal community forms a major part of the vote bank. "They cannot claim to be pro-Adivasi by not granting them forest rights and planning to hand over forests to the corporates," she said. The Presidential election will be held on July 18.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Religious conversion of Hindus stopped: Goa CM on completing 100 days in office
text: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said religious conversions of Hindus in the state stopped within 100 days of his government assuming office. "Our government has taken a tough stance on religious conversion...Religious conversions happening for years have been stopped," he added. Furthermore, he said, "We formed SIT to look into illegal land acquisition matter."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Uddhav still Sena chief, rebel group doesn't have recognition: MP
text: Shiv Sena MP Arvind Sawant on Thursday asserted that Uddhav Thackeray continues to be the Sena chief and stated that the rebel group doesn't have any recognition. "Even if two-thirds of the MLAs go, Uddhav Thackeray remains the Sena chief and according to law, only he is the one who can appoint a leader of the legislature party," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Apologise to Delhi people for calling them thieves: AAP to LG
text: AAP on Thursday accused Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena of calling Delhi people "thieves" and demanded an apology for asking people to pay taxes to the civic body "honestly". "By the grace of God, you (LG) are sitting in a very responsible position. Delhi people only want cleanliness. There is no problem in paying taxes," said AAP's Durgesh Pathak.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Happy that he has resigned: KJ Alphons on Saji Cherian's resignation
text: BJP MP KJ Alphons has said that he is happy that Saji Cherian has resigned after the latter resigned from the Kerala Cabinet. "It's [a] shame that the ministers feel they can desecrate the Constitution of India," KJ Alphons said. Saji Cherian resigned on Wednesday amid protests over his remarks on the Constitution.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Kejriwal wishes Mann on his marriage, says he is embarking on new journey
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal reached Punjab's Mohali on Thursday morning to take part in Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's wedding ceremony and congratulated Mann for his "new journey". "He is embarking on a new journey today, I wish him a happy married life," Kejriwal said. Mann will get married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur in a private ceremony in Chandigarh.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: FIR against AAP MLA for assaulting 2 men over sewage complaint
text: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Akhilesh Pati Tripathi was booked for allegedly assaulting two men in Delhi's Ashok Vihar area. One of the victims, Guddu Halwai, claimed that he met the AAP lawmaker during a function and complained about sewage problems in the area which angered the MLA who reportedly hit him on his head with a piece of brick.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Other Muslims are Assamese too: Assam CM on indigenous status to 5 Muslim communities
text: After Assam cabinet granted indigenous status to five Assamese-speaking Muslim communities, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said other Muslims are Assamese too and shouldn't worry. "They are Goria, Moriya, Deshi, Julah and Syed," state Health Minister Keshab Mahanta said earlier. This will ensure their development in health, education, skill development and women empowerment, Sarma said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: We make mistakes, can be rectified: Mamata after Mahua faces FIR over her remark
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said, "We make mistakes while working but they can be rectified." Her statement comes at a time when TMC's Mahua Moitra is facing FIRs over her remarks on Goddess Kali. "Some people don't see all the good work and suddenly start shouting...Negativity affects our brain cells so let's think positively," she added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Madras HC dismisses pleas against ex-CM Edappadi Palaniswami
text: The Madras High Court on Thursday dismissed contempt applications against former Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami for allegedly disregarding its June 23 orders. The pleas were dismissed as the Supreme Court stayed the June 23 orders, which restrained the AIADMK from passing resolutions on its leadership. Palaniswami's supporters are pushing for him to be the party's top leader.
author: Indraneel Sen

headlines: My political tenure not yet completed: Naqvi after resigning as Union Minister
text: A day after resigning as the Union Cabinet Minister of Minority Affairs, Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Thursday said that his political and social tenure has not yet been completed. “I understand that my tenure in Rajya Sabha has been completed...I will continue to work with dedication and concern for society,” he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Don't understand why PM Modi is not appealing for peace: Rajasthan CM
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that if PM Narendra Modi would have appealed to the nation the incidents of violence would not have happened. "We are repeatedly appealing to PM Modi to give a message of peace and unity to nation as it will have an impact," he said. "Who is his advisor giving him such advice?" he questioned.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Eknath Shinde officially takes charge as Maharashtra CM
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde formally took charge of his post at the state secretariat Mantralaya in Mumbai on Thursday. A 'puja' was held at the office of the CM before Shinde took charge. On Monday, the Shinde-led state government proved its majority in the Assembly as it surpassed the majority mark of 144.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: File your FIRs, will see you in every court in land: Mahua on her remark
text: Following her remark on goddess Kaali, TMC's Mahua Moitra said, "I do not want to live in an India where BJP's monolithic, patriarchal [and] brahminical view of Hinduism will prevail and rest of us will tiptoe around religion." Furthermore, she tweeted, "I'll defend this till I die. File your FIRs - will see you in every court in land."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Murmu as President a matter of pride for country: Maha CM Eknath Shinde
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said tribal community member Droupadi Murmu's nomination for the Presidential election is a matter of pride for our country. "PM Modi has given an opportunity to Murmu to become the...President. It's a matter of pride and honour," he said. "I am also proud that a tribal community member has been nominated for the post," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Bagga sends flowers to CM Mann on getting married, shares screenshot
text: BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga sent flower bouquet to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on his wedding. He posted the screenshot of his order worth ₹568 on his Twitter handle and wrote, "Sent flowers and Best wishes message to Bhagwant Mann ji on his wedding." Bagga had earlier criticised CM Mann for spending on advertisements of Punjab government's paperless budget.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Won't stop work on Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project: CM Ashok Gehlot
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said his government won't stop work on the Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project (ERCP). His comments came after Jal Shakti Ministry asked Rajasthan government to hold the project citing "lack of consent on interstate issues". "Water is [of] the state...the catchment area is ours...who're you to tell us to stop the project?" Gehlot further said.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: BJP demands ban on PFI after police arrest 4 party activists in T'gana
text: BJP's Telangana unit has urged the Union Home Ministry to ban the Popular Front of India (PFI) after four party activists were arrested in Nizamabad. "The PFI agenda confessed by...arrested suspects...is extremely unsettling and dangerous to the religious harmony...of this nation," said BJP's chief spokesperson K Krishna Sagar Rao, while calling it a "serious plot to destabilise the society''.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Kerala Minister Saji Cherian resigns amid protest over anti-Constitution remark
text: Kerala Culture Minister Saji Cherian on Wednesday announced his resignation from the state Cabinet amid protests over his remarks on the Constitution. He had said that the Indian Constitution endorses the exploitation and loot of the common people. He later expressed regret and said, "I respect our Constitution...The news that I criticised the Constitution is twisted."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: RCP Singh resigns as minister from PM Modi's Cabinet
text: RCP Singh submitted his resignation as the Union Minister of Steel to Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday. Singh is a minister in the Modi Cabinet from the JD(U) quota. Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi has also resigned as the Union Cabinet Minister of Minority Affairs. This comes a day ahead of their Rajya Sabha term getting over.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Bring it on BJP, I'm not afraid of police: Mahua on complaints over Goddess Kali remark
text: After the BJP filed several police complaints against TMC MP Mahua Moitra for her remarks on Goddess Kali, she tweeted, "Bring it on BJP!" Moitra added, "Am a Kali worshipper. I am not afraid of anything. Not your ignoramuses. Not your goons. Not your police. And most certainly not your trolls." She also wrote, "Truth doesn't need back up forces."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: We've reached a stage where one can't say anything on religion: Tharoor on Mahua's remark
text: Following a controversy over TMC MP Mahua Moitra's remarks on Goddess Kali, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "We've reached a stage where no one can say anything publicly about any aspect of religion without someone claiming to be offended." Tharoor said he was taken aback by the attack on Moitra as Hindus know that forms of worship vary across India.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: PM Modi's weak China policy will cost India for decades: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said that PM Narendra Modi's weak China policy will cost India for decades. His response came after the Centre approved 80 foreign direct investment proposals from Chinese entities. "After restricting Chinese investments in India, Modi has now done a u-turn and started approving FDI proposals from China," he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Congress denied probe into Shyama Prasad Mukherjee's death: JP Nadda
text: BJP National President JP Nadda, on the birth anniversary of Shyama Prasad Mukherjee, said the Congress denied an inquiry into the "mysterious" death of the leader. "Only Congress and Nehru know why...inquiry was not conducted," Nadda added. He further lauded PM Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah for scrapping Article 370 in J&K, calling it a "true tribute" to Mukherjee.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Taken aback by attack on Moitra; urge people to 'lighten up': Tharoor
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said he is "taken aback by the attack" on Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra for her comments on Goddess Kaali. He also urged people to "lighten up and leave religion" to individuals to practise privately. "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess," Moitra had previously said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Shiv Sena nominates Rajan Vichare as its chief whip in Lok Sabha
text: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena has nominated Rajan Vichare as its chief whip in Lok Sabha replacing Bhavana Gawali. She was one of the party MPs to suggest that Shiv Sena ally with the BJP. Earlier in the day, Sena MLA Gulabrao Patil claimed that 12 party MPs would soon join the faction led by CM Eknath Shinde.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: SC stays Madras HC order on AIADMK leadership issue
text: The Supreme Court has stayed the Madras High Court's order which stopped the AIADMK from passing resolutions on the party's single leadership issue. The apex court was responding to a plea filed by former Chief Minister Edappadi Palaniswami. The Supreme Court stay aids the dominant faction within the AIADMK which is pushing for Palaniswami to be the party's top leader.
author: Indraneel Sen

headlines: Is this cost of toppling Maharashtra govt: Congress on LPG price hike
text: All India Mahila Congress on Wednesday, while referring to the price hike of LPG cylinders, asked Centre if it was a cost of toppling the state government in Maharashtra. This comes days after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde won a confidence vote in the state Assembly. Notably, the price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder was increased by ₹50 on Wednesday.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Insult of Hindu deities won't be tolerated: MP CM to Mahua Moitra
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan criticised TMC MP Mahua Moitra for her "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess" remark and said that she has hurt Hindu religious sentiments. "Insult of Hindu deities will not be tolerated at any cost," Chouhan added. Meanwhile, a case was registered in Bhopal against Moitra for hurting religious sentiments.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Shinde's wife plays drums as he reaches home 1st time after becoming CM
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's wife Lata Shinde played drums along with other musicians to welcome her husband home as he reached his residence first time after becoming the Chief Minister. In a video shared by news agency ANI, Lata can be seen smiling and playing drums. Several other people behind her can also be seen playing drums.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Droupadi ji will represent a new India: Meghalaya CM
text: Extending support to NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said she will represent a new India. "She represents hope for every tribal, every girl and every woman and will carry with her the aspirations of small communities of India," Sangma tweeted. Droupadi Murmu, who visited Meghalaya, sought support of the lawmakers for the upcoming Presidential elections.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Delhi Congress leader Tarvinder Singh Marwah joins BJP
text: Congress leader Tarvinder Singh Marwah, who was an MLA for three terms in the Delhi Assembly, joined the BJP on Wednesday. Speaking to reporters, Marwah criticised Congress leadership for allegedly ignoring longtime members and appealed to all the G-23 leaders of Congress to join BJP. He further praised PM Narendra Modi, saying that there has been no PM like him.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP wins 102 of 130 panchayat seats unopposed in Arunachal
text: The BJP has won unopposed 102 of 130 panchayat seats in Arunachal Pradesh where by-polls are scheduled next week, said state Panchayat Minister Bamang Felix. The Congress, National People's Party and Independents have secured another 14 seats unopposed. The by-election to the remaining seats will be held on July 12.
author: Indraneel Sen

headlines: Modi ji's gift to Indian households: KTR on LPG price hike
text: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led central government for the increase in gas cylinder prices and said it was Modi ji's gift to all Indian households. "LPG over ₹1,050. An increase again of ₹50," he tweeted. His comment comes after the price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder was increased by ₹50 today.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Headlines managed, economy mismanaged: Rahul after LPG price hike
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the Centre over the price hike of LPG cylinders by ₹50 and accused the BJP government of managing headlines, but mismanaging the economy. He added that in 2014, inflation used to be the headline, but now there's no discussion of the LPG price hike, even when it has become costlier by ₹50.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Punjab cabinet approves 300 units of free electricity to every household
text: The Punjab cabinet on Wednesday approved the decision to provide 300 units of free electricity to every household in the state. Taking to Twitter, CM Bhagwant Mann said, "We had guaranteed the people of Punjab that we will give 300 units electricity free of cost as soon as we form government. This decision has been approved by the cabinet today."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Told Uddhav we aren't getting any benefit from MVA: CM Shinde
text: Maharashtra's newly appointed CM Eknath Shinde said that he had told former CM Uddhav Thackeray that they [Shiv Sena] are not getting any benefit from Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA). "Despite our party's CM, we came at number four in Nagar Panchayat [polls]...We tried but we didn't succeed [in making him understand]," Shinde said on Wednesday.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Spirit of our culture can't be trivialised by anybody: Singhvi on Mahua's remark
text: Congress leader Abhishek Singhvi reacted to TMC's Mahua Moitra's remark on goddess Kaali, saying that people must be careful when they "play" with emotions of people, which are reflected in such symbols, culture and faith. "Heart and spirit of our culture cannot be trivialised by anybody, anywhere be it elsewhere, abroad or here," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: After Maha, BJP will now form govts in Raj, WB: Suvendu Adhikari
text: After rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde-led new government was formed in Maharashtra, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said, "After Maharashtra, BJP will form governments even in Rajasthan, West Bengal and Telangana where appeasement politics is rampant." His remarks came a day after BJP Tamil Nadu chief K Annamalai said that Tamil Nadu is also waiting for a 'Shinde' to emerge.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Pair of Shinde, Fadnavis to make Maha prosper: Fadnavis' wife Amruta
text: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis' wife Amruta Fadnavis said that the "ED pair", CM Eknath Shinde and Devendra Fadnavis, will make the state prosper with their hard work. "Difficult situations change but strong people always last," Amruta added. On Tuesday, state Deputy CM said, "We'll work round the clock to make Maharashtra the number one state in [India]."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: I don't think Uddhav-led Sena expects us to return to them: Shinde
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Wednesday ruled out the possibility of going back to Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena. CM Shinde said, "I don't think they (Uddhav Thackeray faction) [expect] us to return to them especially after the way they are accusing us." Talking about forming government with BJP in Maharashtra, Shinde said he did not repent for his decision.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Hold Goa Panchayat polls in 45 days: SC upholds Bombay HC order
text: The Supreme Court upheld Bombay High Court's order which asked that a notification be issued to hold elections to 186 Panchayats in Goa within the next 45 days. The Goa government filed a plea requesting an extension till September to conduct the polls. The apex court said that it did not find a reason to interfere in the election process.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Lalu Prasad Yadav to be shifted to Delhi, Bihar CM meets him at Patna hospital
text: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who fractured his shoulder after falling off stairs, will be shifted to Delhi, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said. Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Wednesday met the RJD chief at Paras Hospital in Patna, where he has been admitted currently. "If situation calls for us to take him to Singapore, we will," Tejashwi added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Tamil Nadu waiting for an Eknath Shinde: State BJP chief Annamalai
text: Following a change of regime in Maharashtra, state BJP chief K Annamalai said that Tamil Nadu is also gearing up for a cabinet shuffle. "Tamil Nadu cabinet headed by DMK leader M K Stalin is also...waiting for an Eknath Shinde to emerge," he claimed. DMK, however, described Annamalai's comments as "insignificant" and said "the party is not taking him seriously".
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: LPG costliest for Indians while unemployment at peak: Varun Gandhi
text: BJP MP Varun Gandhi said that at a time when unemployment is at its peak, Indians have to buy LPG at the highest price in the world. The statement comes after domestic LPG cylinder's price was increased by ₹50. "The connection cost increased from ₹1,450 to ₹2,200," Gandhi said. "The poor's kitchen is filling with smoke again," he added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Several police complaints filed against Mahua Moitra over her remarks on Goddess Kali
text: Several police complaints have been filed against TMC MP Mahua Moitra by the BJP across West Bengal over her remarks on Goddess Kali. Moitra had said, "For me, Goddess Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess." After a controversy erupted over her statement on the goddess, she tweeted, "I never backed any film or poster or mentioned the word smoking."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: I express my deep regret: Kerala minister on anti-Constitution remarks
text: Kerala minister Saji Cherian on Tuesday expressed "deep regret" for his controversial statements criticising the Constitution, saying his remarks were "misinterpreted". "I respect our Constitution...The news that I criticised the Constitution is twisted," he added. Earlier today, Cherian had said that the Indian Constitution was written in a way that can be used to "exploit" people.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Vijay Kumar Janjua appointed Chief Secretary of Punjab
text: The Punjab government has appointed Vijay Kumar Janjua as Chief Secretary to the Government of Punjab and in addition, Principal Secretary of the Department of Personnel and Vigilance. Earlier, the position was held by Anirudh Tewari. Tewari has now been posted as the Director General of Mahatma Gandhi State Institute of Public Administration.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Couldn't take decisions on Dawood Ibrahim, Mumbai blasts in MVA govt: CM Shinde
