text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said, "Shiv Sena, BJP contested 2019 Assembly elections together but...government was formed with Congress and NCP...whenever issues of Hindutva...Savarkar...Mumbai blasts...[and] Dawood came up...we were unable to take a decision." He also said, "We have decided to take our Hindu Hriday Samrat Balasaheb Thackeray's Hindutva ideology further."
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: UDF protests outside Kerala Assembly over minister's remarks on Constitution
text: The opposition UDF led by Congress on Wednesday held a protest outside Kerala Assembly against state minister Saji Cherian's remarks on the Indian Constitution. "What Cherian said is not acceptable and [CM Pinarayi] Vijayan should ask for his resignation," said VD Satheesan, Leader of Opposition in the Assembly. Notably, Cherian had said that the Constitution exploits working-class people.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Cong has no right to demand HM's resignation over PSI scam: K'taka CM
text: Criticising Congress for demanding Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra's resignation over his alleged involvement in the Police Sub-Inspector recruitment scam, CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said the opposition party has no "moral right". It is only because of Jnanendra's honesty and efficiency that irregularities were exposed during the preliminary investigation, the CM added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: It was my proposal to make Eknath Shinde Maha CM: Devendra Fadnavis
text: BJP leader and Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday said, "It was my proposal to make Eknath Shinde the CM..but senior party leaders insisted that government won't run if I stayed out of it, so I accepted the Deputy CM post on their command." He added that it is his responsibility to ensure that Shinde is a successful CM.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP supported us for our 'Hindutva position', development agenda: Maha CM
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has said that the Shiv Sena MLAs who revolted against Uddhav Thackeray's government had taken a "Hindutva position". Shinde said BJP supported them for their Hindutva and agenda of development. "And they (BJP) supported us despite having more numbers, more MLAs," Shinde told ANI, adding that Devendra Fadnavis became Deputy Chief Minister showing a "big heart".
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Talks to convert Delhi into full UT, move will face resistance: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday alleged that the Centre might dissolve the Delhi Assembly and convert the city into a full Union Territory, adding that the move will face stiff resistance from residents. "They (BJP) fear the AAP and that is why they do not want elections. Kejriwal will keep coming and going, Kejriwal is not important," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP could sense growing discontent among Sena MLAs: Fadnavis
text: Deputy CM of Maharashtra Devendra Fadnavis asserted that BJP could sense the growing discontent among the Shiv Sena legislators for the last three to four months. "They were reeling under a lack of leadership. So, we waited for the opportunity and then made our masterstroke," he said. Maharashtra will see new heights of prosperity under CM Eknath Shinde, he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: We'll fight for it, protest & go to court: AIMIM leader on renaming of Aurangabad
text: Days after Maharashtra Cabinet approved renaming of Aurangabad to Sambhaji Nagar, AIMIM leader Imtiaz Jaleel on Tuesday said the residents, whichever religion they may be from, feel connected to the name. "No one wants the name to change. We'll fight for it in any way possible...stage protests, go to court and raise our voice in Parliament," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: We're not doing anything illegal, ours is strong govt: Maha CM Shinde
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said, "We are not doing anything illegal." "There are rules, laws and Constitution and we've to work according to them," he added. Furthermore, he said, "Today, we've more than a 2/3rd majority, so our decision is legal." Shinde added, his government has the support of 170 MLAs and it’s a strong government.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Mahua unfollows TMC on Twitter after party condemns her remark on goddess Kaali
text: TMC leader Mahua Moitra has unfollowed the official Twitter handle of TMC. This comes after the party distanced itself from her remarks on goddess Kaali. "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess," Moitra said. Following her statement, TMC said, "The comments made by [Moitra] and her views…have been made in her personal capacity…AITC strongly condemns such comments."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Biggest proof of honesty: Kejriwal on CAG report showing Delhi govt in profit
text: Speaking about the CAG report which stated that the Delhi government was running in profit, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that the numbers were the "biggest proof of its honesty". "This honesty has deprived our opponents of their sleep," Kejriwal added. The CAG report indicated that Delhi government's revenue receipts were sufficient to meet the revenue expenditure.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Tamil Nadu waiting for an 'Eknath Shinde' to emerge: BJP's Annamalai
text: After rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde-led new government was formed in Maharashtra, BJP's Tamil Nadu President K Annamalai said that Tamil Nadu is also waiting for an 'Eknath Shinde' to emerge. "Just like how...Eknath Shinde sprung up in...Shiv Sena, Tamil Nadu Cabinet headed by DMK leader MK Stalin is also...waiting for an Eknath Shinde to emerge," he said.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP planning to convert Delhi into full UT, scrap polls: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said there are "talks" that the Centre may dissolve Delhi Assembly and convert Delhi into a full Union Territory (UT). "The BJP leaders are now threatening that there will be no next election in Delhi...by making Delhi a full Union Territory (UT)," Kejriwal said. "By hating Kejriwal, you've started hating the country," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Haryana has become stronghold of criminals: Cong's Hooda
text: The law and order situation in Haryana has completely collapsed under the BJP-JJP government and the state has become a stronghold of criminals, Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda said on Tuesday. No one is safe in the state, neither the common man nor an MLA, he said. He added that three MLAs have received threats within a week.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Mithun Chakraborty should apologise to Mamata Banerjee: TMC leader
text: TMC leader Kunal Ghosh criticised actor and BJP leader Mithun Chakraborty and asked him to apologise to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. "When Didi nominated him for Rajya Sabha, he said that he will never forget the gesture of Mamata Banerjee. Then he...backstabbed Didi," Ghosh said. Ghosh's comment came after the BJP leader's visit to Kolkata after a year.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: CAA will be implemented before 2024 Lok Sabha polls: WB BJP chief
text: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar on Tuesday said that the Citizenship (Amendment) Act or CAA will be implemented before the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "BJP has a track record of keeping its promises," Sukanta Majumdar said. "We had promised to build Ram Mandir, we have done it. CAA is our goal and we will achieve it," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP filled with terrorists, it's top 2 afraid of AAP: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal called BJP a party "filled with gundas, hooligans, rapists and terrorists". He noted that a terrorist recently arrested in Jammu and Kashmir was a "senior leader". "If you google 'rapist in BJP', you will find a long list of BJP leaders," he said. He also said that BJP's top two leaders are afraid of AAP.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: TMC should expel Moitra if they don't endorse her remark: BJP's Sukanta
text: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar said that TMC can't detach itself from Mahua Moitra's remark on goddess Kaali. "If TMC actually doesn't endorse it, they should take action and they should either expel her or suspend her from the party for a few days," Majumdar said. On Tuesday, TMC condemned Moitra's "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess" remark.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: When will you ask police to issue lookout notice for Mahua?: BJP MLA to Mamata
text: Following TMC's Mahua Moitra's remark that to her, "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess", BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari asked, "Honourable CM Mamata Banerjee, when will you ask Kolkata Police to issue lookout notice for Mahua Moitra for insulting goddess maa Kaali?" "Why do you and your party leaders reserve all the abusive remarks for Hindu deities?" he asked.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Eknath Shinde backstabbed me: Former Maha CM Uddhav Thackeray
text: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday said Eknath Shinde, who led the rebellion with party MLAs to bring down Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government, backstabbed him. "Shinde to whom I have given the responsibility of the party backstabbed me," Thackeray said. "It's painful to see...those who won due to Sena workers and got everything have left," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: PM Modi calls up Tejashwi Yadav to enquire about Lalu Prasad Yadav's health
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Tejashwi Yadav to enquire about health of RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who fractured his shoulder after falling off stairs on Sunday. "The PM spoke to Tejashwi Yadav on Tuesday and enquired about the health of the RJD supremo. PM wished speedy recovery to RJD chief," RJD spokesperson (Bihar), said.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: YSRCP MLA from Nellore enters drain to protest against sewage issues
text: YSRCP MLA from Nellore, Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy, protested against the officials for not resolving sewage issues in Umma Reddy Gunta by entering into sewage water on Tuesday. He said officials didn't listen to him despite several requests. He demanded the officials to give him in writing, a proper time frame for the work to be completed.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Autorickshaw outpaced Mercedes car: Maha CM Shinde on Uddhav
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday took a jibe at Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray and said that an autorickshaw has outpaced a Mercedes car. Shinde, whose rebellion led to the downfall of the MVA government in Maharashtra, was referred to as an "autorickshaw driver" by some Sena leaders when he was leading the revolt.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Huge scam in Dalit Bandhu beneficiaries' selection: T'gana Cong MP
text: Telangana Congress MP N Uttam Kumar Reddy on Tuesday alleged a huge scam in the Dalit Bandhu scheme and demanded a probe. "More than poor Dalits, the scheme is proving to be an income scheme for TRS leaders," Reddy said. He said many Dalit families were being forced to pay commission for their selection as a beneficiary of the scheme.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Bengal has turned into pile of explosives: LoP Suvendu writes to Amit Shah
text: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari, in a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, on Tuesday said, "The state has turned into a...pile of explosives." Adhikari also demanded an investigation by the National Investigation Agency (NIA) over the "alarming situation in the state". Adhikari claimed a man died when the crude bomb he was making exploded.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Indian Constitution written in a way that can exploit people: Kerala minister
text: Kerala minister Saji Cherian, while addressing a recent political programme, allegedly said, "The Constitution of the country has been written in such a manner that can be used to exploit the maximum number of people." Retired Kerala High Court judge BK Pasha has reportedly sought Cherian's resignation from CM Pinarayi Vijayan. CM Vijayan has asked Cherian to give an explanation.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: TMC condemns MP Mahua's 'Kaali is meat-eating, alcohol-accepting goddess for me' remark
text: Amid controversy over the poster of the documentary film 'Kaali', TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Tuesday said, "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess." TMC distanced itself from her remarks. "The comments made by [Moitra] and her views expressed on Goddess Kali have been made in her personal capacity...All India Trinamool Congress strongly condemns such comments," it tweeted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Confident that Murmu will comfortably win Prez elections: Bihar CM
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Tuesday said he is confident that NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu will comfortably win the election. "It's a matter of happiness that a tribal woman is running for the highest constitutional position of the country," Nitish Kumar said. Droupadi Murmu, who visited Patna, met NDA leaders and sought their support for the upcoming Presidential elections.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Could have become CM had I requested: Maharashtra Deputy CM Fadnavis
text: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday said he could have become the Chief Minister of the state had he requested. "We made Shiv Sena (leader) CM for ideology," he said. Fadnavis added, "It was my proposal to make Eknath Shinde CM, but senior party leaders said the government won't run if I stayed out."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Raj isn't UP or Bihar, won’t be divided in name of Hindu-Muslim: State minister
text: Rajasthan Minister of State for Home, Rajendra Singh Yadav, said that Rajasthan is not UP or Bihar and it won’t be divided in the name of Hindu-Muslim or religion. He was reacting to a question, "Polarisation is rising in Rajasthan and it doesn’t help Congress. What is Congress doing to control it?" the Indian Express stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Why is BJP silent over horrific attacks on Dalits-Adivasis?: Priyanka
text: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticised BJP-ruled states and claimed that atrocities on Dalits and tribals have gone up in these states. "Why has the BJP, which is using the names of Dalits-Adivasis for elections, kept silent about these horrific incidents of attacks on Dalits-Adivasis," she said, citing instances of them being attacked in Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Shiv Sena still hopeful of rebel MLAs' return to party: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that the party is "still hopeful" of the rebel MLAs' return to former CM Uddhav Thackeray's side. "They are our people, will come back. 'Subha ka bhoola agar shaam ko ghar aa jaye to usse bhoola nahi kehte'," he said. "Shiv Sena is Balasaheb Thackeray's. Cannot be anyone else's," he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Hurt by turn of events, but will make Sena stronger: Uddhav
text: Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray has said that he was "hurt" to see some members ditching the party despite getting benefits and will visit Hingoli soon. Thackeray told Sena workers that it was painful to see MLAs and ministers, who won because of Sena workers and got everything (positions in the party) have left him.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Aurangzeb & Akbar responsible for inflation, unemployment: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday criticised the BJP government and said that Aurangzeb and Akbar are responsible for inflation, fuel price hike and unemployment and not PM Narendra Modi. "If children don't have jobs, then emperor Akbar is responsible," he said. "Had Taj Mahal not been built, petrol would have cost just ₹40 per litre," he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Single, low GST rate will ease burden on poor, middle-class: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said a single, low GST rate will reduce compliance costs, prevent the government from "playing favourites" and ease the burden on poor and middle-class families. "GST on health insurance: 18%, GST on hospital room: 5%, GST on diamonds: 1.5%. ‘Gabbar Singh Tax’ is a painful reminder of who the PM cares for," Gandhi tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: U'khand people supported Uniform Civil Code by giving mandate to BJP: Dhami
text: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Tuesday said the people of the state showed support for Uniform Civil Code (UCC) by giving a mandate to the BJP government. "We've formed a committee that is seeking public opinion...consulting stakeholders and will form a draft. We have kept a six-month period for...procedure, once it concludes, we will implement UCC," Dhami added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: HC judge threatened for exposing BJP's corrupt govt in K'taka: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the BJP government for threatening an HC judge with transfer for exposing the party's corrupt government in Karnataka. "Institution after institution is being bulldozed by the BJP. Each of us must stand with those fearlessly doing their duty," Gandhi said, using the hashtag #DaroMat.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Siddaramaiah demands K'taka minister's resignation over PSI recruitment scam
text: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on Tuesday demanded the resignation of state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra over the police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam. "In...PSI recruitment scam, the officials shouldn't be blamed. Home Minister Araga Jnanendra is responsible for this scam as well as officials," Siddaramaiah said. Earlier, former ADGP Amrit Paul was arrested in connection with the case.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Centre playing with future of 6 lakh students of Delhi: Dy CM Sisodia
text: Deputy CM Manish Sisodia accused Centre of playing with the future of six lakh students in Delhi by repeatedly transferring senior officers. "Directors...secretaries of higher and technical education departments have been transferred within two-three months," he said. "No one has been appointed to the post of director of Higher Education for 22 days after transfer of previous director," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Ours is a govt where nobody will be insulted: Maharashtra CM Shinde
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said, "Ours is a government of common people. Ours is a government where nobody will be insulted." "Every community will be respected and taken forward...The state will be taken forward and the process of development will be taken forward," he added. Notably, Shinde-led state government won the floor test in Maharashtra Assembly on Monday.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: 1,349 unlicensed weapons seized ahead of polls for urban bodies in MP
text: Authorities have seized 1,349 unlicensed weapons ahead of polls for urban local bodies in Madhya Pradesh, an official said. More than 2.58 lakh licensed arms holders deposited their weapons at their nearest police stations and preventive action had been taken against over 1.73 lakh persons, the official added. The polls will be held on July 6 and July 13.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Maharashtra cabinet expansion will be done soon: Dy CM Fadnavis
text: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, a day after the Eknath Shinde-led state government won the trust vote in the Assembly, said the state cabinet will be expanded soon. "Let us breathe properly. Devendra Fadnavis and I will sit and discuss cabinet portfolios and their allocation," said CM Shinde after winning the trust vote on Monday.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Cong workers put paper boats on Indore streets to protest against floods
text: Congress workers on Tuesday put paper boats on the waterlogged streets of Indore to protest against flooding concerns after heavy showers. A video of these party workers holding placards with scripted messages for Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan also surfaced online. Notably, urban local body polls will be held in Indore and Bhopal on July 6.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: PM, Shah have assured full support for Maha development: CM Shinde
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah have assured full support for the growth and development of the state. "I am going to undertake a tour of the entire state and allot projects in every constituency. There will be a total transformation of the state," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: I've no fear of arrest, didn't do anything to be afraid of: Swapna Suresh
text: Swapna Suresh, who is the prime accused in the Kerala gold smuggling case,  said, “I have no fear of arrest. I didn’t do anything to be afraid of.” “It’s a fake case. It was initially bailable but was later made non-bailable. Let me face it,” she added. Earlier, Swapna wrote to PM Narendra Modi seeking CBI inquiry in the case.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: We appeal to citizens to recognise hollow nationalism of BJP: Pawan Khera
text: Congress' Pawan Khera said, "We appeal to the citizens to recognise hollow nationalism of BJP." Furthermore, Khera said, "BJP party had provided a ticket to Masood Azhar’s disciple Mohammad Farooq Khan from Srinagar’s ward number 33 in a regional election. Nupur Sharma is from your party…How many fringe elements have you been cradling to remain in mainstream?"
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Will work round the clock to make Maha number 1 state: Fadnavis
text: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis held a road-show in Nagpur on Tuesday. During the road-show he said, "We'll work round the clock to make Maharashtra the number one state in [India]." "We'll [Eknath Shinde-led state government] not only complete these 2.5 years in power, but will also form a government with a majority for the next five years," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: It was black day for country when Satyendar Jain was arrested: Kejriwal
text: People say Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain, who was arrested by ED in a money laundering case, is honest, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Tuesday. "I think it was a black day for the country when Satyendar Jain, who gave not only this country but entire world the concept of mohalla clinic, was picked up and arrested," Kejriwal added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Nation wouldn't be in turmoil had PM, Shah appealed for peace: Baghel
text: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel criticised the Centre over Nupur Sharma's comments, asserting that turmoil across the country could be avoided if PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah appealed for peace. He also took a jibe at BJP-ruled states and said that there haven't been proceedings in a single state where BJP was in power.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: He humiliated the Constitution: MoS MEA on Kerala Minister's remarks
text: Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan criticised Kerala Minister Saji Cheriyan over his comments regarding the Indian Constitution, calling it an anti-national statement. "Kerala Minister Saji Cheriyan humiliated the Indian constitution in his speech," Muraleedharan said. Cheriyan allegedly said that Indian Constitution is written in a manner that can be used to exploit people.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Uddhav Thackeray, Sanjay Raut not accepting reality: Kirit Somaiya
text: As Shiv Sena's Uddhav Thackeray and Sanjay Raut continued to criticise the newly-elected Eknath Shinde-led government, BJP leader Kirit Somaiya condemned them, saying they are not accepting the reality. "Thackeray needs to introspect now. Raut is accusing BJP of betraying them, rather he betrayed us by taking votes in the name of PM Modi in the 2019 elections," Somaiya said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Aaditya Thackeray confronts rebel MLA, says 'didn't expect this', video surfaces
text: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray confronted rebel party MLA Prakash Surve for joining Eknath Shinde camp. In a video shared by Times Now, Thackeray can be seen talking to Surve. "I thought you were coming back to us...You were with us...This was not expected of you...There was so much love for you from all of us...I personally...felt bad," Thackeray said.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Don't make us seek an independent Tamil Nadu: DMK's A Raja
text: DMK MP A Raja on Monday demanded that Centre should grant 'state autonomy' to Tamil Nadu and not push party to seek an independent country. Raja, who made these remarks while addressing party's local body representatives in Namakkal, said that DMK won't rest until demand is fulfilled. Meanwhile, fellow party leader TKS Elangovan said that Raja made comments in "frustration".
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Religious sentiments shouldn't be hurt: Nusrat on 'Kaali' poster
text: Actress-MP Nusrat Jahan spoke about the poster of Leena Manimekalai's documentary 'Kaali', saying that religious sentiments should not be hurt. The poster shows a woman dressed as the goddess smoking a cigarette with a pride flag backdrop. "Let's not pull religion...and make it saleable...If you're coming up with something creative...take responsibility for your own actions as well," Nusrat said.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: When CM Yogi can establish peace in UP, why can’t Gehlot?: Ex-Rajasthan CM
text: Following the Udaipur murder incident, former Rajasthan Chief Minister Vasundhara Raje on Monday said a sense of fear and insecurity has arisen in the state which should be eliminated. "When Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath can establish peace in Uttar Pradesh by eliminating any atmosphere of terror, why can Ashok Gehlot not do it here?" Raje asked.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: NC, PDP to jointly fight J&K elections
text: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference (NC) and the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) on Monday announced that they will jointly contest the Assembly elections. PDP President Mehbooba Mufti said, "We intend to contest the elections together as it is the will of the people that we should strive together for the restoration of our lost dignity."
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Top Congress leaders discuss strategy for upcoming Gujarat polls
text: Congress leaders met on Monday to discuss the party's strategy for this year's Gujarat Assembly elections. According to PTI, the party finalised a strategy during the four-hour-long meet and decided to raise the issues of Dalits, tribals and farmers during their poll campaign. The meet was attended by several leaders including Priyanka Gandhi, Ajay Maken, P Chidambaram and Randeep Surjewala.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Delhi BJP leader Kapil Mishra claims receiving death threat via email
text: Delhi BJP leader Kapil Mishra on Monday claimed that he received a death threat through email. In a tweet, Mishra shared a screenshot of the email that read, "Terrorist Kapil Mishra you will not be allowed to live long." Mishra further wrote that he isn't scared of such threats, adding, "Our campaign to help...families of victims of Jihadist violence...will continue...aggressively."
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Confident of winning 100 seats if mid-term polls held in Maha: Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that his party is confident of winning 100 seats if mid-term polls are conducted in Maharashtra. "Shiv Sena is Balasaheb Thackeray's. Cannot be anyone else's. You cannot hijack it through money," Raut added. Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that the rebel MLAs were not only given money but also "something else", Raut said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Tripura CM Manik Saha to take oath as MLA on July 8
text: Tripura CM Manik Saha will take oath as MLA on July 8, Tripura Assembly speaker said on Monday. He added that Saha met Rajya Sabha chairman and Vice President, M Venkaiah Naidu, to tender his resignation as Rajya Sabha MP on Monday. Saha had won the by-election from Town Bardowali assembly seat, after assuming office as CM on May 14.
author: Mayukh Debnath

headlines: Nupur Sharma row a conspiracy by BJP to further its divisive policy: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday alleged that the "Nupur Sharma controversy was a conspiracy by the BJP to further its divisive policy". "Why was she not arrested? Arrest her because you cannot play with fire," Mamata added. She said that the country's global image has been affected due to suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Mohammed.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Will visit Guj every week, address issues: Kejriwal ahead of polls
text: Ahead of Assembly elections in Gujarat, AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that he will visit the state every week and discuss various issues with residents. Kejriwal made these remarks at a meeting organised on the issue of electricity in Gujarat. He added that the state will get free electricity up to 200 units if AAP is elected.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Now ED's target won't be Maha but other states like Chhattisgarh: Baghel
text: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said that now target of central agencies like ED and CBI won't be Maharashtra but they all will become active in Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, West Bengal, Rajasthan or southern states. "In the last eight years of the Modi govt, there haven't been proceedings on a single BJP-ruled state. This is a misuse of government agencies," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Remove criminals from politics: Allahabad HC to Parliament, ECI
text: The Lucknow bench of Allahabad High Court has asked the Parliament and the Election Commission of India (ECI) to take steps to "remove criminals from politics" and break "unholy alliance" between organised crime, politicians and bureaucrats. "No one can dispute that the present-day politics is caught in crime, identity, patronage, muscle and money network," the bench said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Centre should release white paper on employment: T'gana minister
text: Telangana Finance Minister T Harish Rao on Monday asked Centre to release a white paper on filling two crore jobs every year. "BJP...promised to offer two crore jobs every year and in eight years, 16 crore jobs had to be offered but...central government failed," Rao said. On the other hand, Telangana government has filled about 1.35 lakh posts, he added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Undemocratic, unethical: Mamata on Eknath Shinde govt in Maharashtra
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the newly formed Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government and called it "undemocratic" and "unethical". "His government will also not run for long. The BJP uses money power and muscle power along with agencies to go against electoral mandates," Mamata added. They might have formed government, but they have not won people's hearts, Mamata further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Karnataka Cong MLA's offices, houses raided by ACB in Bengaluru
text: Multiple Bengaluru-based properties linked to Karnataka Congress MLA BZ Zameer Ahmed Khan are being raided by the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Tuesday. Khan was also booked by the ACB in the disproportionate assets case. Raids are being conducted at Khan's two offices and three residences which are located in areas including Sadashiva Nagar, Banashankari, Kalasipalya and Bengaluru Cantonment.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Will work for the party again: BJP's Mithun Chakraborty in Kolkata
text: Actor-turned-politician Mithun Chakraborty announced his comeback in active politics before 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "I was inactive for some time because of health reasons. But I am fit now. So, I came to Kolkata today," the BJP leader said. "I will work on specific assignments given to me by party leadership, which I am unable to disclose now," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Single, low tax rate will reduce burden on poor people: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the government over GST rates and asserted that a low tax rate will help reduce the burden on the poor and the middle class. "GST on Health Insurance: 18%. GST on Hospital Room: 5%. GST on Diamonds: 1.5%. 'Gabbar Singh Tax' is a painful reminder of who the PM cares for," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Sinha vows he won't be 'rubber stamp' Prez, urges Murmu to do same
text: Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Monday tweeted that he pledges to be an "impartial custodian" of the Constitution and not a "silent or rubber stamp" President. He also urged BJP-led NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu to make the same pledge. "To ensure a better future for all Indians, the Rashtrapati (President) must work conscientiously," he said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: BJP uses criminal elements for its own propaganda: Mehbooba Mufti
text: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti alleged that the BJP is using criminal elements to perpetuate its propaganda of "communal division and hatred." Referring to media reports claiming that the murderer of the Udaipur tailor, and an LeT terrorist arrested from Jammu had links to the BJP, she said that had these been associated with Opposition leaders, multiple FIRs would be filed.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Was suppressed for long time; won't resort to vendetta politics: Shinde
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Monday said that the rebellion led by him was a fallout of the unfair treatment meted out to him, but added that he won't resort to vendetta politics. "I alone had closed down 16 ladies' bars in and around Thane. There are some 100 various criminal charges registered against me," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Dead man wins sarpanch polls in MP, authorities look for solution
text: A deceased man has won sarpanch elections in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district. The man, Ravindra Thakur, passed away due to cardiac arrest on June 22, but his name appeared on ballot papers for July 1 polls as authorities weren't informed, an official said. "We've sought the opinion of the state election commission," Sagar Collector Deepak Arya said.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Disqualification notices sent to Uddhav camp's MLAs except Aaditya Thackeray
text: Shiv Sena chief whip Bharat Gogawale of Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's camp on Monday said they have sent disqualification notices to all the MLAs of the Uddhav Thackeray faction for defying their whip during the floor test. However, Gogawale said they haven't sent notice to Aaditya Thackeray due to their respect for Balasaheb Thackeray.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: We are not traitors, we revolted: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Monday said, "We are not traitors, we revolted (against the leadership) because of what was happening." "The one who orchestrated everything is here," Shinde said, pointing to Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis. "I didn’t force anyone to come with me. Nobody put a gun to anyone’s head," Shinde stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Not here to protect anyone: Karnataka CM Bommai to Congress
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai criticised Congress alleging that the party used to protect criminals when it was in power in the state. Speaking about the arrests of ADGP Amrit Paul and IAS officer J Manjunath, Bommai said that the accused would have been covered up if the Congress was in power. "We're not here to protect anyone," Bommai further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Stolen majority: Shiv Sena after Maharashtra CM Shinde wins trust vote
text: A day after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led government proved its majority in the Assembly by surpassing the majority mark of 144, Shiv Sena termed it a "stolen majority". "BJP and Shinde faction got vote of confidence...This is a stolen majority. This is not the belief of 11 crore people of Maharashtra," Shiv Sena said in its mouthpiece 'Saamana'.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: NCP's Ajit Pawar to be Leader of Opposition in Maharashtra Assembly
text: Former Maharashtra Deputy CM and NCP leader Ajit Pawar will be the new Leader of Opposition in the state Assembly. As per reports, the decision was proposed by NCP Legislative party leader Jayant Patil and approved by the Assembly. Earlier on Monday, CM Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government passed the floor test after surpassing the majority mark of 144.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Delhi Assembly passes bills to hike salaries of its members by 66%
text: The Delhi Assembly on Monday passed bills proposing 66.67% hike in salaries and allowances of its members. "For Delhi MLAs, salary and allowances are being increased from ₹54,000 per month to ₹90,000," Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. "To invite talented people into politics, there has to be rewards," he added. The bills will be sent to the President for approval.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Who are the 5 new ministers in CM Bhagwant Mann's expanded Cabinet?
text: Five MLAs were sworn in as ministers in Punjab on Monday as Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann expanded his Cabinet for the first time after forming government in the state. The legislators who took oath are Aman Arora, Dr Inderbir Singh Nijjar, Fauja Singh Sarari, Chetan Singh Jouramajra and Anmol Gagan Mann. The Cabinet now has 15 ministers, including the CM.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: SC to hear Uddhav faction's plea against Speaker's decision on party whip
text: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear a plea by former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's faction against the Assembly Speaker Rahul Narwekar's decision to recognise Shiv Sena's new whip. The matter will be heard on July 11, after the court's summer break. "The Speaker has no jurisdiction to recognise whips," said senior advocate Abhishek Singhvi, representing the Thackeray group.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Would've sat at home had the BJP told me to: Maha Deputy CM Fadnavis
text: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said he would have sat at home if Bharatiya Janata Party had told him to do so. "[It is] same party that made me Chief Minister...Today I tell you that there will never be a tussle for power in this govt...People taunt...it's an ED government...it's an ED government, government of Eknath Devendra," he added.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Bharat Gogawale gives petition to suspend 16 MLAs of Uddhav Thackeray faction
text: The chief whip of Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde faction, Bharat Gogawale, has given a petition to Maharashtra Assembly Speaker for suspension of 16 MLAs of the Uddhav Thackeray faction. News agency ANI said the Speaker's office has confirmed that the notice will be issued to 16 MLAs of Shiv Sena for the violation of whip.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: BJP denies links with Lashkar terrorist after saying he was in Jammu unit's IT cell
text: J&K BJP chief Ravinder Raina has denied that the party had any links with captured Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist Talib Hussain. This came after a BJP Minority Morcha order appointed Hussain as Jammu unit's IT and social media in-charge and the Minority Morcha chief confirmed his past association with BJP. "He doesn't have any membership in [party's] official records," said Raina.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Decisions taken in MVA govt's last cabinet meet will be upheld: Fadnavis
text: The newly-formed Maharashtra government, led by CM Eknath Shinde, will uphold the previous government's decision to rename Aurangabad and Osmanabad, as well as the upcoming Navi Mumbai International Airport, deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis announced on Monday. "We will take a cabinet meet and reaffirm the renaming of cities decided by the last cabinet meet of the previous government," he added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Court issues bailable warrant against Raut in ₹100 crore defamation case
text: A court in Mumbai on Monday issued a bailable warrant against Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut in a defamation case of ₹100 crore filed by BJP leader Kirit Somaiya's wife. The warrant was issued after Raut failed to appear before court. Earlier, Raut had claimed that Somaiya and his wife were involved in a public toilets scam worth ₹100 crore.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: 22 MLAs remained absent during Maharashtra floor test process
text: A total of 22 MLAs remained absent during the process of floor test in Maharashtra Assembly on Monday. The list of absent MLAs includes 10 Congress MLAs - Jitesh Antapurkar, Zeeshan Siddique, Praniti Shinde, Ashok Chavan, Vijay Wadettiwar, Dhiraj Deshmukh, Kunal Patil, Raju Awale, Mohanrao Hambarde and Shirish Chaudhari. Eknath Shinde won the floor test with 164-99 margin.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: UP can lead country ahead: CM Yogi on completing 100 days of 2nd term
text: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said that his government has worked to change UP’s image of "hooliganism and crime", with foreign investment subsequently rising. "UP is the biggest state in the country and can lead the country ahead," CM Yogi added. His statement came on the completion of 100 days of his government's second term.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 10,000 became unemployed; 200 died in Char Dham: Rawat on BJP govt's 100 days
text: Former Uttarakhand CM Harish Rawat has commented on the completion of 100 days of the BJP-run Uttarakhand government. "In the last 100 days, at least 10,000 youths have joined the list of the unemployed. Over 200 persons died during the Char Dham Yatra [this year]," Rawat said. The Congress leader added that the Centre's Agnipath scheme is a "fraud".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Had once said that I'll come back, several people mocked me: Fadnavis
text: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Monday said, "I had once said that I'll come back but when I said that, several people mocked me." "I've come back today and brought him (Eknath Shinde) along with me. I won't take revenge on people who mocked me. I'll forgive them. Everything isn't taken to heart in politics,"  Fadnavis added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 2 BJP MPs booked in Chhattisgarh for sharing fake video of Rahul
text: BJP MPs Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore and Subrat Pathak were booked in Chhattisgarh for allegedly sharing a fake video of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi. "Original video was...Rahul's...comment on...SFI violence on his Wayanad office but it was...doctored to appear as if it was a comment on...Udaipur [murder]," Congress' Jairam Ramesh said. FIRs against the MPs have also been filed in other states.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Who benefitted from Kanhaiya Lal’s murder? BJP: Mehbooba Mufti
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said BJP provides support and patronage to criminal elements and uses them for their benefit and propaganda. "When Kanhaiya Lal was murdered (in Udaipur), Hindus and Muslims went against each other. Who benefitted? BJP," Mufti added. "Questions are raised on Pulwama attack…How did the attack take place? Who benefitted from it? BJP," she stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Feeling Adivasi woman can't become Prez depicts 'nasty mindset': BJP
text: BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi on Monday criticised opposition candidate for Presidential polls, Yashwant Sinha, saying a feeling that an Adivasi woman is not capable of the position, depicts one's "nasty mindset". Murmu has already proved her capabilities, as the Governor of Jharkhand, as a minister and MLA in Odisha and as a lecturer in a college, he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: New Maha govt won't last long, many contradictions in it: Cong leader
text: Congress leader HK Patil on Monday said that the newly-formed Maharashtra government under CM Eknath Shinde "won't last long" as there are too many "contradictions" in it. "Shiv Sena MLAs are restless. The way they have travelled so much shows they are not united," he added. Patil stated that Congress will remain a part of Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA).
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Shinde faction cannot claim to be original Shiv Sena: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that the faction led by Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde cannot claim to be original Shiv Sena. The "Thackeray name is synonymous with Shiv Sena," the Rajya Sabha member said. "They used the party symbol and all benefits that come along with it to win election, and then broke the same party," Raut further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Will provide free electricity upto 300 units in Gujarat if elected: Kejriwal
text: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said that his party will make electricity free upto 300 units in Gujarat just like it did in Punjab, if voted to power. "In Gujarat, ministers are enjoying because their electricity bill comes to zero despite consuming thousands of units but a poor has to pay thousands for just a fan and bulb," he said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Reports stating Cong likely to pull out of MVA alliance are false: HK Patil
text: Following the political development in state, Maharashtra Congress in-charge HK Patil on Monday said the MVA alliance is stable. “I saw some reports stating Congress is likely to pull out of the MVA alliance in Maharashtra. They are false,” Patil added. “Congress has neither discussed this nor decided on anything. The rumours are far away from the truth,” he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP could’ve made Scindia CM, Shivraj Chouhan Deputy CM: Digvijaya
text: Following the political development in Maharashtra, Congress’ Digvijaya Singh said the BJP does "great injustice". "After Eknath Shinde revolted, he was made Chief Minister and Devendra Fadnavis, Deputy Chief Minister. In Madhya Pradesh, too, they could’ve made Scindia Chief Minister and Shivraj Singh Chouhan, Deputy Chief Minister," Singh tweeted. "This is sheer hypocrisy," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Hoarding with KCR's questions to PM Modi put up in Hyderabad
text: A hoarding showing Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao's questions to PM Narendra Modi was put up at Diamond Point Road near Parade Ground in Hyderabad. With a hashtag #ModiMustAnswer, KCR was shown questioning the PM on death of farmers during farm law protests and that of migrants during lockdown, promise to bring black money and privatisation of PSUs.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: PM secures future of friends abroad, leaves youth here jobless: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday alleged that PM Narendra Modi secures futures of friends abroad, but leaves the youth of India unemployed. Rahul also shared a video of young men who had taken the exam for recruitment as police personnel in the Central paramilitary forces walking on the streets in protest because they never got the results.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: SC to hear plea on AIADMK leadership row on July 6
text: The Supreme Court will hear a plea by former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on July 6. The plea challenges a Madras High Court order staying the passing of resolutions in AIADMK General Council Meeting. The plea will be heard subject to clearance from Chief Justice NV Ramana, vacation bench of Justices Indira Banerjee and JK Maheshwari said.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Amit Shah spoke like broken gramophone at BJP event: T'gana minister
text: Telangana Finance Minister T Harish Rao on Monday said that Union Home Minister Amit Shah spoke like a "broken gramophone" at BJP's recently-held national executive meeting in Hyderabad. "[BJP leaders] spoke about nothing except getting into power...It was disappointing that they didn't talk about any new welfare development," Rao added. Assembly elections in Telangana will be held in 2023.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Will take action as a dictator to tackle malpractices: Tamil Nadu CM
text: Addressing a party meeting of urban local body representatives, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said that people close to him say that he is acting in a "very democratic way" but anyone doing anything isn't democratic. "I'll take action as a dictator if malpractices arise. This isn't only for local body representatives but for all," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: We'll go to villages, find other workers: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut
text: Following the political development in Maharashtra, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Monday said the party won’t weaken. "Our oxygen isn’t power…This (BJP and Eknath Shinde faction alliance) is a temporary arrangement," Raut added. "People come and go. They opted to join our party and left due to outside forces. We'll go to villages...find other workers," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde wins trust vote
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde-led state government proved its majority in the Assembly on Monday as it surpassed the majority mark of 144. It comes a day after BJP's Rahul Narwekar was elected as the Assembly Speaker. Notably, Narwekar reinstated CM Eknath Shinde as Shiv Sena legislature party leader.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Rahul Gandhi stops car, helps man injured in road accident in Kerala; video surfaces
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi recently helped a man injured in road accident in Kerala's Wayanad, a video of which has surfaced online. Rahul stopped his car on seeing the injured man and helped in taking him to a hospital in his convoy's ambulance. The video shows him helping with the stretcher while the man was being taken to the ambulance.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Goenka shares pic with 'lookalike' Maharashtra CM, says 'My security can be a nuisance'
text: RPG Enterprises' Chairman Harsh Goenka on Sunday tweeted a photo of himself with Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde while referring to the similarities in their appearance. Goenka tweeted, "To those who come to meet me, sorry for any [inconvenience]. I know my Z+ security can be a nuisance. Look forward to your support. Jai Maharashtra!"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Maha Speaker reinstates Eknath Shinde as Shiv Sena legislature party leader
text: Maharashtra Assembly Speaker, Rahul Narwekar, has reinstated state Chief Minister Eknath Shinde as Shiv Sena legislative party leader. The Speaker has also reinstated Bharat Gogawale as the party's Chief Whip. News Agency ANI reported that appointment of Ajay Chaudhary as legislative party leader has been set aside by the Speaker.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Will prove majority with 166 votes in tomorrow's floor test: Maha Deputy CM
text: Ahead of the newly-formed Maharashtra government's floor test in the Assembly on Monday, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said, "We will prove our majority with 166 votes in tomorrow's vote of confidence." "The youngest Speaker candidate won the Speaker election with 164 votes today as 2 MLAs couldn't come due to health issues," Fadnavis added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Why don’t you rename Ahmedabad to Adanibad?: KTR on BJP’s demand to rename Hyd
text: After BJP leader and ex-Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das said Hyderabad’s name will be changed to Bhagyanagar if BJP comes to power in Telangana, TRS leader KT Rama Rao asked, "Why don’t you change Ahmedabad’s name to Adanibad first?" Meanwhile, speaking about BJP’s national executive meet, BJP’s Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "PM Modi said that Hyderabad is Bhagyanagar."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP govt in K'taka trying to communalise school curriculum: Sinha
text: The opposition candidate for the Presidential polls, Yashwant Sinha, on Sunday said that the BJP government in Karnataka was attempting to communalise the school curriculum in the state. He accused the Central government of launching repeated assaults on democracy and secularism. He added that the Centre has "unleashed poisonous communal propaganda to divide India's multi-religious society".
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Will restrain Centre from destabilising Oppn state govts: Sinha
text: The Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha has said that he won't hesitate to restrain Centre if it "aids and abets" the destabilisation of state governments run by Opposition parties. "I have declared that I shall speak out against any attempts aimed at communal polarisation...I have also announced that I shall work for the repeal of the sedition law," Sinha added.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: PM Modi, Shah’s decision to make me CM opened eyes of many: Eknath Shinde
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Sunday said that the decision of PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah to make him the Chief Minister despite having more members than his side "has opened the eyes of many". "Everyone knows that Devendra Fadnavis had 115 members with him. I had only 50," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: AAP expanding in Guj, people tired of 27 yrs of BJP: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that AAP is expanding on a huge scale in Gujarat, adding that the people of the state are tired of 27 years of the BJP. "BJP thinks Congress can't replace them, so they've developed ego. People are looking with hope towards AAP this time," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP govt's policy is Gandhi in abroad & Godse in India: Yechury
text: CPI(M)'s Sitaram Yechury has criticised Centre for dismissing a US panel's recent report on religious freedom in India. "Policy of BJP government is Gandhi in abroad and Godse in...[India]...On one hand, [they] want to tell everyone that we have...democracy...and on the other, they're crushing...democratic rights inside [India]," he said. Panel had termed India a "country of particular concern".
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP MP asks Raj CM to get mental treatment after nikamma remark for Minister
text: BJP MP Ashok Bajpai took a jibe at Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot for calling Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat "nikamma", saying that the CM should get mental treatment. He added that the CM's old age is visible in his conduct, adding that Shekhawat has worked hard to provide tap water in a short period of time.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Telangana govt has become a symbol of corruption: Piyush Goyal
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said that the Telangana government has become a symbol of corruption, adding that the state's residents want a change. Goyal further stated that members from the same family hold key positions in the state government. His remarks came on the second day of the BJP's national executive meet, which was held in Secunderabad.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Accepting Deputy CM post must be a 'real shocker' for Fadnavis: Shiv Sena
text: In an editorial of its mouthpiece 'Saamana', Shiv Sena has said that accepting the Deputy CM post must have been a "real shocker" for BJP's Devendra Fadnavis. "...The climax at the Raj Bhavan was the most shocking part...Fadnavis accepted the [Deputy CM] post as the party leadership's order. But now being said...that Fadnavis showed a big heart," the editorial said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Shinde govt may fall in next 6 months, be prepared for mid-term polls: Pawar
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that the newly formed Eknath Shinde-led government in Maharashtra is likely to fall in the next six months and everyone should be prepared for mid-term elections in the state. He further added that many rebel MLAs are not happy with the current arrangement and once the ministerial portfolios are distributed, their unrest will come out.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Lost states because of BJP's superior money power: Cong's Abhishek Singhvi
text: Congress leader Abhishek Singhvi said the party lost some states because of the "climate of fear", successfully created by the PM Narendra Modi-led government by misusing central agencies. On being asked, from Karnataka to Maharashtra, non-BJP parties have not been able to retain power in many states, Singhvi said, "Yes, we've lost these states because of BJP's superior money power."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: We should be prepared for people speaking against us: Fadnavis
text: Soon after the Eknath Shinde-led government proved its majority in Maharashtra Assembly, the state's Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that everyone should be prepared to listen to adversary's voices in politics. "We've seen that people were jailed for making statements...We should be prepared for people speaking against us. We should respond to criticism but in a proper way," he said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP will resolve all problems of Northeast by 2024: Amit Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that BJP has found a permanent address to the issues in the Northeastern states. Speaking at the BJP national executive meet in Hyderabad, Shah said that all problems of the Northeast will be resolved by 2024 and the region will face no issues in the coming times.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Terrorism is raging because of Congress party: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said that terrorism is raging because of the Congress party. "In Udaipur, there was recently a killing in broad daylight. We will crush terrorism. We will run bulldozers over the miscreants," Chouhan added. Furthermore, Chouhan said that Congress is a party of "polarisation" and the country lost its respect under their rule.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Neither yours nor for your son, it’s BJP’s turn: Shah to KCR on T'gana CM post
text: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah on Sunday said as the country moves forward, Telangana is lagging behind. "KCR (Telangana CM) doesn't care about your source of livelihood…He just wants to make his son CM. KCR, the next turn is neither yours nor for your son. The next turn is meant for the BJP," Shah said in Hyderabad.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: JD(U), BJP in search of their own Eknath Shinde: Chirag Paswan
text: Lok Janshakti Party’s (LJP) Chirag Paswan said that the JD(U) and its ally BJP were in search of "their own Eknath Shinde", in Bihar. Furthermore, Paswan said that the two parties are in alliance “just for the sake of power”. "Both are trying to pull the ally down," he added while addressing a press conference.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Akhilesh like Mughal emperors who oppressed kin for power: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Dinesh Lal Yadav on Sunday likened SP chief Akhilesh Yadav to the Mughal emperors, who he said oppressed their kin for the sake of power. "Reawakened Muslim and Yadav voters after 2014 have shattered the hope of the SP, which used to claim a monopoly over them," he said. SP is turning into a "samaptwadi party," he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: KCR has no care for unemployment, only wants his son to be CM: Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao has no concern for the unemployed youth and only wants his son to be the CM of the state. Shah added he doesn't care about the people's source of livelihood, adding that the next term is reserved neither for his son nor him, but for BJP.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Half genuine, half sponsored: Fadnavis on protests against Aarey car shed
text: The newly elected Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that the issue created around shifting Metro-3 car shed project back to Aarey is "half genuine and half sponsored" and added that it was "only solution to Mumbai's congestion". "Work was paused after 25% of it had been completed. The cost has already been escalated by ₹10,000 crore," Fadnavis further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Next 30-40 years to be era of BJP: Union Home Minister Amit Shah
text: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah said that the next 30-40 years will be the era of his party and India will become a “vishwa guru” (world leader). Furthermore, Shah, during the BJP's national executive meeting, said “dynastic politics, casteism and politics of appeasement” were the “greatest sins” and the reasons behind the country’s sufferings over the years.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Rebel MLAs were unable to look us in the eye: Aaditya Thackeray
text: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said that rebel MLAs, who returned to Mumbai from Goa, were unable to look Shiv Sena in the eye. "How long are you going to move from one hotel to the other? These MLAs will have to go to their Assembly constituencies one day. How will they face the people then?" he asked.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Congress in Gujarat exists only on paper: Arvind Kejriwal
text: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said Congress party in Gujarat largely exists only on paper. "The office-bearers of AAP have to ensure that not a single vote is cast for Congress in Assembly elections," Kejriwal added. "We'll have our booth level organisation in place next month. By then, we'll have built an organisation bigger than BJP in Gujarat," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma
